I called last week and made an appointment for today at 2:30 to renew my Chilean Passport.
I drove all the way from Belconnen (during my working hours), I got there at 2:25, waited until 2:50 just to be told by this guy to come back during the week because the Secretary had called in sick!. And that if I really wanted it done today that I would have to wait for an hour for him "to finish whatever he was doing in his office at the back". Like if I have time to waste like them!! 
This is a joke!! I mean, what's the point of making appointments for if they are not going to take you seriously. They did not even bother to call me to let me know, very professional!!

La semana pasada llame para pedir cita para hoy a las 2:30 para renovar mi Passaporte Chileno, maneje desde Belconnen (durante mis horas de trabajo), llegue ahi a las 2:25, espere hasta las 2:50 cuando me dice este tipo, que trabaja ahi que iba a tener que volver durante la semana por que la secretaria no fue a trabajar hoy, y que si realmente necesitaba este papeleo para hoy que iba a tener esperar como una hora a que el "terminara lo que estaba haciendo atras en su oficina". Como si tubiese todo el tiempo del mundo como ellos!!
Se pasan!!, Yo digo, para que le hacen a uno pedir cita y eso si no te van a tomar en serio!!
Ni si quiera se molestan en avisar!!, SUPER PROFESIONAL!

Sent an overnight prepaid mail and still crossing my fingers that I'll get my damn passport one day! Ahlil...
PS: After 8 months dealing with my passport I discovered that you have more chances to get them on the phone if you press 7 for arabic. Just a tip... Good Luck people!

Update: A person from the embassy calls me And says that I was a shame for Algeria because I'm posting reviews online and that I'm racist for the "press 7 for Arabic" part of my review lol.
To whoever called, because you didn't given me a chance to talk, here is my answer:
1- The only thing I could think of when I noticed that you guys answer faster when we press 7 is that the lines are less busy when you select Arabic service (maybe because most customers select English language) That's all!
2- I had no other intentions, by giving my review, than to give my opinion about your institution and try to help future customers to have a good experience than I did. (This is what online reviews are all about)
3- You do not have the right to call people and tell them that they shouldn't put negative reviews because they will give a bad image of their country to the world. Lol. It's just weird! 
3- If you are that concerned about the image of your country, use your time to work harder not to read reviews online and call people to yell at them.
Peace!

reviews.text: The customer service provided by this office is very poor.  I have tried dealing directly with this office via phone and email.  Neither has resulted in any form of response.  I have learnt to direct my enquiries to other consulates.  This approach has been far more successful.  How disappointing that this is the level of service you are greeted with by such an establishment.  Very unprofessional.

The menu was clear and the options comprehensive, but there was no way to speak to a human if your problem was catered for. I need to return to the UK to attend my citizenship ceremony, but I can't obtain a Visa. My second family visit visa is continually refused because of concerns I would seek to stay in the UK for extended periods through frequent and subsequent visits. They just don't seem to understand that the UK Home Office has seen fit to offer me citizenship (British mother born before 1983) and that once I take the oath I won't need a visa. Classic catch 22 - you can't go because you might stay, but if you do go you'll become British so you can stay.

Me (an EU/British Citizen) & my wife (a Peruvian Citizen) visited The Spanish Consulate to apply for a Schengen Visa for her when we will be flying to Ireland in June via Madrid, anyway they refused to accept our Peruvian marriage certificate (which has an apostille) it doesn't need to be translated as it is already in Spanish, but they told my wife that for them to accept it I would need to register our marriage with the British government, get a certificate from the British embassy here in Lima & then get it officially translated into Spanish! apart from all this being a pain we can do without, The British government no longer accepts foreign marriage registrations! 

So basically the Spanish Embassy here in Peru won't issue my wife a Schengen Visa! as according to them the Spanish government can't & won't accept our marriage certificate even with an apostille! as the Spanish government doesn't recognize marriages here in Peru (even though Spain has meant to have a mutual agreement with Peru & all the other Latin American countries & Spain is also listed as one the members for Hauge Convention & accepts Apostilles!)

My wife even quoted them From the Directive 2004/38/EC, Article 5.2 (Right of Entry relating to non EU Family members)

Family members who are not nationals of a Member State shall only be required to have an entry visa in accordance with Regulation (EC) No539/2001 or, where appropriate, with national law. For the purposes of this Directive, possession of the valid residence card referred to in Article 10 shall exempt such family members from the visa requirement.

MemberStates shall grant such persons every facility to obtain the necessary visas. Such visas shall be issued free of charge as soon as possible and on the basis of an accelerated procedure.

their response to this was they have their own rules & that EU Law has nothing to do with them! (Spain is an EU country so they do have to follow the rules set out by the European Union)

They also warned my wife if she flies to Madrid without a Schengen Visa the Spanish authorities will deport her back to Peru regardless of the fact she has a valid Irish Visa! (which the Irish embassy had no issues accepting our marriage certificate with the Hauge Convention Apostille stamp on it)

I have since made a complaint to the European Commission regarding the Spanish Embassy here in Lima refusing to accept our marriage certificate with an Hauge Convention Apostille & denying my wife her rights to be issued this visa as the family member of an EU Citizen!

I have since received an email from Your Europe Advice in reply to my complaint saying this:

Dear Mr. Thompson, 

Thank you for your enquiry to the Your Europe Advice service. 
It is not necessary that you register your marriage with the British authorities. The Spanish authorities appear to be in breach of EU law in insisting that you should register your marriage in the UK. Marriages validly contracted anywhere in the world must be in principle recognized under EU law and for the purpose of entry into Member States of the EU for the purpose of Directive 2004/38/EC. 
You are correct that as the wife of a British national, your wife s visa should be granted to her without charge or delay or formality (Article 5(2), Directive 2004/38/EC). 
Even if your wife were to fly to Madrid without a visa, she should not automatically be deported to Peru but should be given the opportunity to prove her right to enter Spain with you pursuant to Article 5(4), Directive 2004/38/EC although this is a route we would not recommend. 

Further to the reply to your enquiry and following your agreement on the enquiry form your case was forwarded to SOLVIT. This is an on-line problem solving network in which EU Member States work together to solve without legal proceedings problems caused by the misapplication of EU law by public authorities.

I also reported the matter to The European Commission so I am optimistic they will solve this error on the Spanish Consulate here in Lima's part...

When I came here to get my Visa to visit Angola, the people behind the glass were so nice in helping me fill out the form, telling me the documents that I needed and even when I didn't have some stuff printed out they printed it for me. The service in this place I would say is superb. 

The decor of the office is a nice timeless look. You walk in the glass doors which has the Angolan decal beautifully inserted on the glass. There are nice comfy chairs to start on while watching and a pretty view outside of the window to look at while waiting!
SLOW......   Get there early if you want to get out of there at a reasonable hour.  People compete to get there early so they don't have to stand around half the day.

Good service and friendly personnel, props to them for making my visa request stress free and quick. I m saying this because of my past experiences with the other consulate .
Thank you again guys.

reviews.text: Marine Security Guard from 1966 to 1968.  Lived at 23 Soendastraat, Den Haag.  Ambassador was William Tyler.   Stood guard at Ambassadors residence when Vice President Hubert Humphrey visited.  Had a bomb go off at back of library, ground floor.  5000 strong demonstration 2 days before VP arrived.  Enjoyed working with Secret Service.

I am an American citizen.  When I called the embassy, a Dutch woman answered and instead of providing assistance, she completely did not understand my question.  When I asked to speak to an American official, she hung up the phone.  So, I called back, an American answered, and he assisted me.  Per his instructions, I sent email.  The reply was completely off-topic and did not answer my question at all.  This morning, I will call back and see what happens.  I have dealt with the American Embassy in Helsinki (really good service),  the Finnish Consulate in New York (excellent service), the Japanese Consulate in Detroit (very good service), and the U.S. Passport Agency in Chicago (nice people).  So, really, what is wrong with the U.S. Consulate in the Netherlands?  Do they have Dutch people reading email who can't understand English or what?  NOT RECOMMENDED:  CALL ANOTHER CONSULATE IF YOU ARE AN AMERICAN CITIZEN!!!√§

In this option, your certified cheque along with the legal documents backing your funds will be delivered to your address that you will provide within 72 hours, we will use the international licensed by Speed Post Courier Company to deliver your funds parcel to your address.

reviews.text: Am apasat butonul din strada si, dupa o asteptare (tot in strada) de vreo 15 min. m-au intimpinat un el si o ea incolori si insipizi, ce pareau sub 25 de ani (in 2015) si vadit vexati cind i-am interpelat in lb. romana. Asteapta sa li se vorbeasca in bielorusa sau in rusa, iar daca le soliciti creierele obosite sa rosteasca citeva cuvinte in romana sau in engleza ii enervezi de-a dreptul si-ti raspund cu lehamite intr-o romana sau intr-o engleza stricata si uitindu-se oriunde in alta parte dar nu la tine. Daca vrei viza acestei tari, mai bine uita si gindeste-te la altceva fiindca formalitatile de obtinere a vizei bieloruse sint incredibil de greoaie. Site-ul consulatului e conceput neglijent, intr-o romana haotica si bizara, de parca Belarus n-ar fi in Europa ci undeva pe Valea Ferganei a Asiei Centrale, iar pentru ei Romania ar fi cam tot pe acolo. Niste mameluci‚Ä¶ Si inca ceva: relatiile cu publicul sint exclusiv dimineata (nu si dupa-amiaza, cum ne zic baietii destepti de la Google Maps Romania).

Quit your job if you don't like it or please do not ruin the honor of the US embassy.

reviews.text:
The Belize Embassy is actually around the corner from the map location. The map location is the Hotel Honduras Maya. If you are at the hotel, as you exit turn right, west, and follow the road/sidewalk around to the right into the first mini stripmall. There is room for about 10 shops the most visible one is Bank Atlantida. The consulate is in the corner of the building and has a small sign, it kind of looks like a US travel agency shop.

The staff is pleasant, professional, and speaks english. We were there to get a visa for my wife who is traveling on a philipine passport and also has a US green card. We completed the form, had our passports on hand, and a picture. With that it took about forty minutes or so and we left with the visa in her passport. One of the questions they asked is if we were traveling with our kids, which we were, so it was lucky for us that we brought their passports because we needed the document numbers to complete the form. Also having the hotel picked out already is a plus. Overall the Belize office was excellent, I hope the rest of the country is run the same when we get there.

Thank you for kind and prompt service. I was completely lost and couldn't find any information about these Russian visas until i stumbled upon the website and called the very nice people here who helped me thought every step of the way. The others I called were rude and didn't even want to spend a minute with me on the phone, however these folks were amazing. I must have called a dozen times asking about every single question and they were patient. Once I got to the office with my forms, the receptionist immediately pointed out the problems on my form, which would get my application rejected. Thankfully I was able to correct them. Once I left the office, I got a call from a nice man Shawn, he told me he noticed a few other things we needed to correct and also add some additional documents to make sure my application goes through. This was very nice of him and I really appreciate it. The process overall was long - about 2 weeks. I got my passport with the visa exactly on the day they said I would by courier. I didn't have to drive out to Toronto (I am from Kitchener), so they offered to courier it to me for something like $30, which definitely beats the waste of time and gas driving back and forth. Overall I was very satisfied and I will come back again. You have a customer for life!

This is not the official Russian VISA application centre!!!! This place is a 3rd party "company" that charges you more than double what the official Russian VISA price is. It's a full on scam. The ACTUAL VISA application centre is 60 St. Clair Ave East. I just traveled all the way here and realized it was sketchy as soon as I walked in. I called the Ottawa location and they guided me out of there to the correct official centre.
Thank you for your suggestions. Without them, I would have done unnecessary things!
Great Service. Thanks! On my way to Moscow!

My appointment is for the Schengen Visa. The gentlemen who helped me was very easy to work with and patient throughout the process. I arrived 30 minutes before my appointment time and they called me up quickly. The whole process takes in about 15-20 minutes once the interview starts. Just make sure to bring all your documents and you should be good. I received my Visa in 4 days. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend this consulate.

Visa issuance is relatively swift and passports are returned in a timely manner.  Bear in mind, if this is your first Schengen, it is possible that you will be issued a 30-day visa rather than the 90-day one. Processing times greatly depend on your nationality. Some tourist visas are issued inside a week, while others take up to a month.

In terms of the organization at the Consulate, services desperately need to be streamlined. At the moment there is only one visa counter,  which slows down the application process to a great extent. Most appointments are delayed by half an hour or more due to this poor distribution of tasks, which I can imagine must take a toll on the person behind the visa counter too. This could easily be rectified by having two visa counters during rush hours. Other than this criticism of the actual working of the Consulate, the visa process by itself appears to functioning properly.

My appointment was to renew my passport. I arrived 30 minutes before my appointment time (12 pm). They called me up at 11:40 am. The two women who helped me were very easy to work with. I was done at 12:10 pm. Overall an awesome experience!
If you're going here it's probably unavoidable, and I feel sorry for you. The worst bureaucratic experience I have ever had. Kafka-esque levels of apathy and incompetency from the staff.

EXCELLENT SERVICE. I requested a Residence Certificate and I was very surprised to received it by mail on the very 4th business day. Yes, I was frustrated in the beginning because I didn't get an acknowledgement from their office about my request but I rather not to hear anything as long as I got the document I requested sooner than expected. Queridos Representantes, keep up the good work!!!

Los correos electronicos deberian estipular con mas claridad los metodos de pago, conjunto con la informacion de la cita en cuestion de renovar pasaportes.  Demostraron muy poca flexibilidad y entendimiento por circumstancias fuera de control, no me dieron la oportunidad de correr a el banco y conseguir los dolares Americanos por la simple razon que cerraban a la 1pm.  Aun cuando maneje por una hora y media (mas de 100km) para la cita.  Por cuestion de pura pereza y por estar afanados de irse, no les importa ayudarle a uno.  Que poca simpatia por el ser humano.  Definitivamente un mal ejemplo de la sociedad Colombiana, demostrando lo peresozos e inhumanos que son, atipico de los Colombianos.

Worst, worst visa application experience, ever. Ridiculous document requirement, extremely primitive lining-up arrangement, rude staff. Trust me it's not an individual experience, I do business travel to Japan quite a few times and I've been coming here for over 10 times in the past 8 months, most of times are unpleasant and nasty. I've seen so many other applicants couldn't stand the bad experience and lost their patience and temper. We know Japan is famous for its perfect customer experience, and I hope the Japan government can take a closer look at what's happening in Hong Kong.

Worst ever visa application process I've been through. Trust me, I have 100+ stamps in my passport and have been to some difficult countries, this is the worst. Oh, not forget to mention I've been to Japan several times already.

-the queue is unbelievably long, and it's almost impossible to do it without help from the travel agency (well they do give flyers with a list of agencies at the entrance handed out by the security guards, how "thoughtful")
-documentation requirement is ridiculous. "schedule of stay" has to be listed day-by-day, even when your itinerary is the same every day. have to list the contact person, place of stay day by day too. and if it's for business, have your company stamp on it.
-not possible to apply multiple entries even it's in their policy; because, they need you to list all trips again, day by day.
-do not accept recycled paper, well I printed the schedule of stay on a bad print (really nothing on the back) and they rejected it. -way to save the trees!!

When I read the reviews I know everyone had been through the same pain here in Hong Kong. Hope the Japan government can read this and do something about it.
The worst consulate in the world... Unfriendly, rude and arrogant...
Extremely rude and difficult, and most of all racist staff. Expected so much more from the Japanese Consulate to be polite.

I realized 2 days before that being a US. National I still need a visa for Pakistan holding US. Passport and being Overseas Pakistani (as I was born in Pakistan) 

Next day it was memorial day. I called the emergency contact number which is used for serious matters not just the visa. However, Miss Saadia answered the phone and suggested that if I can fly urgently next day she will open the Office for me to issue the visa so day after tomorrow I had a flight to catch for Pakistan and if I canceled that flight I would've lost a lot of money plus there were no seats. I went to Walgreens to get my 2 pictures. I went to Amscot to make the money order. 

I flew next day. Mr. Qasim was very friendly and issued me the visa within half an hour. 

I will never forget this cooperation. I sincerely thank you and writing this review as I mentioned to Mr. Qasim & Miss Sadia that I will ensure that at least you guys will get a good word of mouth from myself.

This embassy is a disgrace to Pakistan. The people working there have typical Pakistani mentality where they don't care or understand what customer service is. They all have different requirements for making passports and when we confronted them to honor the requirements listed on their website they told us the website is not always correct. After 3 trips and several hours of explaining our case and providing them all the documents they said they will have to think about it. When I told them what is the problem they said to come back and to give them time to think. Some idiot officers Qassim and Sulaman kept asking stupid questions which had nothing to do with anything. When I confronted them why they changed their story and why they are so rude to their client they said this is Pakistani embassy and if we don't like it we can leave. Pakistan really need to investigate their staff and give them proper training. They should visit American offices and learn from them. They can keep their stupid green Pakistani passport and shove it. I'm proud to have USA passport. People should get together and as a community should confront those idiots as a group. Qassim and Sulaman are not qualified for this job. I'm not the only one who feels like this, most people feel the same but are afraid to confront them. I bet people who wrote positive reviews either don't know what customer service is or they wrote  it as a bribe to get their work done.

January 22, 2016 -

Mr. Suleman and his colleague was doing a really good job in processing passport applications.

I know they are short-staffed but they are doing their best to assist everyone. It didn't take me more than 20 mins to get things done. If you are in rush like me better be there before the office opens.

Stay Calm & Your Passport Application will be processed based on your token number. :)

Went there today for attestation of wife's passport and renewal of my passport. The lady at the attestation counter was quite helpful altough couldve been a little bit more polite. 
Passport renewal was a different story: i arrived at the consulate at 9.15am. The website states that they "receive" documents between 9.30am - 12:30pm which leads one to falsely believe that one should enter the consulate between the said timings for passport renewal. Long story short, if you are from out of town and are looking to accomplish passport renewal in one day come early; around 8.45am and stand right outside the entrance, as soon as the door opens, run as fast as you can and grab a token, this will save you time and tension, unless you want to wait for several hours till the two people working in the passport renewal section very slowly process applicants who came before you. They usually take about 20 mins per applicant and sometimes there are families of upto 4 on one token which takes up to an hour. Sometimes they run out of tokens in the token dispenser outside the door, be sure to knock on the door and ask for your token if you see an empty token machine.
My message to the consulate: if you are understaffed mention it on the website and increase your working hours past 5pm. If you cant do that hire some local help who i'm sure can be trained to do the highly skilled tasks you guys perform on a daily basis. If you cant do either of the above, kindly pack your bags and leave because you are wasting tax payer money. If other countries can automate passport renewal so can you!!!!

I am surprised how people pass negative remarks about the staff at Houston Consulate. When I got my citizenship, I was flying next month right after my citizenship. I was told that I have to apply for US passport and visa to Pakistan. I have few days to apply for passport then visa, I was extremely worried how do I get passport and then visa in short time. I called to Houston Consulate several times, but I found the number out of service, then I found email on their website and wrote them to know about visa process and procedure. Amazing thing, a second after click on send my email to them, I got call from Houston Consulate, the lady name was Sadia Rafiq, she explained to me that I do not need visa for Pakistan, if I have valid Pakistani Passport. She also told me that I should send my both passport to her to put stamp for visa exemption. She made my day wonderful by telling me that I do not need to apply for visa. The quick response shows how the staff at Pakistani Embassy Houston are very responsible and helpful and resolve the issue even on the phone. Thank you Sadia Rafiq, for prompt response on my email and made my day great.

reviews.text: Unable to reach any the customer service number, nor through emails nor through the emergency number mentioned. Consulate website mentions to talk to CKGS for OCI related queries when reached to CKGS, they mention they are not authorized to answer Visa questions. Need to know if we can travel with Valid PIO card to India in July 1st week as our OCI application is still in progress. No clear Answers. Kindly advise.

The entire visa/OCI/PIO/renunciation process, website, call center are badly designed.  Seems like India will always be the at lowest rung of IT services and likes to think it is an IT powerhouse.  India is just a cheap low quality IT services provider which is reflected in its visa/OCI/PIO/renunciation processes and website.

The MOST idiotic documentation requirements are for the OCI. They assume people will happily spend days collecting their list of 20 documents. The website sucks, the requirements make absolutely no sense, and you can't get clarifications from anyone without going to their office. The document requirements seems to be designed by some idiot in some backoffice in New Delhi in between his sutta breaks. Instead of designing the process for 99.9% of legit Indians that are applying- it is designed it to keep out the 0.001% of Pakistanis that they worry will go through the trouble of naturalizing to US citizenship and then seek an OCI. Its designed like - how can I trip up the most number of people, what documents are the hardest to get, and how can I list the requirements so vague so as to be misconstrued and cause people frustration and errors.

I have had to make 4 visits to their office in San Francisco because every time there would be one stupid document that they did not list clearly on their website checklist. So they will say bring 'proof of Indian Origin'. I take my old Indian passport- well that's not good enough, you need to bring a naturalization certificate- wtf? People might go get in-between citizenships, just so they can get an OCI, so lets just screwup everybody's application?. Oh you brought your naturalization certificate- but you didn't notarize it- go back home and find a notary. I had to spend $400 notarizing 40 copies of documents for my family.  What kind of ancient processes are these when they harp of Digital India. 

If you are missing even a single document, go home. There is no way to talk to anyone or get a response from them over email. I have emailed every single person on their list of officers. BC Joshi, Venkatesan Ashok- all to no avail. They are hiding behind these stupid websites and afraid of trying to solve their customer's problems. Probably partying at some high falutin Indian socialite's or visiting celebrity's party instead. No one is accountable for their stupidity in processes, non responsiveness and snobbish behavior. The first experience they are providing potential visitors to their country is horrendous.

There's a lot of venting here, I will try to be as descriptive as possible in the hope that someone may find the information helpful. I arrived at the consulate on a Tuesday morning at 9.50 am. The number in process was A019, and my number was A094. It wasn't until around noon that the number progressed to the 90s, so roughly 2 minutes per number. The online appointment DOES NOT MEAN ANYTHING. My appointment time was 10, and I showed up at 9.50, but still I had to wait. So show up early, don't show up at your appointment time, show up as early as possible.

Also, there is no separation between the visa processing for foreign visitors and the passport service for Chinese citizens. After two hours and fifteen minutes of waiting, the number progressed to the 90s, but it also stopped counting at 92. From there the staff started to prioritize the visa processing, leaving people in need of passport service hanging.

12:20 pm: I am still waiting. 6 windows have shrunk to 2, the other 4 are gone for lunch. Keep waiting. I find it appalling that a consulate based in the Bay Area can be so technically backwards and inefficient. 

12:36 pm: I waited in the number-less line and finally moved to the window. Surprisingly the process only took 3 minutes. Just when I got excited about ending this ordeal, the staff told me I still need to wait for the officer to double check my documents. "How long is the wait?" I asked. "Probably until 1 pm." OK, keeping waiting.

12:53 pm, the officer returned and within 30 seconds finished my application for passport renewal. I'm finally done. 3 hours in total.

Copy machine available at $0.25/page. Passport photos are also available at $15 per 8 photos. Cash only. There are a couple of outlets where you can charge your digital devices. Restrooms available in the corner next to the copy machine.

Prepare yourself for the worst, but hope for the best.

I was there on Wednesday at 8:20 was the 18th person in line. Ended up being number 15 for visa processing. Was finished with what I needed to do by 9:40am. Everyone in the line had been checked in by 9:20am was fast and not crowded.

On Monday I can at 7:30 and was 15th in line. There were only 7ish people in front of me in the visa pickup line and I was in and out by 9:20am. One hiccup was that we were planning on paying in cash and they only took cards.

***** When I left at 9:20am on Monday the line outside wrapped around the block. Where on Wednesday there was no line by 9:20am *****

Also did not have to pay for parking. The 2hr parking limit starts at 9am and you could stay till 11 if needed. (Park across from Japan center about 2 blocks from the consulate)

My wife and I were applying for a tourist visa. We arrived on a Wednesday morning at 8:40 and joined the line. The door opened promptly at 9:00. By 9:10 we had been checked through security and been given a number(27). Our number was called after a short wait and the woman that was helping us had checked both of our required documents , given us a receipt to claim our visas in three working days. By 9:45 we were headed to our car. After reading some of the reviews this was a much shorter stay than we had expected and the staff person was friendly and helpful.

During our short stay we observed that the people that had delays seemed to not have their applications completed or had to join another line to have pictures taken. The website is self explanatory:
      
            1 fill out application 
            2 have current passport
            3 have itinerary
            4 have flight and hotel information
            5 have photocopy of previous visas to China

I got to the consulate 15 minutes early (there are many 2 hour parking spots available around the whole consulate block) and was 38th in line. I brought my visa form (filled out by hand in neat black ink), round trip flight itenerary, hotel reservations, passport, and a photocopy of the main passport page.

The line moved very quickly (the office girls worked quickly and kept a good light atmosphere) they took my passport and paperwork, and gave me a receipt that included a pickup date (5 days later in my case because of the weekend) 

I spent about 1 minute at the actual window (there are several windows open at a time, they call your number in order, sometimes quickly enough that people who are too slow get skipped, if you get skipped just go to the window that was displaying your number, just show your number before they call the next one, people won't mind terribly much) 

You can bring your cell phone in the building- but there are plenty of interesting people to talk to so why bother? Traffic into town is bad, expect to leave around 20 minutes earlier because of it.

I've always believed most people living in China are racist.  The Chinese detergent commercial depicting a black person as sub-human is just an example.  President Obama should file a complaint to the Chinese Gov't that such blatant asks of racism will not be tolerated, such as was the case with hitler and the KKK.

There are no rules for anyone to get a visa to Brazil. There is an employee in the Consulate in Vancouver whose sole job is to humiliate Brazilians, he is the elderly Brazilian man at the counter. My husband tried to get a tourist visa and was rejected once and told to come back with me, the Brazilian wife, to sign some papers. When we got there they said they didn't need me there, and that he should have brought another document they hadn't mentioned, nor was it mentioned anywhere else, before. They seem to come up with things for you to bring at the last minute so that they won't give you a visa. I wish I didn't have to deal with these people, unfortunately, as a Brazilian, I have to. Bring a lot of patience, and affinity for red tape because you will find a lot of it there.
I appreciated the politeness of the Argentinian man at the counter, he was fair, and understood customer service.

name: Consulate General of the Republic of Korea

reviews.text:
I was there for  just 15 minutes and talked to the consulate no more than 5 minutes. He told me to pick up my visa exactly one week after. After reading so many negative reviews here, I was afraid that I wouldn't get the visa on time. As my trip would start in 12days. This is the most enjoyable and efficient visa applications I have ever had.

I love you, Brazil!

If you are complaining about the service you get here, it is because you do not know the pain it is for Brazilians to get a US visa at US consulates in Brazil. You are treated badly and cannot even enter with your car key or cell phone, forcing you to hand it over to strangers. I have been to the Brazil Consulate in SF many times and I gladly noticed that Americans are treated really well there - they can even enter with their smartphones! HAHA what a different treatment. 

KNOW that Brazil does things reciprocally to other countries, i.e. if the US requires Brazilians to pay a $200 visa fee and wait for 2 weeks to get their visas, so will Brazil! Fair game.

I did a passport drop in, and I was in and out in less than 10 minutes.

For my girlfriend's visa appointment we were in and out in less than 15 minutes. 

We brought all the documents that the website requested; we read the page that clearly states all instructions in English. We did our part, and they did their part much faster than any time that I was in any DMV.

I cannot understand why this place has 2 stars review, but mine is 5 with no doubt.
I saw the raving review here before I went. But they are really friendly and efficient. I went for a tourist visa interview. Waited for 5 minutes. Visa officer was professional and nice, too.

Don't expect anyone to get back with you quickly or at all. All we wanted to check up on was school transcripts and there is no extension for that. So much for hosting anyone from Brazil again. It has been two months and we still have not received school transcripts.

I read all the reviews below and was not looking forward to this experience, how wrong was I. in our case we were applying for a Thai birth certificate and at the same time a passport for my 6 month old son.
We had booked a 10 AM appointment slot via the online booking system, but expecting the worse arrived well before opening time, we were admitted by 9:00 AM sharp, and were number 6 in the queue. 
We had carefully completed the 3 forms required, well before hand and submitted them together with two copies of the relevant supporting documents.  Upon initially reviewing the application pack, the clerk on the desk immediately identified several minor errors in 2 of the 3 forms but instead of sending us to the back of the queue and asking us to rectify the mistakes [which she was well within her rights to do so], she corrected our errors for us, on the spot.
The next clerk we saw, took a photo, together with a thumb print from my son and asked for my signature on the completed paperwork that he had created, everything went smoothly and we had finished with the application process and were on our way by 9:45 AM.
In my experience the Thai embassy staff who we interacted with on this occasion and who dealt with our application were: more than helpful, knowledgeable, courteous, and spoke very good English.
One thing to be aware of, for consular services such as this, the Thai embassy will only take cash for applications made in person, but knowing this before hand, this was not a problem. However they will issue a receipt if you request one.

Thai embassy London - visa application.

My non EU wife requires a tourist visa for an upcoming holiday to Koh Samui. As I can work in central London decided to go up there today in person with her application and passport to submit.

All I can say, the service is non existent. You are requested to take a ticket and wait your turn at a single counter #4. Unfortunately the system is let down by the fact the counter is unstaffed. I waited 50 minutes then got up and left in disgust. I will be posting her application by recorded post now.

All I can say if I had not already booked and paid for a holiday to Thailand I would not be bothering. There are far nicer places in the world to visit on holiday as this service seems to reflect others reflected experiences of Thailand. 

My advice is don't bother going in person unless you are prepared to arrive at 9:00am and wait until they close, hopefully by then they will have seen you. If not, don't be surprised if they ask you to come back next day, as now closed and they turn around and walk off behind a closed door.

Appalling customer service, shockingly rude,  unhelpful and unwilling to explain and resolve queries. Although there are some positive reviews, by and far they are from Thai natives. Perhaps they have an intense dislike for foreigners and a total disregard for the Amazing Thailand image.

Before visiting to apply for a 12-month multiple entry visa I read the documentation requirements on the website carefully, and checked half-a-dozen times by phone. Website and phone differed so I followed the phone information.

When I got to the embassy, the desk officer disagreed with the phone information and wouldn't accept my application. 

She was unable to find my income in the bank statements - 'Where is it?' so I found it for her.

FWIW she required my solicitor to confirm all the pages on my bank statement showing income, although I'd brought three contiguous months, chopped on the front page as requested. She also required proof that my solicitor is a solicitor, 'How do I know this is genuine?' although they're a big firm and their registration is a matter of public record. 

Unfortunately they don't accept postal applications, presumably because they demand cash payment which seems a very questionable practice. 

Applications close at midday which is inconvenient if travelling.

The Hull consulate, which is no longer allowed to issue 12-month visas was efficient and effective, and the comparison is most unflattering to the London embassy.

As I'd had quite a long and fruitless journey thanks to their incompetence I rate them 1 star.

I send in my visa paperwork and received it back in a timely manner, however, I've had complications with my boyfriends visa and am getting no response from the consulate.  His paperwork was delivered on a Friday holiday by the post office, and then re-delivered on Saturday, which obvious wasn't a business day. (don't get me started on the post office!)

Neither the post office nor the consulate has returned our calls to confirm that it was picked up by the consulate, resent or even received. I've emailed the consulate twice already, and called 5 times, leaving several messages, after we discover the error by accident two weeks after mailing it in. In a strange situation like this, I just want to talk to a person to help get the situation sorted out. Our trip is now a week away and we still don't have any information from the consulate. We're starting to panic.

I've heard many bad things about this consulate in particular, but from my experience everyone there was very helpful and polite. My wife and I had to get our Passports renewed and register our marriage in Brazil and even though we didn't have all of our documents exactly how they needed them, they were still able to accommodate us and get everything done.

The staff at the Brazilian Consulate are very helpful and polite.  There was a small mistake on my son's passport, and the women at the consulate was able to fix it on the spot.  I'm not Brazilian and I still give it 5 stars.  I just wish the US consulate was as polite and efficient as the Brazilian consulate in Boston.

I was very nervous about receiving the renewed passport on time for my travel and just a while ago I got a message that the passport is being shipped out today. I had also emailed the consulate yesterday inquiring the status and I received a very fast response too. I'm really happy and proud of our government's service to us.

The Indian government wants money from non resident Indians, but their employees  provide the WORST service anywhere on this planet. Call them at 8 am when their offices open, and you will still be on hold for 15 minutes and you will have to endure their jarring music.

Back to applying for a visa, I found that the citizenship application in the US or Canada is easier to fill in than the Indian visa application form. The checklist of "how to fill the application" and "list of document" itself runs to 4 PAGES. Every time one applies for a visa, it only get  MORE COMPLICATED. Now they want a proof of address, and the return pre paid envelope must have PRINTED ADDRESS LABEL. Why is that? Cox and kings can not explain. "Rules are rules" Period. 

I can cite a zillion other flaws in the system. Now when this guy Modi was elected, people thought things would get simpler - as he keeps promising at every event. NO, they just want your money, but will screw you otherwise, at every occasion. To start with Narendra Modi needs to make life simpler for Indians abroad, and teach his employees to treat people with dignity and respect - one that is in short supply among Indian Government employees,

So these guys want to send a mission to Moon and Mars, but can't simplify their visa application form?. How nice,

If i could rate it a -100 stars I would. This place is such crap. I got there at 11:33 (my ticket says) and took them about 1 hour to get to me when there were about 5 other people. THEY HAVE OVER 10 COUNTERS to do their job. But no, they want to relax and enjoy their coffee and laugh with their colleagues. Their time is precious but not our time. I got to the counter at 1:02 and made my payment for my stolen passport. Funny thing is they messed up my name TWICE. ITS NOT THAT HARD. The receipt had my full real name but the workers who are trying to multitask calling their friends about their travel plans to Latin America (I know all this because they forgot to turn the voice speaker off). I waited for hours to get a simple emergency passport. THEY DONT EVEN LET YOU TAKE YOUR PHONES IN. Yeah so literally over 5 hours of waiting just sitting my ass in their hard wooden chairs. They don't take this job seriously at all, I ended up waiting until 4PM because they couldn't do their freaking job right. Also it costs $140 for this stupid fake looking passport. Literally 4 pages, they make you pay for this crappy security they have.

Also the security is such an ass. The head of the security just plays games on her phone and the other security she gets mad at the people in spanish and she cant do her job right. I think they should have english speaking security at the Embassy of United States? I want to report this place to the UN. The only helpful person here was the cashier. Yes, the cashier was the most helpful.

The visa application must be submitted before 11 a.m. and will be ready around 15 p.m. Sometimes in the next morning when it‚Äôs really busy. On Friday they are open til noon. Make sure you have two recent passport photos. Around the corner, is a supermarket with a photo booth. If you do not speak French, use the help of Habib. He is a Mauritanian ‚Äòfixer‚Äô who is assisting foreigners at the embassy site. He is helpful and reliable. Give him something for his services, it‚Äôs his full-time job.

Update 26/02/16: From now on no more paper visa. Only biometric at the cost of 1450 dirham.
Came in 8:45, they gave us papers, filled it, in 8:55 were free. The same day took our visas at 14:05. 340Dh per person

It is very tricky to get a visa for mauretania. At the time of writing, one has to queue (there was a paper queue, as an initiative of the first to come) as early as at 6 morning, complete a form, add 2 pics and passport photocopy, be lucky to get through queue and be accepted from 9-11h morning. Guys arround the place will help you with the form, or if you are illeterate, but woyl accept a couple of dirgams. 
At last you get visa the next working day arround 14h. Be sure to triple check each info they give you, as they tend to forget about their own rules, working hours and national work-free holidays. 
Also, they say, women queue seoaratelly and are served early.

Be sure, its africa, things change according to mood, weather and money.

reviews.text: Wish there was zero stars. All they do is fight fires. You can't get an appointment, they don't let you inquire over the phone on when more appointments are being made available. And from what I can tell, they will only take an emergency appointment if it's within a month of travel. Living in OR, getting down to SF isn't cheap and easy...especially a last minute trip. Hey French Consulate...are YOU going to pay for my last minute travel costs to SF? Plus spending all vacation days visiting your territories and providing the French government with money from tourism makes it even harder to take the time off. This should be done remotely. No need to ever have to step foot in the French Consulate.

My wife and two daughters needed to renew their passports.  We were in San Francisco so they applied there and they passports were sent to Honolulu to pick up.  Everyone has extremely helpful.  It was a pleasant experience and I highly recommend them if you need their services.

I find the french consulate in SFO to be outstanding service..in many respects...
the information on the their website is very clear and accurate.. (esp compared to other European countries). The respond to your queries very promptly and proper guidance..They are considerate about special scenario's.. Overall they treat customers with respect..(esp compared to how other consulates treat)So over all great experience.

Got a visa appointment at 9:30. Arrived 9:20 - no queue, got called, handed over all documents, had a pleasant chat.
When I was told my visa will be ready at 11:30 I had to ask again since I thought I misheard. Visa was actually ready in 40min, got a call - stopped by to pick it up - done. Mind blown.
The appointment took me ~2 weeks which is very reasonable, unlike some other consulates (*ahem* Italy *ahem*)

I had a most pleasant and informative experience when I contacted Monsieur Anthony Bedoussac, in charge of legal questions at the consulate.Ms Bedoussac  was very helpful,patient and competent in explaining what I needed to know and to do.
 I  really appreciate this kind of excellent rapport with your staff and sincerely hope that my comments will help create the correct image of the consular staff.    
 Dr. Drago Schmidt,

This is probably my most pleasant experience at a Nigerian Embassy. The immigration officer and his staff in charge of passports were excellent. I did not get the same day service for passport renewal that I expected due to a technical issue with the passport machine. But the way they handled the difficulty was excellent. The officer in charge came out in person, explained the situation and apologized. He then proceeded to give clear instructions and guidance on what to do next (where to go get a self addressed envelope). The process of getting my biometrics taken was fast and efficient. These are the kind of public servants we need to turn the country around. Good service shows when things do not run smoothly. I got excellent service today. Thanks guys. One suggestion I will make to the guys is to be less tolerant of customers that show impatience, rudeness or use bad language, get security to haul them out, deny them service. Demand politeness and respect from your customers.

I am disappointed! I went to The Nigerian high commission in Ottawa 3 years ago and got fair treatment. I was there at the required time with all my documents and seen people I got there before get their passport before me. I wasn't mad about that typical Nigerian connection kinda thing. They respect people that come from BC or Alberta because of the distance covered. 
BUT THIS TIME!! I am PISSED!
Its like they have changed their staffs or head of department. I mean people are people. But as a business and an organization u guys are whack! DISRESPECTFUL, disorganized, I cannot get these guys on the phone when I call. Can't even get an email reply. You make life difficult for your own people commons this is Canada men! Don't make life difficult for us. And that 9- 5 time they have there I question there. Hear say but I heard their real time is 10-1 and out of the 3hours they take an hour break. People we have to change this BS.

I couldn't help it but just to give them 4 star because they had given me the best service ever even though I had to pay extra for quick service but it was worth it and overall it was great at first I was so scared with all the comments and all that thinking gosh I wish this wont happen to me so luckily God was on my side , I submitted all the documents need and yesterday my passport my delivered within 7 days with the visa on it so I could had given them 5 star but I did NOT because some couple of times I tried to rich the visa office but believe me no single day I got hold of anyone in that office all the time leave a message I do and nobody will return my calls but the lady in the receptionist of that embassy she is the best ,kind and very friendly and she will answer any question when you ask her either is something to do with visa or passport she is the best ever wish all the can be like her and at least answer the phone that the only frustrations  I had went through but at the end I got all I wanted and delivered as promised so if you are someone out there  need Nigerian  visa just submit all the documents needed and relax and you get your visa in no time and also I know not everyone will experience the same treatment or service but just give it a try it doesn't seems so bad like some comments say so I was skeptical but now here I am am happy , just give them the benefit of doubt ................take care all and stay blessed

Excellent Service! With the required documentation, the process was soo fast. Ignore the negative reviews, the passport officer is superb. I was there to renew my passport today. They opened around 9:00am and by 10:50am, my passport was in my hands. I cannot be more happier as a Nigerian. Mind you, I do not work there and cannot write fake reviews if the service wasn't good.

IF YOU READ ANY REVIEW THAT GIVE THIS ESTABLISHMENT A 5 STAR, THEY ARE EMPLOYEE OF THIS ESTABLISHMENT OR RELATED TO SOMEONE THAT WORK IN THIS ESTABLISHMENT.  

THEY ARE NOT FRIENDLY OR POLITE IN ANYWAY, IF YOU DO NOT BELIEVE ME PLEASE TRY FOR YOURSELF. 

I WILL SAY IT AGAIN, THEY ARE SCAMMERS .. ABSOLUTE SCAMMERS AND THIEF.

The people there are thief and useless.  Try calling them either you can't reach them or they are rude.  I was 12 years old when I came to Canada, I am now 31 years old. I decided to get my Nigerian passport I followed every guideline, it has been over a year still no passport and I can't get my money back, they inform me the account that they use to collect all the money has been closed that in order to get my money back I would have to go to Abuja look for some corrupt department and request for my money, I later discover that they had stolen money from everyone.  I think during the time with my calculation due to a number of complaint I think in a month they stole more than $40,000 from Nigerians in my area.  This people are thief and scammer.  Due to all the corruption, I have decided I will not be visiting Nigeria any time soon, I rather just stick to my Canadian Passport, you would think this is Canada they would be a little bit more organized.   Here is a warning - If you can avoid them please do because they are money Hungary bastard; I guarantee that you will regret it.

zero *       from last 2 weeks calling them to get online appointment for new born but no body answer from all given number on website go to hell ...........also no anointment through web  available before aug

1. The consulate is situated in a pure residential area surrounded by school and private properties. Hence its really difficult to get proper parking. 

2. Every day there is queue of 1000's of applicants outside the consulate to get the serial number to enter inside the consulate. Most of applicants are coming to stand in the queue from 4am and above all they are coming from other cities. Therefore, it is highly advisable to implement the proper online appointment system as soon as possible. Needless to mention the present online booking system is not up to the standard to meet the present day demand. For benchmarking, Pakistan consulate Jeddah should follow the online booking system of Pakistan Embassy Jeddah. 

3. There should be quick process of required services for new born babies, women and elderly people. Moreover proper sitting arrangement required for women especially with new born babies. 

4. It is highly advisable to outsource an agent like "VFS  Global" for NICOP and passport related services. Already, most of the consulates are successfully providing services through agents like VFS Global and such agents are handling applicants successfully through extended working hours and adequate staff.

Learning a new language can be arduous  but with GLC and suman mam by your side, its become easy. If you want to learn German language  than i must say that GLC is the best place for it.
 I have completed my A1 level and hopefully will join the A2 level soon. 
Danke sh√∂n Suman mam for helping me learning the German language.You are simply the best.

GLC is the best place to learn German language in Bhopal. it has got a very good environment of learning German language. GLC gives us the feeling of being in the Germany. One should never miss the opportunity to learn German language from Suman ma'm.

Learning was never so amazing,until reached GLC. What an aweSome atmosphere and positive attitude of everyone here,specifically the teacher,Suman mam is well experienced and highly skilled in teaching. Her guidence and tactics always simplifies the difficulty of language. Wonderful books ,self made by Suman mam are themselves an example of her hard work and dedication towards teaching. Want to learn German language! no place other than GLC Bhopal in central India is as great to be. GLC rocks.

Learning a new language could never be more exciting and enlightening. I've just finished the A-1 level and will be joining A - 2 level very soon and I cannot wait! Ich kann etwas Deutsch sprechen üòÄ.. 
Suman Ma'am makes everything clear in a matter of minutes and always guides us. She's extremely talented and understanding. GLC has many books so you always have the liberty to expand your horizon with Suman Ma'ams help. She's an excellent teacher with excellent skills.  Highly recommend GLC if you want to learn German.

Best place in entire central India to learn German. Suman mam is a great teacher and the environment of the class is totally based on German culture. Mam makes learning a new language an easy and fun task.

Saddened to list myself as a Trinidadian. I don't understand how Trinidadians can be so inconsiderate. Employees at this place, wake up, travel to work knowing that their goals isn't to answer anyones questions, be polite to anyone or answer the telephone. What's the point?. Trinidadians love to use the term "common sense". So using my common sense would tell me employees here dislike their jobs, and their own people. Please Stop being so nosey into clients personal life. I'm sure if we were to ask these employees about their personal lives, most of them don't have any, or their husbands are drunks, or their wives are cheating on them. Listen we come for guidance  and assistance. We don't come with fire blood to disrespect anyone. Stop blaming everything on Trinidad, we are in the US with well updated technology. Stop blaming the system for being backup. The employees of the Trinidadian consulate makes the system and process slow.

THE RUDEST SET OF EMPLOYEES EVER! I traveled from upstate NY to get the new MRP. Not only were the detailed instructions NOT on the website (dead links) but when I told them they just flagged me down and started talking to the person behind me like I did not exist! Called me up to the desk with a "(steups)...just come just come". I was clearly BOTHERING them with being at the window when it was my turn. If it weren't for my 23 month old son that caught the eye of the woman behind the glass I may have never seen a smile from any one of them. I DID get through but my husband had to drive from upstate NY that morning to bring me the documents I needed that were NOT listed on the website. May GOD touch them and help them to realize that people should be treated with respect!

I have never written a review before but this was warranted. As far as I'm concerned NO STAR. We are at their mercy and they dont care it is blatantly disrespectful to the people to have a business like this and not have someone answering the phone giving info at ALL times. Over the course of at least 6 months I took time off work 3 times to try to get my passport renewed each time I went they mark in red in all over my information sheet and told me I had to come back knowing my mother was severely sick in trinidad. Unfortunately  I cannot take time off work days in a row I had to spread it out and at my last visit I was so upset I said to the security guard my mother can die before these people process my paperwork for my passport he said no have faith your mother won't die. Sadly my mother did pass away one week after and I was unable to go to her funeral they said I can get a pass to go to trinidad but I have to stay down there until I get the new one which may be months. I truly despise that place and the manner in which they do things in such a primitive manner. My mother is dead so I refuse to get a trinidad passport again. Can you believe it is easier to get an American passport.

I have been trying for the past six months now to contact the consulate office for information about passport renewal. 
But to no avail they will answer as I'm 
Tied to my job, wanting to know if there's a way I can mail in the applications Rather than spending all day at the office. So this can be expedited quickly. 
It seems I will never get this answer.

I have heard that it takes six months or more to have your passport renewed.
That's unbelievable and unheard of.
As we merge ahead into the 21st century 
We expect that things are done much more rapidly but this cannot be. 
With the mentality of Trinidadians and the Government, this is impossible to keep up with time.
30 years ago I could have gotten my passport in less than a week. 

Now 30 years after it's taking more than six months. That's why everyone is laughing at us. As we go further in time we are going backwards in technology. 
It's really ashame.
They must first change their attitude before changing anything else. 

Will they ever pick up the phone in this modern world is yet to be proven, but I doubt it. 
Just unbelievable, unbelievable, unbelievable. 
Be prepared for the future looks very dull in renewal of your passports. 
Start trying a few years before it expires. 
This is my advice to other Trinidadians.
I was forced to give a star.
Just as dealing with this experience 
If there was an option for minus stars
They would have gotten it all the way down, that is how badly I feel about their services and ways of running a government agency.

I accompanied my husband for a passport renewal. I was told at the door I had to leave since they only allow the person conducting business in the office. I was not allowed to wait in the hallway and was told to leave the building. Thankfully the very nice people on another floor allowed me sit and wait. The staff in the office is discourteous and uncivil. They do not know how to answer simple questions properly. Their website does not have vital information pertaining to a passport renewal. Forget about calling them, they don't answer the phone. My husband sat down and witnessed the phone ringing constantly and no one wanted to answer it. He was advised a passport renewal takes 4-6 months. I'm still wondering why it would take 4-6 months, in this modern century we live in where there are companies like Fedex and ups and also "Express U.S. mail". I returned back into the building and tried to ask if the passport can be expedited, I am more than willing to pay any additional fees since our 10 year wedding anniversary is in July and we planned a vacation. The staff looked at me like I had four heads  and simply said to me " there is nothing they can do".  I feel bad for the other people that are dealing with more time sensitive items like visa and deportation. Good luck to anyone who has to visit this place. I am pretty sure they will make it a memorable visit.

WOW. I literally said to my friend I wish Thai CG had a review page so I could tell people how horrible they are. Here it is. I sent in my passport via mail to get a thai tourist visa. I did everything according to the book on the website, sent in the exact documents, exact amount of money, even called them to double check, but they didn't pick up the 3 times I called. I mailed it in and about a week later they called me saying I hadn't sent enough money. I told them that's the amount the website said and he said "no check again" and I did and .. guess what. Still the same amount as what I sent. REGARDLESS, I spent 30$ to overnight the remainder of the money and kept checking tracking on my self-addressed return envelope I included, but it remained inactive. Throughout the next week I called about 6 or 7 times and no one ever picked up the phone even though it was business hours. Finally, someone answered when I called 8 times in a row as I leave in 3 days. They first told me they couldn't find my passport, and when they finally did, they said it didn't have a self-addressed envelope included. Funny, as I have a receipt and tracking and put it in myself. So then I paid Fed Ex 40$ to go pick it up and overnight it to me, as my trip is now TWO days away and I don't have a passport. I have been calling all morning since they opened, and no one has picked up the phone. 
I wish I could give LESS than one star, this is the LEAST professional place I have ever dealt with in my life. Now I am sitting here, just PRAYING this passport gets to me in time or I'll lose about 1400$ on a flight I booked.

reviews.text: Is such a terrible service !!! Not good at all. If they commit a mistake no one will do anything ... They just say (apply again)... Very frustrating

My experience was good obtaining a business visa, although they do not offer much information before or during the processing of the visa. To give an idea of processing times I will tell my experience.

1. The "interview" was scheduled 2 weeks after I submitted the online application and payment ($142). The interview was quick, the interviewer was not informative at all.
2. After the interview, normally, it takes 3 weeks for them to return your passport with the visa. I had to pay for "Priority service" ($170). My passport with the visa was returned after 5 business days (splitted by a weekend) although they say that this service reduce the time to 7 - 10 business days.
3. In total, it took 27 calendar days to obtain my visa. with priority service. The do not offer any kind of information about the status of your visa by telephone, and would not accept you without an appointment.

reviews.text: I went to go and pick up some Italian books and movies. I was totally impressed by how friendly, warm, and welcoming everyone there is. Definitely lived up to my impressions of how likeable and awesome Italian people are. Even though they did not get the email I sent with my list of requests, they were extremely apologetic and extremely accomodating. They put up with my bad attempts to remember the Italian titles and were still able to get me the books and movies I wanted. They even let me go into another part of the office to wait on the couch while they brought my stuff. The one woman even said I can feel free to just ask for her if I ever need to come again for other stuff. They even complimented my limited Italian. Not all the embassies are as fantastic as this one, and I know that from personal experience.

Arrived for my visa appointment at 7.30am... Had my visa approved and leaving the building by 8.40am!

I was dreading the whole process but I was pleasantly surprised. 
Arrived and joined the queue for my 8am appointment.
Had my passport and documents checked , through security and into the building by 7.50am
You'll receive a ticket number. When your number is called you go to the screen indicated- here you'll have your fingerprints taken and your documents checked
Then you join another queue for the actual "interview".
My interview was over in a matter of seconds- my fingerprints were verified and asked a couple of question related to the exchange programme I'm doing under a J1 visa.
The embassy officer kept my passport and documents and said he's happy to approve my visa.
And that was it!! 
I was prepared for a grilling but in actual fact it was a painless experience!

Seems to get only a worse establishment... Few years ago needed a document to return to the US as had misguidedly thought it were worth applying for residency in (I now know different, wild horses would not drag me to that vile country!).  Anyhow, the laughable thing is that I spent hours getting this document from London Embassy, when I got to the US...the immigration officer said the document could be a forgery..üòÅ Issued by this 'wonderful' 'Embassy'.

They are a joke, not a nice one..

If you're taking a holiday...go elsewhere!

L1-A visa. Great staff, smooth process.
The process went very smoothly. You turn up outside the embassy 30 minutes before your appointment time and join the queue, don't panic at the size of it as it flows very well. I wouldn't advise getting there any earlier as they process people strictly by appointment time and NOT by the time you arrive.
You wait in line until you see the (helpful and pleasant) staff on the "tent" desk, you then queue again to get through security (again the staff were real people and were very nice), this whole process took me around 60 minutes.
Once inside you get a "ticket number", take a seat and wait for your number to be called on the TV screens. You then go to the screened counter number indicated on the large TV and you application documents are checked. If they are OK. The lady on my counter (10) was brilliant, very helpful and friendly. If all is OK you then wait in line for the "interview".
The interview lasted 3 - 4 minutes and I was surprised by how "jolly" the interviewer was. No tricky questions, no abruptness, just genuinely nice people. If you are approved, they keep your passport, if they give it back to you that's bad news.
I was stunned by how easy and smoothly the whole process was, and how quickly it was. Once inside it only took 40 minutes. 
My advice is to don't panic and don't pre-judge. It's not as bad as you think it's going to be.

Sehr schlechter Service und sehr unfreundlich zu den Menschen.

Very professional, efficient, and courteous. We had three passports renewed at the same time, and they gave us the new booklets on the spot, after just a few minutes. Come prepared with an appointment made online and all your paperwork in order, and you'll leave satisfied. Forza Italia!

I have had to deal with the Consulate General of Philadelphia on several occasions during the Spring and Fall of 2015.  Specifically, I contacted them for Italian passports and to help register my Grandson as an Italian citizen.  This involved two visits in persons, and several emails.  I mostly dealt with Ms. Emanuela Villa and Ms. Alexandra Malevic.

I have dealt with many American bureaucracies, so I know about how difficult it is to obtain documents and deal with busy people.  I can state that these people are highly professional, extremely knowledgeable, and very pleasant.  They deal with the angry public all day long.  In spite of this, they always smile and always act on the public's behalf.  I never doubted that they would get the job done and do the work accurately.  All of my emails were answered quickly and in depth.

At one point, I thought that they lost some of my documents.  I bothered them about this, and they always answered me with respect and kindness.  I actually never sent them the documents.  When I approached them with my mistake, they treated me with kindness and respect.

These people will work hard if you have problems, such as the need of passports or issues of citizenship.  They are true professionals who deserve our respect.  I recommend this Consulate General without reservation.

Very helpful. I do not speak Romanian yet had to deal with something here. And the lady, I wish I knew her name, was more than helpful in answering my questions in English and ensuring I had everything I need for the forms and payment, and always tried to call me back if I tried to reach them for anything. Even though I don't speak Romanian she still took me seriously, and helped alleviate a somewhat stressful process for me. For that I am very Grateful.

Overall, I had a smooth experience getting my Romanian passport (as a Romanian citizen) and registering my marriage in Romanian records. The time it takes will vary for everyone, but it took me 5 weeks to get the passport in hand, through the mail, after filing in person at the consulate. The visit to the consulate was about 1 - 2 hours (filing paperwork, fingerprints, passport photo), and this involved filing for a Romanian marriage certificate, and for 2 passports (me + spouse). As expected, there were a few forms which had to be filled out, and some were exact duplicates. Their forms can definitely be optimized (but is probably standard across all their consulate locations worldwide), but it was a very small inconvenience, and didn't take too much time. 

Mr. Ghenea (Consul) was very helpful and responsive to phone calls and email ahead of time to ensure we had the proper paperwork and payment method when we got there. (Please note they only accept money order as the form of payment - this is listed on their website). They also had me fill out a FedEx form with payment info so that they can ship the passports to my address (in a different state) when they arrived  in their office. 

I'm thankful for the quick and smooth service in receiving my passport, so I can highly recommend this consulate office.

I called the Hungarian Embassy in Los Angeles to ask for some basic information and the staff I talked to was extremely inpatient. I did not understand something that I was asked and she, the clerk was very inpatient. It give you the impression that you are an idiot for not understanding the question. Isn't an embassy by definition meant to help people? Very poor manners, rude behavior and extremely indecent attitude. You should be ashamed of  yourself.

My experience with them when applying for a Schengen visa this week was absolutely the worst! The female visa officer who handled my case was totally cold and didn't give a damn. 

I applied for the multiple-entry visa and explained that besides the September trip I already booked flight for to visit Budapest, I also planned to make another trip back to Europe in the winter. She simply did not consider it and said she would only issue me one-entry visa because I would only be in EU zone and told me to come back to LA and apply again for my second trip. 

I live in WA State, a Chinese citizen with GC. I had to fly to LA and stay for 2 days this time just to take care of the application. It took 3 days of my personal time plus $600-$800 of airfare, lodging and application fee. And I only got one-entry visa good for only 15 days and I have to do it all over again in 2 months!! What a waste of my time and energy! What kind of policy is that?! Does it make any sense?! Maybe none of them have ever had to go through all the hassles and apply for a visa in person. Come on, the world has changed! This is not like 30-50 years ago when there were not many Chinese independent travelers who can afford a trip to Europe. 

I am an experienced traveller and have been to over 20 countries. Before this, I already travelled twice to Europe in the last 3 years to Italy and France and had never encountered such unreasonable and inconsiderate consulate/visa officer. Most of them are people you can reason with. For instance, French Consulate in SF issued me multiple-entry visa valid for 6 months in 2014 and they were polite and professional. Japanese Consulate issued me multiple-entry visa valid for 3 years in 2015 even though I only explained but did not provide reservation for my future trips except for the first one. 

Anyway, frustration aside, this is just sad. It really left a bitter taste in my mouth and dampened my enthusiasm to visit Hungary. A tip from my experience: go apply at consulates of Western European countries such as France and Italy. They have more generous visa policies and will welcome you with open arms to visit their countries and spend money.

I had several dealings with the LA Consulate staff over the past year. I found everyone to be very courteous and helpful. They are excellent representatives of the Hungarian culture. Thank you again.
-GM. J. Bolega
Salt Lake City, UT

reviews.text:
RUDE STAFF!
I returned to Hanoi from Cambodia on Thursday, January 7th and I had a flight to U.S on January 18th which had a layover in Japan, and I also had to move from Haneda Airport to Narita Airport. I needed to apply for a transit visa but I only found information about this kind of visa on the Consulate General of Japan's website (not the Embassy's). I called and nobody answered. Later, it transferred me to someone else and he was very rude, and somewhat, hostile. I asked some questions regarding the visa and he even scolded at me for not paying attention to my flights. I was shocked at his attitude. Did I not pay attention to my flights? So why did I call them four weeks before my flight (yes, I called them around late December, too, and no one answered). I also have my other responsibilities which I'm obliged to which meant I couldn't cancel my trip to Cambodia. 
I never had such a bad experience with a foreign agency like this. Although as much as I love Japan, I must say that I'm extremely disappointed at this office.
GOOD AND THE WAY OF THERE ATTENDANCE WAS OKAY

reviews.text: El nombre de la calle es Juan Pablo Sanz (no Juan Pedro Sanz)

This is the worst experience I've ever encountered with a government office. You can only make appointments on their website & to renew a Colombian ID you have to wait until the last week of the current month in order for you to be able to make an appointment for the following month.  If you cancel an appointment and need to reschedule you can forget about any type of customer service it's a miracle if anyone answers the phone and if you do get a hold of someone they say they can't help you & that everything has to be done through their website but their website service is a total joke! I'm so disappointed!
If you ever experienced cronic incompetence before, that was nothing in comparison to the incompetence if this consulate. It makes you wish you were not Colombian.

If I could give them zero stars, I would. They treat everyone like sh*t here, unless of course, they are white Americans. The consul woman is a sad little person who can't even explain the reasons why she is refusing service to many of us. She is hanging on to what little power she has and acting like she owns the world. Extremely rude. What a disgrace. I give props to the one young girl who tried to help me. But she was overruled by this wench. They don't have time to see me because they're catching up on their work and someone is taking the day off tomorrow. That's reason enough to not help me, even though I live far and took the day off to come here. 

I can't wait to renounce to my Colombian citizenship so I don't have to put up with this BS anymore. How do they expect us to be patriotic and love our country when every trip to this place reminds us of everything that's wrong with Colombia? Learn a little customer service. Get with the times. No one treats people like that anymore.

Also, funny how the positive reviews here are from people who aren't Colombian.

I applied for my cedula 18 months ago, it was misplaced and I was given an email to contact, I emailed for 6 months without a reply. When the woman finally replied, she had an attitude as if my polite frustration was not warranted and told me my cedula was there. Going to pick it up tomorrow, hopefully she didn't just say that to get me out of her hair, seemed that way. It's a 2 hour drive for me so I hope her endless incompetence doesn't ruin another day for me.
I have been to the consulate a few times, did my business and left, that was it I didn't spect any special treatment so I wasn't dessapointed.

I'm not going to give an actual rate, but I'd like to help people here get in contact with the consulate.
