reviews.text:
Visa officer (Polyanskaya Natalia Borisovna) put a lot of private feelings and frivolous even nasty way of speech.
My first question was - is it ok if my supporting letter is dated yesterday? She didnt just replyed and asked me back - how do u think and so on during a minute, but could say just yes or not.
Then she took my docs.

She - What kind of visa it actually is, hmm?!, and where is bank statements and accommodation?
I - me n my wife r going to excersise treaty rights free movement, and need not submit anything except these and under directive law stated in my supporting letter.
She - (laught shortly) alright alright there were like you law-kinda-guys, alright alright. 
Are you gonna stay or return?
I - Depends on me n wife's decision.
She - (noticed my bunch of passports in bag n said) Gimmie all yer previous n present passports.
I - for such type of visa previous passports aren't required.
She - alright alright law-man (with nasty voice tone, and asked again) R u gonna stay or return?!
I - is our right to decide and such info isn't necessary for this type of visa.
She - (laugher shortly again) Alright alright man, you keep surprising me, our officer will decide.
Then she forced me to run cross the road to make copy of marriage cert, but is okay, and returned me original.
I was genuinely positive n smiley (not over smiley n positive) and at the very end I asked to write me her name just in case (Polyanskaya Natalia Borisovna). She laughed again but now with angry face n said:
- Man you keep surprising me n I warn u that if u gonna complain I will write (sth additional from herself) on yer application, hinting that this will affect visa outcome.
Gave me paper where stated to pay 2700rubles and immediately scored it n wrote 'Gratis'
I smiled n said - No warries all good and you do your job well, have a good day, bye.

reviews.text: Liguei umas 30 vezes em uma manh√£ para falar com alguem e n√£o conseguir....eles n√£o atende o telefone, e o endere√ßo que informa n√£o √© mais o mesmo..
Best experience of my life, super fast and no hassle application process. Keep your documents in order and everything should be good. Helpful staff and quick processing!

Very unfriendly. Flew there from LA and my I phone was dead. They refused to help me charge it ( brought my charger) . Then they yelled at me when I wanted to enter the wrong door, when the Lady realized she was rude then she became very friendly. If you are already lucky enough to work in SF. Treat your clients right. Typical Swiss. Always grumpy. Michael was very very helpful on the other hand.

I needed a visa for a short trip to Switzerland. First, they need quite a bit of documents for the visa and second, their site is quite complicated so finding information is not easy. Sure, being a consulate you can work on your terms but appointments on phone only between 11 AM & 12 PM during weekdays and visa related questions only between 1 PM and 2 PM doesnt make life any easy. 

Anyhow, I got an appointment and headed there at 9 AM in the morning. Once I signed in and headed up, the elevator opened right in the consulate. The lady at the visa desk was very nice and helpful. She went through the documents and guided me on the document that I would still need. She also engaged in small talk which is a bit unusual for consulate people. I was in and out in about 15 minutes with all the information that I needed. The visa was also processed as soon as I emailed them the document. 

Overall a pretty good experience other than the issue with taking an appointment over the phone which took about 70-100 tries between 11 PM and noon on a weekday.

The only remaining public consulate in the state of California is open a total of 15 hours a week.  This is not a reflection on the individuals in the consulate and their competence.  But it is a reflection on Switzerland.

I love talking to the staff, they are polite, kind and sweet, just like all the Swiss should be. thank-you for all you do. 
best regards to all 
Swissmiss

name: Embassy of the State of Qatar in Bangkok

reviews.text: This is the best experience I've ever had at an Embassy! The place is very organized,clean and they have signs directing you to where you need to go all over the place. As soon as you step out of the elevator there are signs, telling where you need to be! Impossible to miss it!!!!! There are two receptionists and they get harassed by foreigners who wants Visa, I've seen it happened while I as there getting my Brazilian brochures! People go to their window and start yelling at them because they can't get appointments!!!! It's crazy! I'm surprise this people are even allowed in the building in the first place, I mean, if you do not have a visa appointment you should not be allowed to enter the Consulate, at least that's  how it is at most Consulates I've been. The Consulate's website is VERY CLEAR about  Visa instructions also automated message is very clear as well "they do not talk to anyone only by e-mail". Visas are not dealt in person only on the website, this is very clear!!!! I dunno why people even bother to go there to talk to receptionists!!!! Everything was very smooth I've applied online, could not get an appointment, so I've emailed the Visa department was able to get it, came in had an interview and picked up my VISA a day later! No need to talk to anyone because they are instructed to not talk to you  as it is stated on the website!!!!!!! Just do everything online DO NOT WASTE TIME GOING THERE WITHOUT AN APPOINTMENT AND TO  PUSH THEM TO GIVE YOU AN APPOINTMENT IT AIN'T HAPPENING!! After I was done I went to the reception and the receptionist, SUPER FRIENDLY, beautiful and nice gave me brochures of Brazil. She gave me detailed information about Brasil and Rio and handed me a brochure. Then while she was giving me information I saw this guy yelling at the other receptionist guy because he wanted a VISA! Finally after a couple minutes the man had to be removed from the building! Good job Brazilian Consulate! Great job to the charming receptionist lady!!!!
Great service provided by Lisia  Braga. Very compassionate. Thank you for the great service.

I neglected to get a visa for a flight today. The consulate staff was wonderful helping me through the process so I could make my flight. Fabio was very kind and helpful. Great example of Brazilian courtesy. Thanks!

Sh&*#t service. I was waiting for 1 hour and they jumped my number. So I asked mr. Giovani castilho what happend and he said was my fault, that I  was not paying attention and he could do nothing for me. I told him my number was not called and he asked:"what are you saying? We jump your number on purpose? We have things against you?" Really rude! Hope someone call him attention and tell him to do a better job.

Overrun with scammers. 
They ask for you to schedule your visa application and will give you a date 2 months into the future. But fear not! They have the kickback squad 'partners' that will process your visa in less time for 4 times the fee. If you ever been to the consulate you know that they are not that busy. Of course, now they only process visas from 10 AM to Noon. 
Scam, scam, scam. I hope they are getting enough money from their speedy processing partners that it is worth the unnecessary headache they are causing to those applying for a visa.

By going there I realised the phone goes all the time, and the receptionist does make an attempt to answer the phone. The Embassy needs a better system.
HINTS for those needing a Visa (mine was as a tourist) (I'm non-Bangladeshi).
Fill out the application form, and paste photo as requested, but take an EXTRA PHOTO.
SIGN in the Checklist section .... even though most of the points are not applicable.
I didn't need POLICE VERIFICATION.
Take a PHOTOCOPY of your flight details - they don't have a photocopier.
If you don't want to wait around 5 hrs for the visa - bring some ENVELOPES - they were the plastic white and yellow ones ? Express ?Registered - Sorry I didn't ask.
Visas are dealt with at the Embassy from 9.30am-12.30pm Mon-Fri.
When I returned to pick up my visa, I wasted 1/2 hour hanging around in the office, to be eventually told to go upstairs.

I actually got my visa - otherwise no stars

reviews.text:
i keep hearing complaints from so many friends' families there ... they are SLOW , they are COLD BLOODED CARELESS JORDANIAN STAFF ... some mentioned that they even MAKE FUN of their tragedies through their face expressions or voice tone ... others mentioned a SERIOUS CORRUPTION through asking money ( a Daf"ter ... means a book ) ( the layman language in Iraq for the 100 piece of the one hundred dollar notes , and that's equal to $ 10,000 ) to make the family's file move to the next step ( Al Taw"teen ) ... one of the guys even mentioned that they  " LOST " HIS FILE after they told him that his family was put on ( Al Taw'teen ... ) , so he was shocked and wondered " isn't all files on computers "  so , after 2 years of waiting and hope he has to start again from ground zero .... in this Easter Sunday meeting in the church , he speculated that they " sold " his file to another refugee  ...CONCLUSION ,  IN GENERAL :  MOST refugees say that the first step of refugee application is the most frustrating and they wish if the stuff were NOT JORDANIANS ....FACTS :  For most refugess, it's a daily suffering living in Jordan ... it is expensive .. No one allowed to work ... they are slowly draining their saved money or have one of their family risking his life to keep working in danger to keep money flow or worse and that's begging for help from relatives abroad ...  Waiting for the UNKNOWN mercy of the UN and other countries help ... SO !!!!! ...
MY THOUGHT :  i am not against hiring JORDANIANS to help in doing things and translation in UN mission , BUT giving them the BIGGEST ROLE specially in the first step of refugee application and LETTING THEM to decide who to accept and who to refuse to the 2nd step " AL Taw'teen " ... this is COMPLETELY NOT FAIR for refugees , it is an INVITATION for  corruption which all refugees now are talking about { and you can VERIFY THAT from refugees themselves } , it is a CAUSE FOR DELAY IN PROCESSING the applications as they do have interest ( that is a way to keep these refugees' relatives sending money and that's a source of income to Jordan )  ... 
Finally wishing the UNHCR success in their difficutl mission of getting ALL the refugees to safe heaven in any of the countries they prefer ... God Bless .... Riadh

It was by far the WORST experience I had in any restaurant in my last 27 years that I HAD to make an account to comment.

It was my 2nd time there and last time although the service was slow and rude since it was busy I thought maybe it's better when it is not. And I just wanted to have a quick drink and I'm already in the area so why not.

Today it definitely was NOT busy. I was sitting outside and only 3 tables (including mine, which is only 2 ppl) were there at 4 or 5 pm. There were seriously MORE servers than customers.

But some how my drink NEVER came. I waited like an hour without her telling me anything. She just said it's coming. I finished my food, my bf finished his drink. I still waited. Then the cocktails drink of ANOTHER table came when they ordered only 10 min ago. By this time I was furious. I just told him to get the bill and leave. He asked the server why my drink never came, and she said cuz the bartender was not there (for an hour) 

First, if you know the bartender is gonna be gone that long, YOU SHOULD LET ME KNOW. I don't need a cocktail, I can change. The thing is you didn't let me know, and made me wait SO long.

Second, they served another table BEFORE me when I ordered first, like AN HOUR before. 

Third, she was NOT sorry until my boyfriend (who is super nice and polite, usually NEVER confronts anyone) asked her WHY that she said sorry in a rude tone.

Efficient, easy and fast: 
At the moment I visited the embassy those were the fares and times:
For a tourist visa, an approval letter is not needed. Just bring a picture 4x6 white background.

VISA is issued in 24h 
1 month single entry: 60$ = 45$ (visa fee) + 15$ (processing fee)
1 month multiple entries: 85$ =  65$ + 20$
3 month single entry: 95$ = 75$ + 20$

It's possible to get it in just 1 hour (Express service) for 10$

The Washington, DC office incorrectly identified my home mortgage bill as a bank statement (for proof of residence) and even after sending 2 clarifications, I hadn't heard back from them. So I called the customer service a couple of times but they were unable to help me. Finally on the 3rd try I asked the customer service woman for a contact number to their Washington, DC office and her reply was "You can search it on google." I couldn't believe my ears that she would say that. Pathetic! Also the email in which they mentioned to me that I have the incorrect proof of address, the contact number is wrong, the email address to reply back is wrong and the link to track the passport application gives an error page! It's funny.

A Grief for a Grieve!

I had applied for my renunciation and OCI on Oct 30 2013. On Dec 12th 2013, I was advised to send in my US passport, which I did promptly! 

On Dec 27th my father unexpectedly passed away in India, I contacted BLS, and the Indian Embassy. I received an email from the Indian Embassy that my passport was given back to BLS on Dec 20th 2013 (A total of 5 business days ‚Äì my passport, an important document was kept at BLS!).  Later that morning, I was contacted by BLS NY.

I explained the situation, I told them that I lived in NJ state, and to please send my passport via FedEx same day, for which I would pay out of pocket. I called FedEx later that evening to track the package, a package that BLS did not provide me a tracking number for, even after asking the personal involved. 

After several attempts Fedex informed, me that my passport was sent via FedEx priority overnight, instead of FedEx same day, because of which my passport went first to Memphis Tennessee, before getting back to NJ. I finally received my passport on December 30th. Due to the delays and lack of sense of urgency from BLS‚Äôs end, I- the only child, missed my father‚Äôs funeral, and my last opportunity to see him! 
 
I do have the names of personals I dealt with along with email chains, however I wish not to bring it up, as I am sure nothing will be done. It has taken me a good nine months to put this in writing. I just hope no one has to go through this. 

BLS was negligent in keeping my passport for 5 business days/ 7 days in their possession. BLS staff also showed total disinterest and an actively disengaged behavior and a lack of compassion, even after knowing the severity of the situation

I had brought this to the attention of Consulate General/ OCI PIO  of India on Dec 28th 2013, who asked for a correspondence from BLS on Dec 30th.  It‚Äôs been appox 9 months and I am still waiting on a corrective action or a correspondence from BLS, as Indian consulate has placed the ball in their court! I am sure they have other priorities, as they are a government system! 

This was my experience with BLS- a non compassionate step child of the Indian Consulate!

After you make your appointment -- plan for a week or so wait -- its your pretty standard DMV experience. Go to window one, get a number, go to window two, pay, etc. A few notable items though. First, make an appointment. I think they do emergency appointments, but just plan in advance to avoid mafan. They will check at the door that you have an appointment. Second, you'll have to leave your phone/tablet at the guards station. Third, the passport office is on the third floor. I'm guessing there's an elevator somewhere for those that need it, but you're directed to the stairs. Finally, US passports require a different size photo than what's indicated at photo booths. I had a few "passport" sized pix and none were adequate. They have a photo booth on the first floor near the exit, but it's fussy about bills and probably better to go to the Family Mart across the lane to get change and your photo. It's also 50 NT cheaper at Family. All together, though, the AIT staff is friendly and helpful enough.

I had a great experience. I was in and out in less than 35 minutes. Everyone was friendly, helpful and knowledgable. They have signs everywhere, making the whole process clear. There were also many employees which made it quick and painless. Make sure you set up an appointment online first. The photo machine in AIT wasn't accepting bills, otherwise I would have given 5 stars.

Very useless for Americans. They will not let you enter unless you've made an appointment in advance. If you call to make an appointment, they will refer you to their website for answers and tell you there isn't anyone there that can help. They're not a real embassy and they act like it.

don't bother to call this place, they cannot even tell you what's the office hour.  That said, if you want first-hand experience on American government's bureaucracy, give it a try, you wont be disappointed!

Be careful going here for help if your an American. They are completely incompetent at handling the basics of paperwork, and communicating effectively. It's so bad that when you call them they don't even have an mail box for you to leave a message, the phone just rings off the hook. And if they do tell you in person that they will call you, it's a lie. They are simply just telling you what you want to hear to get you to go away. The other location down south might be more helpful for your needs.

reviews.text:
I was here in 2013. The reason I'm reviewing it now is because of my totally contrasting experience with the US Consulate in Chennai. 

I was at the embassy for my first time ever visa (B1/B2 for a conference) in March, and then for a J1 visa in August , 2013. Both times  the way the people were treated and the numbers controlled was orderly and done by polite staff. After lining up outside on the pavement we were allowed in based on interview timing. The grounds are beautiful and at each step there was plenty of seating. They follow a token system and after taking the token also you can sit and wait until you are called to the counter. 

For my tourist visa I was given a white slip and within a few hours of my interview I received an email from the consulate requesting necessary information indicating they are prompt and efficient. They also did keep my passport, but I got it back with the visa in 3 weeks. In August my J1 visa was approved at my interview and I got my passport back in a few days. 

Overall, I think the way the process is handled here - the way the interview candidates are handled, the seating and orderly token system- makes for a smooth experience.

Waiting time is unbearable and there is nearly no indication on the amount of time one will have to wait before being attended. Overall staff is friendly and less arrogant than it used to be in the past. Improvements can be made in the queue management system if one were to provide an estimated time of attendance. In addition ticket owners should have the possibility to remotely inquire the queue management system in order to allow them to manage the waiting time in a useful way (in my very specific case I arrived at 07:30, got ticket number 35 when the doors opened at 08:00 but only was serviced at 14:30) Although the situation is less worse than it was years ago, there is still a lot of room for improvement.

Am avut nevoie de pasaport pentru fetita mea. Doi ani de zile am asteptat pana fetita a revenit in Canada. 
Niste vaci idioate angajate pe pile. Au avut tupeul sa ma sune in Canada, oare pe ai cui bani si sa imi spuna ca nu au inteles, probabil nu vorbesc Engleza bine. Ele sunt niste analfabete. Sunt traducator de meserie, vorbesc Engleza fluent si alte trei limbi straine. Apoi cand a venit mama, chestionau salariile noastre. Eram la inceput. Nu oricine are salariu de nabab ca ele, pe nemerit. Acum facem bani buni, dar mama venise la inceput. Sa le vad eu pe ele ce salariu ar avea la o luna sau doua de Canada. Niste scarbe ordinare, romance, la ce ne putem astepta, vipere. 
Toate merita sa fie date afara. Numai fumuri au in ele si nimic consistent. Toape.

este o urgenta vreau sa stiu daca a ajuns analizele copilului meu din canada in ambasada canadei la bucuresti copilul se numeste asan albert nascut la data de 13 octombrie 1997 eu sint mama copilului sintem toata familia lui stabiliti in canada si asteptam cu mare nerabdare sa primim rezidenta lui ca sa il aducem alaturi de noi in canada va rog din suflet dati mi un raspuns cit mai urgent daca se afla la dvs . analizele copilului pentru ca mia spus imigratia de aici din canada ca le au trimis analizele la ambasada  din romania copilul trebuie sa faca analizele la bucuresti si dupa aceea sa primeasca rezidenta ca sa poata veni aici in canada va rog intelege ti ma  ca sint o mama care nu isi vede copilul de 4 ani si este minor nu are cine sa il ingrijeasca parintii mei sint bolnavi dzeu sa va dea tot ce doriti multa sanatate si succes in toate ajutati ma ca nu stiu ce sa mai fac nu mai am rabdare  verifica ti  daca au ajuns la dvs actele copilului meu si dati mi si mie un raspuns va rog din suflet cit mai urgent  .... hermina  .va multumesc ....

Daca va faceti iluzii ca angajatii MAE sau de la ambasade vor raspunde apelurilor dvs. patetice, chiar disperate, atunci dati un telefon acolo. Va raspunde un robot care va comunica ca ei isi optimizeaza timpul si nu se complica sa vorbeasca direct cu "pulimea".
De altfel informatiile nu sunt actualizate, vezi si faptul ca ambasada SUA s-a mutat de multisor intr-o fortareatza in nordul orasului, dar pe site figureaza la vechea adresa.
Pentru ei suntem carne de tun si platitori de taxe si impozite.
Succesuri.

Last time when my passport expired in 2012, it took me about 3 hours of queuing time to get my new machine readable passport. Not the best but still much better than I expected. Now that it's up for renewal again in 2015, I went back to extend my passport. I got queue no. From embassy website 1 week before. My queue no. Was 109. Although it says on the queue printout to come at 8 am, I got to the embassy around 8.30am. The counter 1 and 2 was serving 108 so I was just in time. so I recommend that if your queue no. Is 101 to 108, please go at 8am. It took only 3-5 mins there, just checking documents and pay service fee of 20 sgd. Then, next is to take photo for new passport. There is no more extension system for passports. They will issue a new passport with a new number. They were having a technical issue with the printer so I had to wait for photo , fingerprints for about 20 mins. The actual duration for this is only about 5 mins. Once this is done , I had to wait to be called from another counters -5 or 6. Since the people in front of me with queue no. were not around , I got served after a few minutes only !! :) .. The guy at this counter just took the documents in, asked to see original singapore PR card and previous tax recept (tax paid till dec 2011). And a few minutes later, he just told me to come back at 3 pm for passport collection with 35 dollars fee. So the entire process took less than 45 mins and 55 dollars !! So shocked and impressed pleasantly how quick the process is !!! So happy !! Thanks to the great embassy staff . Even faster than the wait time when I went to ICA for loss of PR card!! Well done and keep up the good work !!! Just FYI, if you forgot to bring copies , you can make copies at the self service copier machine for 40 cents. If you don't have original tax receipt ( lost or left in Myanmar or in Myanmar for other reasons, for example )  please have it print out by the embassy with a fee of 8 dollars rather than paying a fine of 20 dollars. You will need this tax document everytime you go to Myanmar embassy so it's more economical at 8 dollar for new print of the tax receipt. This info is shared by the friendly lady at counter 1 as a more economical option. I agree with her! Currently, my experience at Myanmar embassy is much better than those at American or Thai embassy ! As other reviews, the opportunity for improvement will be to make the passport collection before 12 noon or have the option to come back on the weekend to collect. Currently we have to take 1 full day leave waiting for the processing but the actual time in embassy is now less than 2 hours. So if there's an option to collect on weekend ( pay all the fees in one go than wait till collection to pay 35 dollars for new passport ), it would be much better. But I understand this is not easy to implement. For visa application at other Foreign embassies, they also ask to come back for collection. The other way is to email in the documents in advance and pay fees online so that you just need to go in to collect new passport or have it sent via Singpost. Singaporean passports are applied via mail anyways. The last suggestion I have , may not be for embassy but the immigration system. It would be better if our passport validity is 10 years. 4-5 years is too short for people nowadays who live and work abroad.

The service of Myanmar embassy has improved slightly. However there are many areas that needs to be improved well. 
- Getting online appointment: the website maintenance is very poor, could not go through to get the online appointment. Realised that there are many people facing the same problem when I reached to the embassy. The boys at q ticket counter 3 are repeatedly telling the people to do things like; use enter key/ space key etc.. to go through when doing online appointment. Instead they should raise the issue to the officer (I am sure officer are aware as well) and try to maintain the website well. Now people are unnecessarily wasting their time getting online appointment in front of computer and end up paying 30 dollars to get on the spot appointment at embassy.
- The embassy building is not using effectively: with the new extension of the building, there are more counter to serve the people. However, the arrangement is funny and not up to the standard. I was wondering why upstairs of the building is not using to serve for our people? If the staff are staying there, embassy should provide accommodation in other area for the staff. The whole building should renovate and utilize fully for the service.
- The rules for purpose renewal service are not properly stated either in the website or at the embassy eg., dependent passport policy; what are the criteria needed to make dependent passport.

I've visited this office few times to register my baby's birth, apply for a police certificates, apply for the dual citizenship  etc. and I've contacted them many times over the phone and I had no problems whatsoever... Every time when I contact them over the phone regarding something, they tried to explain very clearly and patiently what needs to be done... you can't ask more than that... superb service...

I can't imagine how they manage the amount of work with such a low number of staff, They have to answer so many phone calls, have to fill up large piles of forms etc etc.

It's a shame that some people complain about their English, attitude and even about not answering the phone as soon as they ring them... They don't run a call center... you have to call few times, during office hours, just like any other phone if someone is not answering the phone

 I saw some comments down here even the staff members are uneducated people... I have a doubt about those ones' education... Those who complain about these things are simply very "SELFISH", they can't understand another persons difficulties... they think only about themselves... 

and remember, ability to talk in English is only an indication of his/her English knowledge.

That's not an indication of someones intellectual level.. that's a very big mistake we do as Sri Lankans,....

Most of us (Sri Lankans specially sinhalese) think that If someone is able to talk better in English, he's an educated person, if someone's English is bad, he's not educated... hilarious...  

I've seen some of the "Kalu suddo" yelling at them few times... I know very well how they behave with "actual suddo"... simply just can not type "bad words" here... 

They might not speak the best English you've ever heard, they might not answer the phone as soon as you ring their office, they might not provide most polite customer service you've ever experienced... they are also just a bunch of our fellow Sri Lankans... they are just like us.... 

 think about the service they provide us... think about the amount of work they carry out... think about the no. of telephone calls they have to answer... Finally they are just human beings...

reviews.text:
The LORD gave me a message to take to the peoples of the earth: every tongue, tribe, & nation, in 2006. I took His Word very seriously & traveled to Houston to deliver to the consulates, including the Chinese. The female consulate received me well. She was extraordinarily respectful & thanked me for coming & sharing. A great blessing went forth that day.

The Message from the Holy One known instantly as Father & Truth, "It's too late! Go now! Gather as many as humanly possible to Me, by the hand in love."  

The only negative thing that happened was that my car got towed because I parked in the shopping center parking lot next door & it cost $200 to get back. But the Lord is faithful to handle the cost of every matter because God loves us enough to give His Son for us.

Well the atmosphere of this place is like a typical government building, they're all business so if you're expecting a smiling face and great customer service you'll leave disappointed. A couple of things I learned while getting my visa besides your application must be typed and you must have a copy of the information page of your passport is 1) If you are not traveling directly to China you must have a print out of all of your flights going to China and leaving China. For example, I had all the itinerary info for my flights for Houston to Tokyo, Tokyo to Seoul, Seoul to Beijing, and then Beijing back to Houston. Also, you must have a print out of the places you will be staying at whether it's a hotel or air bnb. 2) If you have the time, show up at least 30 minutes before they open to avoid a long wait otherwise you'll most likely be there for about an hour. 3) There is no expedited service but I dropped mine off Tuesday afternoon and got it Friday.  Hope this helps.

Went around 1:30pm on a Friday and waited about 30 minutes in the application line. Staffs were friendly. Make sure to bring a photocopy of your passport information. If you forget, they have a copier that you can use for 25cents/copy(I think it only accepts quarters). Make sure to have your invitation letter in a paragraph format. You only pay when picking up your visa which you can pay with a visa credit card.

I had a great and fast experience! It was my first time there make sure you have a copy of ALL your materials including your passport and bring quarters if you need to make a copy they have a copier. I was out of there in 50 minutes due to the long line of people but they work pretty quickly.

I required 1 passport photocopy of the picture page.  1 visa picture. 1 photocopy of my thai entry stamp in my passport. 1 (4 page) application (available at the office). 1 flight itinerary for the duration of my stay in China.  1 hotel itinerary for the duration of my stay in China and 1 letter stating why i want to visit China (they hand you a copy of the letter then ask that you print it at the minimart on the 2nd floor 10baht). If you require photocopies the guard inside the office does them for 3 Baht.  Great deal. Friendly Staff.

reviews.text: Being French myself, I'm shameful that this embassy represents me and my country. I had to deal with them in order to have my marriage (done in the US) recognized in France and my experience with them turned out to be a nightmare. I called them prior to sending my application and almost got called stupid by a very obnoxious receptionist. I then submitted my application and got the whole package back in my mail box 1 week with my application denied because of a document being not original enough to their liking. Any normal embassy would have called me to let me know instead of shipping the whole thing back and make me lose 60USD of shipping fees but I guess this as good of a service as they can offer to their citizens...

I just called at 2.50 pm. today. The receptionist was very polite and right away a gentleman took the call. This gentleman was very courteous. I called about a matter which concerned me. He took the time to explain everything to me in very simple words. He was very pleasant and I was delighted with his services. After our conservation I had no more concerns.

Ok so here is my experience with the french consulate. At the beginning I felt as if they were rude, but then I put myself in their shoes. They receive hundreds of visa applications and calls. So they are trying to be  fast as possible when they ask you to read everything is because they know that you actually skipped some important parts. I went to get my visa and this was my first time ever filling these type of paper work. (In my country my parent's secretary used to filled them up for me( yeah I was super spoiled)) so I was proud of myself. But then they told me  that there was some documents missing, so I went back and I still was missing a letteR, but this one I promise I had it before. I was shaking because time was clicking and I need the visa asap  . She gave me the chance to go print out the paper (again) and come back. I am so grateful for this and honestly it felt good to do this paperwork with people that really make you read every single thing.

Fantastic experience!
I had to apply urgently and apparently all the spots for the interview were taken in advance.
Consulate workers were extremely nice and understanding to a degree that they could accomodate me and provide a spot, not to mention that I got my visa in 4 days.
It took me about 20 mins and then I just received my visa by overnight Fedex.
Thank you so much to wonderful people working there!

Corrupt. An American government office that has fallen under the corruption of the country it is located in. Visas are not issued on merit. Well qualified applicants, with very strong ties to their home country (university, home-owner, employed etc.) are continuously denied. They want you to pay the $160 fee, again and again... a pay to play system. As an American, I am absolutely ashamed that the people in that office represent me.

As I understand it, they are wrong on the law. They said that if I lose my next passport that I might not get another one. A US attorney tells me otherwise citing a Supreme court ruling on the matter. They also told me that my temporary passport which was the 1 year replacement passport wasn't in perfect shape (I've been traveling for a year) and continued to warn me that my passport was not MY property but the property of the US government. Whatever, I paid for it and I have a right to it.

La sala √® degna del peggior ospedale pubblico con bambini che urlano, sbattono il distributore e gli agenti che urlano i nomi degli appuntamenti peggio che ad una asta del pesce (quando il monitor tra l'altro c'√® ma non lo vogliono usare). 
Se prendete un appuntamento potete anche arrivare tranquillamente un'ora dopo,perch√© lavorare in orario proprio non se ne parla.
Io ho chiesto vari appuntamenti allo sportello visti e dopo avermi detto che mancavano dei documenti ma che quelli portati andavano bene, prendo tutti i documenti e compro biglietti aerei e assicurazione. A questo punto vado e salta fuori che l'universit√† scelta che prima mi avevano approvato, ora non gli va  pi√π bene (pur essendo iscritta al MEC e tutto) perch√© a quanto pare se avete studiato allo scientifico allora non potete andare a studiare Risorse umane, (logico no?). Quinidi con una faccia di merda e stupide insinuazioni, il signor Emerson a cui piace giocare a fare Dio, mi dice di cambiare paese! Io, sinceramente una persona pi√π idiota non l'ho mai incontrata: pensate che alla mia affermazione di aver gi√† comprato il biglietto, lui mi ha risposto dicendo che non volevano il biglietto, ma la prenotazione del biglietto, che ovviamente non √® la stessa cosa eh signor Emerson?
Vorrei anche dire che la lista dei documenti da portare √® molto fuorviante e talune richieste non hanno senso, solo farvi spendere tempo e soldi. Se a questo ci aggiungete che fanno saltare fuori richieste a loro piacimento!
Riassumendo tutto, dico solo che siete dei PAGLIACCI RIDICOLI! Anche i vostri connazionali vi schifano, fatevi un esame di coscienza e un corso di educazione. Un giorno vi torner√† tutto indietro e  non potrete che guardarvi allo specchio.

La Costituzione del Principato delle Due Sicilie

Il Principato riconosce l'obbedienza al Re di Spagna e al Regno di Spagna.

Art.1) Il Popolo √® sovrano assoluto e come rappresentanza istituzionale ha un Monarca , che nelle sue prerogative regna ma non governa, ma ha diritto di veto su ogni cosa e persona facente parte del Regno .

Art.2) Il Governo √® retto da 12 Ministri o Principi. A conclusione di ciascuna carica, per la durata di 5 anni, possono essere rieletti dal Popolo.

Art.3) Il Popolo Sovrano, vota le proposte di legge dei Ministri, le quali saranno da considerarasi effettive previo consenso di maggioranza della popoloazione espressa nel 50% piu uno.

Art.4) Il Popolo Sovrano √® espressione assoluta di volont√†. Qualsivoglia approvazione di legge potr√† ritenersi definitiva solo con il consenso della maggioranza.

Art.5) La donna ha pari diritti dell'uomo.

Art.6) E‚Äô facolt√† inderogabile del Regno negare o ritirare la cittadinanza a tutti coloro che abbiano commesso un delitto contro la Natura e gli esseri viventi.

Art. 7) Assoluto rispetto, tutela, protezione √® dato a tutti coloro che in nome di una libera professione politica o religiosa chiedano la protezione del Regno.

Art.8) Ad ogni residente, Cittadino, √® fatto obbligo assoluto di rispettare la Natura in ogni sua forma e manifestazione. E' assolutamente proibita la caccia e la pesca se non ai fini sportivi ma senza nuocere o procurare la morte. E' divieto assoluto nuocere a tutti gli esseri viventi.

Art.9) La tutela dell‚Äôambiente √® da considerarsi bene primario e andranno incentivate tutte le risorse e le ricerche volte a migliorare la qualit√† di vita nel rispetto assoluto dell‚Äôambiente. L'utilizzo delle risorse naturali √® assolutamente gratuito. La terra e le sue risorse sono beni comune ed esulano da qualsivoglia propriet√† se non quella del Popolo Sovrano.

Art.10) Il diritto al Lavoro √® un fondamento primario e va tutelato in ogni sua forma ed espressione, nessuna imposta √® dovuta allo stato sui proventi del lavoro perch√® frutto dell‚Äôopera e l‚Äôingegno dell‚Äôessere Umano.

Art.11) Il Regno Italico, esalta √® incoraggia l‚ÄôArte in ogni sua forma ed espressione, ritenendola massimo esempio dell‚Äôinnalzamento dello Spirito verso il Divino. Ogni forma di cultura, religione, credo, osservanza politica , provenienza territoriale, razza ed etnia √® totalmente accettata e protetta dalle leggi del nostro Stato del Popolo Sovrano.

Art.12) Lo studio √® obbligo fino alla maggiore et√† e diritto di tutti essendo alla base della formazione di ogni essere umano pertanto non √® applicabile alcuna tassa o imposta.

Art. 13) La libert√† di espressione √® alla base di ogni rapporto umano cosi come la libera propaganda e diffusione delle proprie idee.

I am giving it full stars because the people working at the consulate were very helpful and genuinely seemed to care about the people applying for the documents.  The security guard was especially friendly, supportive, and informative; he gave me excellent advice about scheduling my appointment using the online system (look for open appointments from 9-10am every morning).

Just to note.  The website was a little confusing because each necessary item was not numbered/bulleted, instead the required items were written one line after another with explanatory text in between.  So if you are applying for a long-term visa be sure to carefully read all the text.

Obtaining a visa was pleasant and easy. Monsieur S. Fortune, the delightful security officer at the entrance was extremely helpful!  I was missing one clearance for my Visa, and he directed me to the right office.  The Consulate is now requiring an FBI Clearance, (this was not mentioned on the internet instructions I downloaded for my long term stay Visa so be sure you get this before you take in your paperwork).  When I returned with my clearance two days later, Mr. Fortune remembered me, greeted me, and then sent me off with good wishes.  A wonderful experience .... now ... off to France!

Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful!!!

I had been to so many Consulates till today for European visas and the French Consulate is by far the best. Very polite, understanding staff. Steven was wonderful.  Thanks to Jacqueline, she made my day:-))

The staff are really courteous and make sure you have a smooth process. The security guard Stephen is the most impressive of all. He sees to it that you remain calm and helps you out no matter what the situation is. If there's some issue with your documents or the appointment timing, he gives you really wise suggestions and they will most certainly work !
The visa officials are quick and polite as well. Most of the staff at the consulate are patient.

See to it that you have all the required documents and you'll definitely have a nice visit there, with no stress at all.

reviews.text: Amezing

Don't worry if you're going to the consulate. The bad reviews may be scary, but most of them seem to be rather old, so it's likely that the consulate reformed. I had a great experience!!

I was scared going in after reading the reviews. I was very pleasantly surprised when the consulate turned out to be amazingly friendly. They helped me with everything I needed and I was done within the hour. I should mention that I went to request my first Spanish passport after nationalizing.

They don't take the phone. Spent nearly 4 hours to get information from them. Suspiciously, the phone conversation gets drop and you have to try to call them again (most of the times they don't take it and they don't call you back if something happens).
Once on the consulate, they require you the data, but don't solve any of your additional questions. Really bad experience

I called for a last minute passport renewal and they made an urgent appointment for the next day so me, my wife and my daughter were registered and my daughter's passport renewal were processed.
We received some scolding for doing this in the last minute but to be honest it's true that we should have registered in advance; anyway, I think that it would have been a much nicer experience if they do the same without demonstrating how much annoys them that we didn't do our job on time; I'd have appreciated their help the same and have felt much better.
To compare, I've been a few times in NYC consulate and people there seem to be happier doing their job.
Anyway, they did the job very fast, efficiently and without making us to wait for a regular appointment so the experience is almost 5 stars.

I called the office and they send you to an extension where they never pick up the phone. You call just for information and they are not knowledgeable. 

Their attitude is very rude. They get upset if you question them and want to end the call as soon as they can. 

This is not the impression I have of Spaniards but the people representing them in the USA are simply not qualified to be there.

FYI My question was regarding Parejas de Hecho. If Anyone has information on this legislature that could come in handy I'd deeply appreciate it.

At first after reading so many terrible reviews to admit I was a bit nervous to have to come here for my visa. I had an early morning appointment. Literally right when they opened at nine. I also had all the necessary papers in order, which I think really helped the process. I was able to get in and out within 45 min. And even had a nice conversation with the person whom did my paperwork. Over all I really had an easy time of it. Posting this review just so others don't get worried over all the bad reviews before they go here.

I went in last September with my son to get him register to become Portuguese Citizen and the only bazaar thing was that after paying over $300 dlrs for the certificate they sent me down to buy an envelope with a stamp. I think they should charge $2 more and have supplies on hand and be more organized. Any ways this was not to bad. I had no problems with the rest. I had  been told  my son would need the parents marriage certificate, witch I order from Portugal and did not need. It was very easy; my son got the certificate 2 weeks later,  now he's getting the ID card and than applies for the passport. We're going there tomorrow and this time I'm going prepared with envelopes and stamps.

Concluding for people who need information; It does not matter how old you are, as long you're parents are Portuguese, you can obtain your Portuguese certificate. You just have to follow the right steps; certificate, ID card, and last the passport.

name: The Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Harare

reviews.text: I recently renewed my passport. I did not need to send my original passport. I just sent necessary documents and photo copy of my old passport. It's so easy to renew! They were on time and I really like their service. Many people complain about their customer service that they don't pick up the phone. But whenever i called them, they always picked up the phone. The lady on the phone was well-behaved which is also contradictory that i heard before calling them. She answered all the questions very gently. I was not expecting this much great service after going through the reviews. Don't believe on them always, experience yourself first!

Recently  I have renewed my passport. I have got the new passport on time and they did communication with me. I am impresses with their behavior and services. It seems like they are here for providing best services to the Bangladeshi citizens. They improved their services a lot. Good luck for the future.

Good factors:
1. They put a good effort to help the fellow Bangladeshis
2. They will give your passport as soon as they can (mine came in in 36 days and they said it may take 45+ days and mine already expired for a month when I reapplied).
3. When in phone they give you every detail and is to the point about the conversation
4. They actually are available through mail. Not all embassy's do that. Some countries you have to fly to the embassy to get your stuff done.
5. They actually are available to take in your application and doesn't lose it or ignore it.

Bad factors:
1. Took a month to get them over phone call.  Is mostly busy/quick over phone call so you better be quick with phone calls and be ready with GOOD questions.
2. Does not update the statuses of the passports and the papers online.
3. Little to no response with emails or online.
4. No receipt or anything sent or any alert that the application was received and in process. We send money to them so at least that can be expected.

I want to appreciate the help from them and the work they do because it is a real tough department to be in if you are a government official. Unlike us they do not receive the salary, training or benefits of USA or private companies. So please be understanding when they are impatient or irritated. I do admit the communication isn't good and they need improvement on that and also they need more people there so each can maintain different departments there like online, main office, phone calls, the work they do in general. I think the issue is more of the staffing and the fact the the applications has to go to Bangladesh and you can't just have those done in US instead. But they do deserve 4 star because their effort. Plus knowing Bangladeshi culture, law and everything we take things for granted when we come here. Come on, we don't have as much resources there as people have in first world countries, try to remember that.

I'm not sure why people posted bad reviews..but my personal experience was great! My husband and I went early to wait outside around 7:30am (they open at 8:00), and that made the whole process go by very quickly for me because I was second in line. Everything went smoothly...first security, then waiting to give documents to the first window you are called up to, which if you have all prepared is super easy. Then waited again to be called to another window for my interview...the interviewer was the nicest, asked me straight forward questions, went by fast and was easy. All the staff was helpful and friendly. Whole process took about an hour.

Don't expect them to keep the appointment time from interview letter. The only saving grace is the beautiful 19th floor view of the town that takes away from the otherwise grim experience.

So first of all people don't get scared reading the reviews.. I applied for a visitor visa at the VAC in NYC (address is 290 Madison Ave between 40th and 41st, not the consulate building) and got it a day over a week later. The staff were great at explaining everything and even showed me options for places to type and print out forms. Now you have to understand the process of submitting it takes a couple hours but overall easiest and fastest visa process I've experienced!

All done within 3 weeks. I applied for visitor visa online. The application got approved within 10 days, then i submitted passport same day overnight. The passport was accepted at CSC VAC and send to Canada visa office in couple of days. Canada visa office processed in 2-3 days and send back to CSC VAC. They sent passport to USPS same day and it got delivered very next day to me.
Earlier i was scared after going through so many negative review. I am happy with the processing time.

Kamusta mga Kababayan!
Galing ako dyan kahapon at eto ang aking mga napuna na sana huwag masamain ng kahit na sino at para lang makatulong sa mga may balak din pumunta sa Emabassy.
1. May street parking, magdala k ng maraming quarters. OR may malapit na parking "Colonial Parking" sa 1625 Masschussettes Ave pwede lakarin.
2. Nirerenovate ang building (dec 2015 to fall 2016), may maliit na office sa gilid na may nakapalibot na puting tolda - doon kayo pumunta.
3. Kumuha agad ng number. May pulang number dispenser katabi ng teller window sa kaliwa. UNLESS pipick up ka ng passport, hindi mo n kailangan ng number, dumiretso ka agad sa teller kahit may ibang nakapila, at iabot mo yung pick-up receipt.
4. Siguraduhin po ninyo na kumpleto kayo sa documents. Nakalista sa website ang mga requirements. AT magdala din kayo ng mga copy. May xerox machine sila na tumatanggap ng coins kung gusto nyo doon nalang (walang naka-stationed n empleyado para tumulong s xerox machine)
5. Pag tinawag ang number mo, lapit ka na sa window.
6. Mag iinitay ka ulet tawagin ang PANGALAN mo para magbayad naman. CASH basis lang sila at money order.
7. Pagkabayad, intay tawagin ang pangalan para sa picture (Kung para sa passport ang dinayo mo doon).
8. Pagkapicture at finger print, TAPOS NA. Pwede ka na umuwi.

TUMATAGAL lang kasi
- puro kwentuhan. Yung mga lumalapit sa window ay nakikipag kwentuhan pa sa mga empleyado.
- kulang sila sa tao. 2 lang ang nasa window. 1 cashier. 1 taga kuha ng picture. 
- kung kulang kulang ang documents mo OR hindi ka pa manlang nagfifil up ng necessary forms upon arrival mo doon edi pagtinawag ang number mo by then mo palang gagawin lahat sa harap ng teller.
-nakikipag away pa yung iba. Kung tataasan mo sila ng boses, gagamitan ka nila ng mic at sasagutin ka nila. Mukang masusungit, pero tutulungan nila kayo. Si kuya sa window 1, hindi ko nakuha name nya- nakasalamin may bigote balingkinitang katawan - Napakaraming natulungan, lumalabas pa siya para mag assist.

Nature ng pinoy ang matulungin, empleyado man o hindi ay may tutulong sayo doon. Huwag lang po sana pairalin ang init ng ulo.

3 stars lang rate ko kasi:
- Ang tagal naman ng building renovation timeline.
- Lakihan ang mga signs. 
- Magdagdag po sana ng empleyado.
- 3 hours average wait time.
- may lunch break announcement letter sa poste (open lang sila 9-12:30 at 1:30-5), again kulang sa tao na pwede humalili sa gustong mag break. Dumating ako 2pm na, so hindi ko inabutan ito, nabasa ko lang, ewan ko kung nangyari nga.
- 8 to 12 weeks ang processing ng passport. Walang same day or 2 weeks, Huwag ipilit.. gagamitan ka ng mic. hehehe.

reviews.text: Tammy was very professional and extremely attentive to every email I sent to her when she worked as my divorce attorney. She was recommended to me by a close friend that had used her as well. I decided to use Tammy solely on the recommendation by my friend. I asked alot of questions and am typically a person that expects alot. Tammy exceeded my expectations in every way. Tammy was able to get my case moved up and completed within a couple days. I was very happy with her as my attorney. I would highly recommend her to anyone looking to get great service and immediate attention to their case.

Honestly the worst law firm I've ever seen. Used them off a recommendation from some one I later found out never used them. They were handling my wife's immigration and started by telling us how horrible a position we were in, scaring us, and raising their prices. They almost missed our filling date out of sheer incompetence. Me and my wife did all the firm's ourselves. They charged 2500 just to mail it. 

After the filing they were no where to be found. We asked for consultation to know what to expect in our immigration interview and they flat out stated "we have no idea what they'll ask" which tells me they've never done this before. When we asked for any help they said they "have no idea how that whole process works". 

Worst law firm ever. Sheer incompetence at best crooks at worst.

She was extremely helpful and well organized throughout the whole process. She prepared all the documents fast and correct, always answering all the questions I had and was constantly updating me on progress. I have a lot of trust in her work and highly recommend her for any of your legal needs.

I went in to apply for my business visa. You need to have an appointment and the security person was expecting me. Within 10 mins, my turn arrived. The staff took just one pic and returned the other. Everything was in order and the staff was nice. Collection of passport in 5 working days. Plz carry cash, preferably with change to avoid delay.

Horrible Service. EXTREMELY INFLEXIBLE.

Severely understaffed yet No Sense of Urgency. They have short working hours. God knows what they are doing (Especially when they close at 11.30hrs on Fridays). 

No proper follow-ups on Emails. Approximate waiting time for a Visa is about 6 weeks. Expedition is not even possible regardless how many times you chase them.

I think the best thing is to call the ambassador to get things going...

I had a terrible experience at this embassy when I attempted to apply for the Schengen visa.  The staff was not only inefficient, but also rude!

I have a wedding to attend in Poland in early Sep, since my first entry to EU is Frankfurt.  So, as instructed on their web site, I booked my visa appointment online (with one month wait), filled in the application form and prepared a hug stack of required documents.

The visa officer took one look at my application form, and then handed me a pre-printed note - saying that since Germany is NOT my main destination, he could not process my application.
I was shocked: how could I miss this? "Where was this specified online" I asked. It took them 5 minutes to find it in the FAQ section.
With a grin on his face, he waved me off!

This makes no sense!
Why don't they add a warning message in red  as part of this online appointment booking web site?

I certainly don't want to waste their time, but I hope my time and effort are being respected too!

*** Update ***
After calling and emailing the embassy for three days, I got an email from them re-stating the rules.
I tried to cancel my flight with Lufthansa, NOT to my surprise, my trip was not refundable.
You could guess which country I have the least desire to visit and/or do business with.

reviews.text: WASTE OF TIME!! USELESS! I have been waiting 14 months for my passport and still not a WORD. They don't answer emails or reply to your phone calls. Not sure what to do at this point. USELESS!
Thank you very much, Ms. Fontelera, for helping with my mother's, Penelope Grobler, paperwork. I appreciate your constant effort and communication.

In the past several months we have been in constant contact with Ms. Fontelera on the phone and email. She has always returned our calls and emails promptly. We have found her to be patient and professional. We can highly recommend the Los Angeles South African Consulate.

-Mrs. Penelope Grobler- Bolega
-Mr. Matthew Kreischer
Salt Lake City, UT

In contrast to the other two reviews, I must say that my experience working with the South African consulate in Los Angeles was fantastic. Every time I called they answered, and the man I talked to about my Visa application was extremely kind and professional. They called before sending our passports back because we only sent one return envelope for two passports, and in general worked with us actively to make sure everything was in order. To top it off, we were working with a pretty tight time frame--we sent off our applications about two weeks before our departure date because it took us a while to get all our materials together. We got our passports sent back with plenty of time to spare. Really, I don't understand the other two reviews; especially the earliest one. Why did the person apply for a Visa to go to the World Cup? South Africa automatically gives every US citizen a 90 day tourist Visa when they enter the country--I've done it four times myself. Whatever the case, this consulate was fine to work with and I think they deserve a good review.

update #4: thursday night--no sign of my papers being sent UPS return.  heading to LA tomorrow to HOPEFULLY pick up my paperwork, although I don't have much hope of that working out to well. i can't wait until they close at noon tomorrow to find out whether they sent it in the morning because if they didn't, i have to wait until monday to go there to try to get it and i leave monday.  $500 to change my plane tickets if i don't get my paperwork.  GRRRRRRR!
update#3:got through to someone yesterday without calling too many times.  she said they would be working on Monday's deadlines yesterday (Wednesday) and that my daughter's paperwork would be sent out yesterday or today.  it's today--afternoon--and it has not been sent out yet.  going to call tomorrow 9-12! and tell them i am driving 2 hours to Los Angeles to pick it up because they aren't going to be working on it over the week-end and i want it in my hands before Monday.
update #2: after many many tried i finally got through to someone yesterday--but they had no information for me.  asked if i had sent a return envelope (i did) and asked for my phone number and said they would let the consular know i called, then they hung up.  the study abroad company we are working with said, oh yeah, that happens to us all the time too.  so i am spinning my wheels trying to call (at the study abroad company's urging) only to find out that even if you do get through, you probably won't get any answers!  
update: today it is TWO rings then busy signal.  at least it is a change! phone message says to check the consular services on the website--this page is not there.  so not only can you not get through by phone, they do not respond to emails, and their website for consular services does not currently exist.  supposed to be leaving next monday for SA.  what are the chances?

We have not been able to get a response from this consulate--two different email addresses used, no response.  phone calls ring 4 times then go to busy signal--have tried several different days, during their business hours.  pressing 0 for operator goes right to a voice message system saying operator is unavailable.  we sent my daughter's paperwork in for a student visa  on dec 30 and have yet to hear anything or get the paperwork back.  she leaves soon and things better turn around fast or we are losing a lot of tuition and plane fare. this is very frustrating!!

The Thai Consulate has improved a lot over the last few years.  If you ring them you will get a recorded message saying they will ring back.  They do so within a few hours and are very helpful.

They will email the forms necessary for the visa (etc) which you wish to apply for.  As will visa applications for all countries you have to provide the exact documents they require, but the staff are very helpful in guiding you through this.

You will need to leave your passport there and then pick it up during a fixed period on Mondays or leave a self addressed envelope with them (prepaid registered) so they can post it back to you.

I have visited Thailand for several months every year for over a decade.  As I have a Thai wife I can apply for a multiple entry spouse visa which allows me to simply register with Immigration in Thailand every 90 days to extend my stay.  No need for a border visa run and no requirement to prove your income but you do need a written invitation from your Thai wife  to stay there.

In and out. As long as you have all the required documents you will be fine. There are a myriad of resources on the internet that will tell you exactly what you need before you go in. Just make sure to have your application typed out and printed (nothing hand-written,) have a photocopy of your passport, and know that if you're going for visa services it's in a different location than the main consulate (at Erie/state.) Efficiency is appreciate. Sure, there may be some waiting involved (it would be a lot less if people applying had their sh!t together)...sure they might be "rude," but I can't imagine the number of metal midgets they have to deal with on a daily basis.

The Chinese Consulate was fine. My waiting time wasn't long. The only complaint I had was that the copying machine was out of service and we had to go to one of the businesses on other side of the building to make a copy, but it was a $1 per page versus 25 cents for the machine. 
Just remember to have all your information and make a copy of your passport beforehand.

I did a lot of research before visiting the consulate, and I read many bad reviews. I wasn't sure what to expect, but honestly I had a positive experience. I knew from doing my research that the visa office is a couple blocks form the main consulate. I knew what documents to have. I knew that Chinese culture is different from mine and they value efficiency and may not come across the same way as American customer service employees might. That said, I waited about 30-45 minutes for my number to be called DMV-style and it took about 2 minutes at the window to answer a couple questions and turn everything in. It was a piece of cake.

I made a reservation online and they told me to arrive between 10:20 and 11:30. When I got there I realized NOBODY makes an appointment. You just come here, grab a number and wait forever. 

They open from 9-12 in the morning and 1-2:30 in the afternoon. I arrived at 11am and they only called 29th person????? There are only two windows (that are actually working, the others are for pick up and pays), A and B. A for Chinese citizens and B for visa applications. For A they call to 29 and for B they call to 287. So if you want the A services you better be those  29 people.

Recommendation: DO NOT TRUST THE APPOINTMENT TIME! Come as early as you can or you'll have to do another visit.

The officers there are extremely helpful. I found my passport lost couple of days right before my flight back to China. I searched my place bottom up without any finding. I rescheduled my flight to a new date about a week later, which was the cheapest later flight. I went to the Consulate with all materials they requested online. And they explained to me what will be the procedures a new passport would go through, and told me it was very unlikely that I could make the flight, even though they would try their best. Right in the afternoon, 3pm, of the day before my rescheduled flight, they called me to pick my passport up. I was living in a small town, and had no car. I told them when I arrived, it would be about after 7 pm. They told me they were going to wait. Officially they close at 2:30 pm! I finally arrived there with my best effort, and flew back to China the next morning. 

I can't tell how much I appreciate their help! I am just a young man coming out of a small village in China. I never expected any officer do me any favour beyond their absolute responsibility. But in order to help me to meet my parents whom I hadn't met for more than 2 years and not waste my expense on the flight, they helped me to asking favour from other related departments and waited that long for me. I am really touched. It makes me feel the natural bond between compatriots.

name: Embassy of the United Arab Emirates

reviews.text:
Visited yesterday to renew machine readable passports (MRP) for my family (the MRP service is operational in Montreal as well). The staff was very polite and overall it was a good experience. There was no line up thus no waiting time, it took us less than 30 minutes to have our 3 MRP applications processed (5 star).

- At window / reception Shamim Abbassi took the fee and checked/verified all the paper work (5 minutes).

- Tahir Malik (incharge of passports) is also a very nice and professional guy. Last year i met him at  Toronto consulate and now he is here to initiate the MRP project in Montreal.
He himself took the pictures and fingerprints and processed our applications (15-20 minutes). 

The important thing is always visit related section of the consulate website for the services you are intending to acquire and have all the paper work available with you (original plus copies and make the set as it is instructed). You will never face any problem.

reviews.text:
It's nice to have a local office. But, I find it interesting how subjective their services are. Some people can walk in and get a form attested in 10 minutes. Others, like my senior citizen mother, are told to request an appointment and return in a week's time. 

I understand the demands are numerous, but the quality of services is not so great. Even when I had to get a Pakistan visa, it was a 4 day ordeal. Each time, the person at the counter needed something else that hadn't been requested before. I speak urdu, and had access to all the paperwork needed in my parents' absence. What if I hadn't? SOL. And don't tell me to go look at the website and call ahead...I'm born-and-raised American, US-educated attorney, I know how office protocols work. 

The website does not provide all the information necessary and forget about getting someone on the phone.There is no such thing as a help line.

Honestly speaking, before going there I thought that they will be slow, not so friendly and procrastinate the process. But, when I went there I was shocked to see their helpfulness, friendly service and cool nature. You don't expect all these qualities in Desi people. Sitting area was quite small but once your process is so quick it even doesn't matter. I don't know those guys names who were in staff that day, but kudos to the staff and really appreciate the effectiveness and friendly behavior. 
Thank you once again.

I visited the Consulate General Pakistan Chicago office on March 09th at around 9.30 am. I found the staff very professional, courteous, friendly and helpful. First I went to the person across from a table in the main office area and he provided the information I wanted to know, very nicely. I took a seat and went to the counter on my turn. The assistant  at thet counter was also welcomed me very kindly and ask me very nicely my purpose of visit. I wanted to get attested a form. He did the job very carefully and friendly manners ask me to sit back and within ten minutes he called my name and handed over the form duly attested by an athorised offer.
I appreciate nice services of Pakistan Consulate General Chicago.

I'm sorry to read the other reviews of IVPC as my experience has been quite the opposite.  I've used them a dozen times over at least 10 years.  Each time they've done exactly what they've promised on time and on budget.  This includes a number of Chinese Visas as well as other travel permits. They seem to know the people at the various consulates and are able to process documents at record speed.  I couldn't be happier and am about to use them again.

I encountered IVPSC in their Vancouver office. I am not going to come back and would never recommend to anyone to use their service. I tried to call head office in Calgary, but it seems like this whole "Corporation" does not only know any customer complaint resolution techniques, but also does not have any idea what customer service is. The company‚Äôs employees threatened me that my visa would be cancelled and requested to apologize for being disappointed customer. For my entire trip abroad I was afraid that my visa would be cancelled or something would go wrong thanks to IVPSC. If you want to experience ‚Äúnon-customer‚Äù service and fear during your trip, please go for International Visa Corporation.

reviews.text: After reading all the comments was worried about renewing my passport, but it wasn't all that bad. You call them they pick up directly with no waiting, and he explained all what I needed. An office near by will do all the paper work for you, it went smoothly for me.

1. Need to display clear guidance and instructions through posted notes for clients visiting the consulate. The current notice advises clients to start the visit from counter 1, and this is not accurate.
2. Need to have a phone line where iraqi citizens can reach the consulate through and get a response.
3. Need to have an urgent solution for renewing iraqi citizens passports on timely manner similar to previous times when it used to take 1 to 3 days, whereas currently it is taking few months.
4. Need to have a better receptionist who treats citizens with respect rather than frank humility and disrespect. Fake smile isn't a solution.
5. Need to have special consideration for elderly and children in the waiting area.
6. We are providing a constructive feedback and are willing to help by all means to raise the level of service and reputation of Iraq's face i.e. official mission in the UAE.
Wishing you all the best.

reviews.text:
The Iran‚ÄìUnited States Claims Tribunal (IUSCT) is an international arbitral tribunal established pursuant to the Algiers Accords of January 19, 1981, an agreement between the United States and Iran mediated by Algeria to resolve the hostage crisis. In exchange for the release of the hostages seized by Iranian students on November 4, 1979, the United States agreed to terminate litigation against Iran in U.S. courts and to release Iranian assets frozen by the Carter Administration. Many of the frozen assets had been attached by U.S. claimants pursuant to Treasury license. The U.S. claims agreement with Iran provided an alternative remedy backed by a billion dollar escrow account for U.S. nationals with contract and expropriation claims against Iran.

President Reagan confirmed the Algiers Accords, and the constitutionality of these arrangements was upheld by the U.S. Supreme Court in Dames & Moore v. Regan.[1]

U.S. officials who participated in the Iran Hostage Crisis (1979-1981) have discussed that diplomacy and the Algiers Accords in American Hostages In Iran: The Conduct of a Crisis (Yale 1985) and in Revolutionary Days: The Iran Hostage Crisis and the Hague Claims Tribunal, A Look Back (Juris 1996). See also Symposium on the Settlement with Iran, March 6‚Äì7, 1981, Lawyer of the Americas, U Miami J. Int‚Äôl Law (Special Issue, Spring 1981).

The seat of the Tribunal is The Hague. It held its first meeting in the Peace Palace on July 1, 1981; in April 1982, it moved to its own premises in The Hague. The Tribunal is composed of nine arbitrators: three appointed by Iran, three appointed by the United States, and a further three (neither Iranian nor United States nationals) appointed by the previous six arbitrators. The Tribunal hears individual cases in the formation of three-member chambers (consisting of one Iranian, one American, and one from the three appointed by the other six); it meets as a full tribunal to consider disputes between the two governments, and cases referred from the chambers.

The Tribunal closed to new claims by private individuals on January 19, 1982. In total, it received approximately 4,700 private US claims. The Tribunal has ordered payments by Iran to US nationals totaling over USD 2.5 billion. As of 2014, almost all private claims had been resolved, while several intergovernmental claims were still before the Tribunal

Service was fast and systematic. I am quite surprise myself that they have a better system in this consulate, glad that we are doing better in some ways. I came to the embassy to make an adjustment of status(report of marriage) and renewal of my Philippine passport. I arrived in the embassy before office hours(9am) and to my amazement there was already a friendly personnel inside the building, who took my name and put me in queue. He then told me I could come back by 9am and roam around the city while waiting. It was just a few minutes after 9am that my name was called, the 1st person that I spoke (for reported of marriage) gave me a great advice, saved me precious time of driving back to New York( 10 hours from where I live and that is just one way). 
He told me to indicate during my passport renewal application that I wanted the old passport cancelled, if I do the new passport will be mailed to my home address. A time saver indeed. 
     All in all by in less than 2 hours I finished 2 application. For some this might not be fast enough, but it was good enough for me. 
Keep up the good service and great work!

reviews.text: General Consular was not helpful in helping my friend recover his mone y from from Dewan's Office in Abu Dhabi even though local was pardoned by President with promise to pa y debts of locals pardoned from prison. Locals were pardoned but debts were not paid as promised.

Meeting with General Consular Ahmed Al Khaja. On August 28th, I got the honor meeting with General Consular Ahmed Al Khaja. I had to set up an appointment to meet him and it was not too easy but I must say that the General Consular is one of the nicest General Consulars that I have met. He is very polite and listening when it came to meeting with him. I met him to file an inquiry about my case in Abu Dhabi and Dubai regarding a local that was pardoned from jail by the UAE President with a promise to pay his debt along with all the other locals that were pardoned from jail.

The General consular requested that I submit all my court documents to him and papers that I had along with a short description of what my main inquiry or complaint was about. Following the forms being submitted he personally sent an inquiry via Ministry of Foreign Affairs to look into my case. I give the General Consular a 5 star rating for this part. From there the waiting period started and when the waiting period started I knew from there that it basically had come down to them not wanting to pay in the UAE and him not knowing exactly what to tell me. After a while I was notified by them that "The Ministry sees that the right official channel is to go to the US General Consulate".

The US General Consulate did not pardon the locals in the UAE and promise to pay their debts. This is a problem of their own laws and citizens in their own country. This also is an issue that involves their local government because the payments that come from this pardon come from "The Local Debitors Account from the Ministry of Justice in Abu Dhabi".

Not quite sure how to rate this because the issue was not resolved and they have not paid as promised by the President and according to their local Constitution in the UAE.
The Embassy and Consular accepted the inquiry and complaint, looked into the matter but then it pretty much ended there without being resolved.

The UAE is a great place to visit and has a few nice people there. The side that people need to know is that if you have any legal issues there with any locals you will find yourself in a never ending maze. For over 10 years I have tried to collect from a local person that owed me money of which was pardoned a few times by the President every time an arrest warrant was reissued for the local. Now the local crook is free and the Diwan's Office has not paid as promised. I am out on lawyer fees,travel expenses to and from Dubai to try and resolve this along with a long list of other expenses. More can be seen about my case by doing a Google search for Dubai Check Fraud and a search on Facebook for Dubai Check Fraud.

I am hoping and praying that General Consular can help me resolve this case so I can give them 5 stars on this review and so that God rewards them for their good deeds. Until then God knows and sees that someone did not receive justice or fairness when the victim involved requested help from those capable of helping.

I truly believe that the General Consular has the power and authority to help with a case like this. It comes down to whether or not one wishes to do so from their own heart. General Consular Ahmed Al Khaja, if you see this post, I beg for your help and assistance in helping me get back what I am owed and what was promised by the local courts,local constitution before the last President passed away and what was promised by the current President when he pardoned those in Jail and promised to pay their debts. I want this on record that I personally asked and begged for your help and assistance in this matter to be resolved.
Should help with Presidential pardon payments
