I just had a lovely experience! Turns out a person had the same birthday as me :-) I LOVE that. but seriously just in general they seemed very positive, very engaged, and are helping me tremendously. THANK YOU!

I have been forced to deal with this Embassy since 2002. I have traveled all over the world for the last 11 years and been to many Swiss Consulates for my work visa in Switzerland. All were a pleasant experience except for THIS embassy in New York. These are by far THE most rude and unaccommodating people I have ever had the displeasure of having to work with. Every time I have to deal with them, I shrill  thinking about the ordeal they will put me though. I once forgot to make a photo copy of my passport and after waiting in line for 2 hours, they actually sent me down the block to the nearest Kinkos because they refused to make a copy, just on principle alone. They are only open 3 hours a day so needless to say, when I finished making my copy, I barely made it back in time before they closed for the day. I live 2 hours away from this embassy and it costs me 100 dollars a day to go into the city. It takes two days to get the visa ready since they can't get everything done in a single day. They NEVER answer the phone during the ONE hour you are allowed to call should you have a question about the visa. But when you DO ask them any questions, they are often rude, patronizing and arrogant in their response. Dealing with this consulate is worse than going to the DMV. I could understand if it was just one incident but after 11 years of this B.S., I have since learned it's easier to just mail in my application and passport. It saves me time, money and the headache. 

UPDATE: Last year in 2014 I had to make a personal trip to the Consulate in NYC for the biometric fingerprinting. I guess the consulate got "wind" of my review. The head of the Consulate personally offered her sincerest apology, in front of everyone I might add. She assured me that I will be treated respectfully from now on. That was a very nice effort on their part. I have upgraded the star rating to reflect that. Hopefully this will continue.

This consulate is amazing. The professionalism, efficiency, and kindness with which Pamela handled my request was impressive. Coming to this consulate made me incredibly proud to be a Swiss citizen! THANK YOU

I had appt at 9:00am but got there early. I checked in and was called 8:50am. I was out the door by 9:05. The lady who helped was very nice and polite. We had a small talk. I had all my documents in order. Clearly, a whole process is punctual and accurate like a Swiss watch. One of the best experience getting visa done and I apply for a lot of Visa from other countries.

Great experience so far. Been here multiple times and staff was always very friendly and prompt. Got my passport back through post within 7-10 days after the interview each time.

Tip: Book appointment as soon as possible since slots are limited and fill up quickly (recommended 2 months before departure).
Very organized and efficient!!

It took us 3,5 hours to get power of attorney. A lot of people waiting in the small room in the basement when there is no a/c at all. No customer service and no speed in their work. To pay money for their work you need to go to Western Union 5 mins away.  Everything is like in Ukraine you are going from office to office with different pieces of paper.

I had a great experience here. A younger guy who was working on my husband's paperwork was very nice and helpful. After reading these reviews I was prepared for the worst, but was pleasantly surprised.

I want to thank everyone ( I don't remember names :( ) who helped me at Consulate General of Ukraine. as many of you I also wasn't able to reach them over the phone, but I sent an email and fax and i was contacted in a next 24 hours. No appointments ( which worked out  great for me)  I came like around 9:30am and everything was settled in 1.5hours ( I needed to apply for a new ukranian passport ). After reading all the reviews I was a bit scared to deal w them, but NO!!! They were very helpful and understanding. It was a pleasure to work with them.

I was expecting some sort of soviet style service but was pleasantly surprised with their professionalism. While there is room to grow I have to admit they are (and I trust will continue) moving in the right direction.

No one answers phone calls, like many reported - voicemail is full, the web site is a joke! POZOR. 2nd that on "jaka kraina, takyj i consulate". Way to go Ukrainian consulate of Chicago. Get your stuff together, Ukraine Consulate!

Ho un piccolo appartamento a Nizza dal 2003 e frequento questa citt√†' da oltre 20 anni.
Ho pertanto potuto apprezzarne i servizi a tutti i livelli ed i grandi miglioramenti realizzati negli ultimi anni, in particolare nei trasporti e nell'ambito degli spazi pubblici e della cura del verde.
Nel corso degli ultimi 15 anni sono stati innumerevoli i restauri di immobili d'epoca.
Niente di tutto ci√≤' e' invece avvenuto nel nostro consolato, il cui immobile e' sempre pi√π' sporco ed in condizioni vergognose che lo rendono squallidamente impresentabile.
Come italiano sono in particolare inorridito da come viene tenuta la nostra bandiera, talmente sporca da non poterne ormai riconoscerne i colori.
√à' vero che la maggioranza degli italiani non ama l'Italia, ma che un Console addirittura la disprezzi non presentando la bandiera in condizioni accettabili e' veramente troppo.
Se non siamo in grado di reperire fra i diplomatici Consoli che abbiano un minimo di onore e dignita', sarebbe meglio chiudere queste strutture una volta per tutte.
Allora per una pratica di cittadinanza
non rispondono al telefono,35 minuti nel'attesa dell'ufficio competente !

refused entry and told 'under no circumstances will you be allowed entry' even though I am a canadian citizen. Incredibly rude security who refused to ask an embassy employee to come talk to me. Was then given the wrong instructions on how to fill out forms, told to take out money and then told i was not allowed to pay in cash. It may sound ridiculous but if I was given contact with a canadian i would be less angry, as being told english securitypeople i had to leave my own country's building seemed even more offensive.

I also went to the Grosvenor Square building as nowhere does it say that building is now closed. There are even references to the building on the website which suggest it still operates.
 No apology given (not very canadian) and no help recieved. Bizarre as half this buidlings purpose is to serve citizens abroad. Wasted time and effort and thoroughly ashamed to be canadian. 

Tried to get assistance elsewhere met only with prerecorded instructions and answering machines. No help or apology in sight.

Mr.  Gordon Campbell 
High Commissioner for Canada
 
Never, ever in my life have I experienced anything that comes close to when I started my application for a visitor visa ‚Äì and I have travelled a lot - (vacation 14 days in Vancouver). I seriously doubt that anyone will believe me as I describe all the bizar and not knowing answers to my questions by telephone or mail ?
Until now 8th of July (I should have been on a flight 6th of July  ‚Äì and my ticket is not refundable) I have spent app. Kr. 13.000 on nothing but incompetence from the staff in the visa department in London.
This is the 3rd appl. your are processing now !!!  I started up in march in good faith; I have send around 45 mails and got answers that are not understandable ? My phonecalls ‚Ä¶. That‚Äôs is even more worse !!!
When I asked a direct question the did not know anything about that matter; I cannot count how many times I have  .. provided them with a tracking number ‚Ä¶ and .. as usual.. without result. The whole situation is so bizar so when I describe for you what happened to day during my phonecall to London I sincerely doubt you shall believe that I am telling  truth ! 
Biometrics: Enclosed with my 3rd appl. I have send my biometrics which the police in Holstebro  kindly  had helped to.
Got a mail from London that they were of no use ? and furthermore I had to pay a fee to get the right biometrics ? I asked How and where it should be possible to get there biom. taken .. I was put on hold, which is allright, but just to learn that I had to come to London (I live in Denmark) for the biom.
I then politely suggested that I could ask the USA embassy in Copenhagen if they were available for this ‚Ä¶ on hold again .. and: ‚ÄúNO‚Äù ! I don‚Äôt understand why ?? They already have them as I have American visitors visa (took me 4 days !!!); I then argued: But I cannot travel to London as you got my passport, and the answer was (hold on tight now): 1)I should write to you to have my passport returned to me so I could travel to London and get my beiom. 2) When home in Denmark again I should return my passport to you in order to finish the process.
To you who might read this: If you ever wish to go to Canada ‚Ä¶ then take a very deep breath ..  and then forget all about it.
Sincerely
Pala Dembo

I just went today to the US Embassy to pay my respects with some flowers and a message to Muhammad Ali, one of the greatest americans of all time, and when the Romanian guard talked to someone inside, he or she  told him to tell me to come tomorrow....again, this is a very poor way to communicate or just another arrogant attitude from the embassy staff. You just have to learn again and again from the one who was "the Greatest". RIP Muhammad Ali.

...I have some comments about the visa issuing process - the waiting times are hours long. If you schedule your interview for 7.30 be prepared to wait till 11 or so. The worst - the Embassy keeps the people waiting ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE STREET in a for bus like shelter. In winter/autumn or during incremental weather is terrible to wait there you'll get frozen and drenched by rain. Considering Romanians have no problem with this I guess they deserve it but I think this should never happen ( and doesn't ) in any other civilized EU country. ...
To visit USA visa is a necessary.

USA still treats Romanian citizens like third world country...Look at the new embassy layout....people queuing outside the building for the Visa, no mater the weather. Waiting area is across the street and despite being a special built place there is no ''zebra''. There is no dedicated parking area...you have to leave the car on the grass or in the private residential area close-by....
Very professional and well organised,excepted outside,where the people must stay in rain,sun ...Can be improved there!

Worst embassy and worst experience ever. If there was a zero rating I would have given it to them. They don't even deserve a star. 

To start with, the Vodafone embassy service they switched to provides the worst service ever, Charging you 3.5LE per minute and making you do several 20minute calls before you can book an appointment. 

I had to travel to the Irish embassy in Alexandria  to get an appointment.      All the appointments in Cairo were not available until 2 months.

 I submitted all my documents and other irrelevant documents that no other embassy asks for and they didn't give me my visa on the last working day before my trip because their system was down. I lost about 8 thousand pounds on my non refundable ticket because of their stupid system.

Completely unacceptable service and unprofessional staff. I've been traveling to Irelnd for years to see my family who live there and are Irish citizens and now I don't  want to go to Ireland again because of them.

You would hope that when you are living in an unstable country like Egypt, and especially in Cairo that you would have an Embassy that are contactable when you need them!

Cristina from Romania

had a great experience getting my partner a VISA this week.  They were friendly and concise and since we had all of our required documents in order were quickly approved - 45 minutes in total including the wait.

I had the worst experience of my life at this place. I write this to warn you about it and it is an entirely true story. There is a little American weasel who works in this Consulate. Watch out for him! Brown hair, light beard, slim, looks like he hates his job and his life. He is the most vial, disgusting thing. Apparently he is a consular official who 'interviews' people wanting to come to the US. This clown rejected my VISA application even though it is in black and white on the US embassy Canberra web site that if you are going to Canada on a working holiday VISA and want to visit the US in that time you need to apply for a US VISA. I questioned why he rejected the VISA and he became hostile saying that I needed to leave the consulate. I again questioned the grounds on him rejecting the VISA and out of nowhere he became hostile - he started raising his voice in a nervous (scared) tone and yelled for security. I was in total shock. A security guard came up and seriously overlooked me standing there (as that is all I was doing), assumed the person causing a scene had left and began to walk away. I actually approached the security guard and said I think he called about me. A person in line behind me even commented on how rude the staff member was. Shame on this Consulate for allowing such a piece of trash to represent the great country of America. By the way I was granted the VISA on re-application and everyone I dealt with second time around appeared confused on why I was rejected on the first attempt (join the club). I had to fly interstate twice and pay for accommodation, re-applying for VISA fees etc. Thanks consular official DOUCHE BAG for taking so much time and money from me for your incompetency. You are the one who should be denied entry into OUR beautiful country for your blatant abuse and misuse of power. You are lucky to be in Australia so there's no reason you should be such a sour little man. Do yourself a favour and avoid the Sydney consulate altogether if you can. Try Melbourne or Perth. Oh and I tried to get another staff members attention to get a supervisor to assist in the blatant incompetence but all I received was a 'I'm sorry once the American staff make their decision it's final' as if they are above scrutiny. Is that what you expect from a consulate in Australia? Foreigners acting as dictators within the consulate? Obviously the answer should be no. I'll be making formal complaints in writing and post another review once I receive an outcome.
i would not say it is a great consulate, because they have no american food like buffalo wings, pretty bummed out
Worse than terrible.

My Intention was to go to Wearables DevCon in California, as a citizen of 3rd world country Ukraine, I had to get a visa. 

Registration though web-site wasn't very user-friendly, as a result I've managed to book interview and pay for it without filling up the form.

MLC Centre is cool and location is very convenient, all people who works on level 9 are nice and friendly, it took me 3 times to come there to fulfil requirement of having confirmation of application form filled printed on paper, but that is long story and everyone had a good laugh with me and at me :D  

The most interesting part in US consulate is level 59, the first woman was nice and friendly, asked me tricky question whether my phone is turned off even so security on level 9 left my phone with them :)
the second woman was very understandable as well, tired but understandable :) so she checked my documents, everything was fine and then asked me wait my turn for interview.
The interviewer had a poker face no smile, asking "funny" questions, it felt like she tries to make me feel like fool that committed some crime, and now I'm at interrogation... The best part, is that I got refusal after few minutes interview... with general explanation of paper not meet requirements... it's good they making a decision there but I assume it will be more positive if happy people worked here...

And that is my story, I will go to Ukraine for few weeks soon to see relatives. And then I'll be back in Sydney helping people growing their business with such an amazing tool as Google+ and Google Maps.
A.HUTHER

I was at consulate office this morning and was not really sure what to expect after reading bad comments here.  I needed to renew my SNICOP and was not sure what to take with me.  I was mentally prepare that I will have to go back second time because I only had my old NICOP and passport with me.  I was thrilled with my experience at consulate office.  Not only I was provided with the forms, The beard gentleman behind the counter walked me through the whole form, searched all the info. for me in their system and fill them in my form.  I was done within 20 minutes, no problems.  The people, who are leaving the bad comments here,  probably believe that they are crownless kings of Pakistan.  They believe that there should be a band playing in their honour when they bless the office with their presence and consular general should be waiting outside with his staff to welcome them.  Canada is my homeland and I will give my life for it in a heart beat but do not forget that you are still a Pakistani as well no matter how long you live anywhere.    Bashing Pakistan will not make you any more (Stephan harper's)Canadian.  Love your homeland and love your motherland and be true to both of them.  Only thing I think they can improve on is, put a smile on their faces and that will be cherry on the cake.  All of them are very serious in that office.

Its not about Pakistan, country is amazing, no doubt. People are thugs, corrupt.
Waiting for my PR card and Bye Bye to Pak.
Corrupt people by birth. Corruption took birth in Pak.

Just went for a small attestation and took the person at least 4 hours to sign just a single piece of paper. 
Simple hate these people. Pathetic people are in the management.

A gong show at best. Been here twice so this review is about my latest experience to get my passport renewed. Got there at 8:40 am to beat the rush and there was a line up outside. No big deal except they opened 15-20 late than the stated time of 9 am while it was freezing outside. You then proceed to have someone check your documentation and give you a chit. That person is not happy, and i guess rightfully so. For anyone going, please make sure you have your documentation complete and all your photocopies. If you don't, you'll be forced to photo copy in the location...the copiers did not work for people on this particular day. Long story short, you will then spend 2 hours waiting and going to different counters to get your pics taken, make the payment, get your data entry. They will make mistakes, make sure you reconfirm all your info. Dude before me paid for urgent but had his application marked as regular by the employee. Finally...the place itself, good God..dirty carpets, run down walls...this does NOT look like the consulate of a country. For the record I am a patriot but just keeping it honest.

The consulate is a total rip off, paid almost $150 to attest 6 page document $20 a signature and stamp per page plus $30 to attest an affidavit, they insisted that each and every page needs a signature and stamp. I guess all this money somehow finds it way to some offshore company in Panama. No comments on services provided.

reviews.text: What a great experience!!! Wonderful customer service!!! I was there to renew my passport  and Cynthia assist me and providing such an absolutely superior service.   Once again Thank you so much, Bless you all

Very good experience. They were helpful, polite and fast. I needed to get a new passport, which usually takes up to 6 business days to be ready and  I ended up leaving the consulate with my new passport in my hands. The consulate officer was very pleasant. Fabiana even asked if I liked the picture that she took or if I wanted to take another one. She also helped me to transfer my voting card from Brazil to the USA and even though I filled out the form asking to vote in Houston (where the consulate is located) she pointed out that since I live in Dallas, I could actually vote there. She corrected the information herself and helped me to save time and money avoiding a trip to Houston next Brazilian election cycle. I've dealt with embassies/ consulates in New York City and Santiago, Chile and I must say that the Houston team is by far the best one so far. NOTE: I visited the consulate on a Wednesday morning with no holidays coming up.

How awful could you be to never respond to voicemails, or emails? I've been contacting these
guys for over 2 weeks, on an urgent need, and they are simply CARELESS! I lived in Brazil for a few years, and this is NOT how Brazilian people act, so why they are so rude is beyond me. I need to find out if I can fly to Houston from Utah to get my visa application done, but don't want to pay for the flights and waste money for my wife and I if I am to get there and be rejected service due to my state address. All I want is a lousy response so I can continue on with planning my honey moon! Seus Diabos!
I was issued a Brazilian visa 30 minutes after my scheduled appointment. No complaints here!

reviews.text: Very quick, efficient service. There was a minor issue, they communicated what was going on and they fixed the issue with no delays. Very cost effective. Most services I was looking at were charging almost 3 times the service fee. Very pleased and strongly recommend them.

Got my 10 year China visa through them. Good service for like a third of the price of other visa services. Everything went with no issues. I tracked the progress on their website. They took my passport with the visa application to the consulate the day after they received it from me and mailed it to me promptly after they got it back. From the day I mailed it to the day I got it back with attached visa was less than 2 weeks. Very satisfied.

I've used them three time for getting visa for me and my family. Everything is smooth and fast. they charge a fair price. On 2012 it was $10 for the second visa, first visa was free. On 2013 it was $15 per visa. On 2015 it went up to $20. I think this processing fee is fair. And if there is any problem or adjustment they will inform you through e-mail before sending it in. Which I like. Remember this $20 is just the processing fee. you still have to pay your Visa application fee and a $25 returning service fee through FedEx. It does kind of add up but now they issue 10 years visa it's worth it.

Its a consulate not a McDonalds or Starbucks people!
Not sure if you ever been to any other consulate but there are far worse. I had to deal with them on multiple occasions and there was never a problem, they were helpful and polite, always replied promptly. Yes waiting times are long and could be improved

the worst embassy in Europa! I cant belive that you have to contact ministerstvo zahranici CR to get very simple @mail answer regardin simple consular task. And even than you have to wait JUST for appointment more than 60 days !!! plus extremely long waiting time to sort out passport. Average procedure that normal people would expect from embassy  will take over 6! months just to get new passport. WHY WHY WHY ???
WORST EMBASSY EVER!!!! very rude staff and not very helpful ..hope they  did not joined EU....
A bit hard work to arrange a meeting, try to call 5times or send an email. It works. But location is good and also the stuff was very helpful.

Open just one hour afternoon for picking passports. We traveled from far after work, were stuck in massive traffic, I was 10 min later. Somebody were waiting in the car with my baby but when i entered embassy the lady behind the desk would not have it. She let me wait for over an hour. No understanding what so ever. I asked her politely, please i have baby in the car but nothing. The customer service is terrible!!!!! Why open one hour afternoon only? Why one person working here only? That is absolutely redicilous!!!! Worst service i have experienced in long time!!!
I would like to say "huge thank you!" to the notary office! Very kind people here!!! Today they helped me with my documents! Thanks a lot for your attention and kindness!!!!!
Went there on the 18th March they were really helpful especially the lady who is on Desk Number 8 she listen to my problem and helped me out. I would like thank all the team at the Italian embassy.
most unhelpful staff, god help you, zero customer service skills, it is easier getting information from a tree

I recently had my handbag robbed and therefore lost my documents including my Italian driving license,  USL card and identity card and so yesterday I went to the Italian Consulate to ask for advice on how to get new documents.
I phoned before going there to make sure I would be able to get help which they confirmed I could.
On my arrival I went to the information desk. 
The employee there was extremely rude to me as she had already been to other Italian citizens before me in the queue. She said that I would have to go back to Italy to get a new driving license and medical card. 
So I wonder, what is the purpose of having a consulate in London if the employees are unable to solve Italian citizens' problems????
Moreover there was no reason whatsoever for this "lady" to be so rude, especially as there are millions of unemployed who would do her job so much better.
I rang a friend in Italy who works for the anagrafe who told me that she should have given me help.
Beware all Italians who need help in London!!!
Utterly embarrassing service ...

reviews.text: I called to ask for the website to apply for a new passport. She started to give me the web address-www.hc.    and she said something I could not decipher. When I asked her to repeat what she just said, she put me on hold for more than 4 minutes. And because I was calling from outside Canada, I could not wait any longer.

Turnbull hasn‚Äôt the common sense to steer clear of being nosy in others business not his business to say things that is rubbish. The EU will say Mr Turnbull shut up you live in the arse end of the World as the famous Paul Keating one of the best Prime Ministers Australia has ever seen would say to Turnbull. He tried to step out of his frog in the well position but it has backfired with a vengeance we will soon know when Angela Merkel takes her dagger out. name: Generalnoye Konsulstvo Kitayskoy Narodnoy Respubliki V Ekaterinburge

reviews.text:
I had applied for B1 visa. There are long queues to enter the consulate thus recommend everyone to be there 45-60mins before scheduled appointment. 
Getting there: Near Gemini flyover. All auto/ola cabs will be able to take you there
To carry: All relevant supporting document + passport & confirmation page
Not to carry: Mobile, laptop, pen drive, CD, water etc (In case you do, then there is a small shop outside where you can leave your belongings). But it would just take all the more time so recommend to go here without any of the above mentioned items.
From standing in the queue outside to coming out. In all the process took about 2hrs for me.
There is usually is a long queue on weekdays. The people there are very helpful and friendly. They answer applications pretty quickly to my belief.

It was a good experience overall. Don't  worry about your bags/mobile/pendrive/laptop etc. there is an locker option available. they charge Rs 10. you can give your things and take the token. It's totally safe.

The most frustrating part is that they change their words every time he calls them. This is the most unprofessional government dealing that I have had so far in Canada. They should definitely hire some better employees who actually try to help Nepalese in Canada  rather than giving them unnecessary trouble. Far below average service!!

I have had no issues when renewing passport and id book. As long as you go on the website beforehand and make sure you have all the forms, photocopies etc. you should be fine. Only thing to note is that if you apply in person, you need to collect some of the forms from them. There is usually a very helpful man (sometimes woman) around helping fill out forms, giving you the correct forms, etc, so there is no need struggle.
The only thing better, if all could be done online.
And to one of the previous posters: There is in fact bathroom facilities there, so I think he may have gone to the wrong place.

Unbelievably bad! Firstly there is no way to contact them. No one answers the phones, no matter when you ring. No one responds to emails. It took me a trip to London and four hours in queue, just to apply to renew my passport. It's now been nearly three months of waiting with no sign of progress as you cannot track your application's progress. The home affairs website tracking service has been " temporarily suspended". I got someone in SA to try the SMS service...no reply after a week! No idea where my passport is in the process or if there is any way I will get it within the four month (!) period they claim it takes. So despite applying well in advance, I will now have to cancel my holiday. Well done, SA embassy in London, for making South Africans feel right at home.

Email contact on website checked: invalid
Telephone contact checked: Always engaged...even out of hours!!

I phoned the SA office in Pretoria. Boom!!! A reply within 4 minutes...guess where my child's ID is since 27/10/2015?.....SA office in London.

Appalling service from the UK office. I would have expected it from the Pretoria office. So why is the service in UK so poor? Well I know...but I should keep it to myself. Time for our UK citizenship I reckon. Now to collect the passport from the zoo.
Unable to get through during office hours, on several tel numbers. Always engaged. Poor service. Complaints time, waste of everyone's time.

Immediate results.

I decided to personally apply for a VISA for my family at the embassy. I got there at 8:20AM. They start giving out tokens numbers (the order in which you will be served)There were lots of travel agent guys in front of me in the queue. I got token number 23.

I was only able to get to the window at 12PM. So, bring a book and be patient. Better yet, get someone to apply on your behalf and pay them the extra money. The going rate for the tourist visa in April 2008 is Rs. 1550/person.

You have to wait outside the embassy gates under the shade of a peepal tree. Bring water and light snacks or buy the vadas and tea from the local guy who comes around at 11AM.

The information desk  guy practically ignored us we arrived and needed direction, once we got to legal window the representative never smiled once, refused to say hello after we greeted her politely. I had a couple questions on procedures and documents, she acted like I was insulting.  
They make the DMV attitudes look good!!! 

On a more positive note, while you are there go into the Tourism office downstairs and the people inside there pleasant and take time to help in any way. Di Mak Mak!

Now that the rude older lady at the information desk appears to no longer work there (maybe they retired her miserable self), the next ‚Äúbest‚Äù thing to that level of rudeness is at window #3, or Legalization.  Dare I say it‚Äôs because I came in with my Thai passport, which was needed to take care of some Power of Attorney bit in Thailand, versus my U.S. one?  This is nothing new when it comes to the double standard in customer service towards Thais (bad) and non-Thais (good) by other Thais.  As a native Angeleno born and raised in L.A., I can honestly and sadly say that there is absolutely no sense of customer service, so opposite from the image (and it‚Äôs all about putting up this front) of friendliness and politeness the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT), which is ironically in the lobby of the same building, tries so hard portray.  C‚Äômon people‚Ä¶get with the program!

I gave it two stars versus only one because I was in and out of there within minutes on both days I had to go in because there was no queue on either day.  It still makes me wonder, though, why they are so miserable when they only have to pop in and out from their hole to come to the service window once in a while.

I absolutely agree with the previous post (Poor service).  I am Thai and I feel embarrassed by the service I got today. I don't want to say that they all rude because I know that there are many good ones over there.  

Based on my own experience, one of the female officers seems to be unfriendly.  I don't know why.  Instead of answering simple questions, she put her attitude into her answers that doesn't sound right.

I feel like she is irritated by doing her job.  I thought we have the thai consulate to provide help and support to those who need help.  What I need was just some guidance. There is nothing she has to do for me.  I'm not begging for money.  This is so wrong. I'm sorry that you guys have to experience this.  What a shame!

The rudest and most irresponsible service I ever received. I submitted a visa application through them and even paid for their alert service. I called to inquire when I will hear from the embassy and had the phone dropped on me twice. Two FREAKING TIMES!!!! Reasonable customer service will explain you are not the embassy and keep it polite. 

A response to the comment from the supposed VFS staff. You of all people should know that you can't apply directly for a Swedish Visa form the Swedish Embassy in Canada. You apply through the Denmark Embassy (they cover Scandinavian countries). Ironically you are supposed to apply through VFS (which I did) and they are to submit your application and insist you pay for an alert service (which I did). If you don't know the service you are supposed to offer and collect money to do so, what an interesting situation. Little wonder you dropped the phone without listening to my inquiry! A simple suggestion: PATIENTLY LISTEN TO PEOPLE AND THEN EXPLAIN YOUR POSITION!!! ITS THAT SIMPLE!!!!

Prep√°rense a sufrir si desean inscribir un matrimonio celebrado en M√©xico en el Registro Civil del Consulado General:  la informaci√≥n que proporciona la p√°gina web del Consulado de Espa√±a en M√©xico es deficiente e incompleta.

"Matrimonio
Cualquier espa√±ol podr√° contraer matrimonio dentro o fuera de Espa√±a:
- Ante el juez, alcalde o funcionario se√±alado por el C√≥digo Civil
- En la forma religiosa legalmente prevista
 
Tambi√©n podr√° contraer matrimonio fuera de Espa√±a con arreglo a la forma establecida por la Ley del lugar de celebraci√≥n. Los matrimonios de espa√±oles celebrados en el extranjero se inscriben en el Registro Consular correspondiente al lugar donde acaecen.
 
La inscripci√≥n se realizar√° por transcripci√≥n de matrimonio celebrado de acuerdo con la ley del lugar o directamente si se celebra por el propio encargado del Registro Civil Consular.
 
Solamente puede celebrarse un matrimonio consular cuando al menos uno de los contrayentes es espa√±ol y si las leyes y reglamentos del estado receptor no se oponen.
 
El formulario que se debe rellenar y presentar en las oficinas consulares para inscribir un matrimonio es la Hoja declaratoria de datos, que puede descargarse desde este enlace."

As√≠ dice en su p√°gina web consultada esta misma ma√±ana. 

Lo que en realidad solicitan si vas al consulado aparte del impreso de declaraci√≥n de datos que si est√° colgado en su pagina web: 

- Acta literal original local (COPIA FIEL DEL LIBRO) de matrimonio reciente (no m√°s de una mes de expedici√≥n). NO SE ADMITE CERTIFICACI√ìN EN EXTRACTO.
- Acta literal (o copia fiel del libro) de nacimiento reciente (no m√°s de 6 meses de expedici√≥n) de ambos c√≥nyuges.
- Original y copia de identificaci√≥n de ambos c√≥nyuges: Para c√≥nyuge espa√±ol/a pasaporte espa√±ol vigente. Y para c√≥nyuge mexicano/a pasaporte mexicano vigente o credencial de elector vigente.
- Para aquellos contrayente cuyo estado civil sea el de viudo/a deber√°n presentar: Acta literal del matrimonio anterior. Copia de acta de defunci√≥n del c√≥nyuge finado/a.
- Para aquellos contrayente cuyo estado civil sea el de divorciado/a deber√°n presentar copia del acta literal del matrimonio anterior reciente con nota marginal de divorcio.

No aceptan como v√°lido un acta de nacimiento ni de matrimonio "normal informatizada" debe ser "una acta de nacimiento literal (o copia fiel del libro) de nacimiento reciente" ni tampoco certificaci√≥n en extracto. Ni tampoco sentencia de divorcio. Y ojo con las fechas de expedici√≥n, pues si se pasan tampoco ser√°n validos.

Mejor vuelvan a casarse nuevamente en Espa√±a.

Es importante consultar la web del consulado y ponerse en contacto por email. Yo contact√© con ellos por email para un tr√°mite de notar√≠a y me respondieron el mismo d√≠a dando muy buen seguimiento a mi consulta. Arantza fue muy eficiente y amable. Solo hicieron falta tres emails para concretar el tipo de documento que necesitaba, la informaci√≥n que deb√≠a proporcionar y obtuve mi cita para unos d√≠as m√°s tarde.

Que p√©simo servicio, P√âSIMO, m√°s de tres d√≠as para poderse comunicar con ustedes, adem√°s de correos SIN CONTESTAR y cuando por fin contestan la llamada, la se√±orita que contesto con falta de tacto para atender e intolerante a las preguntas, si est√°n proporcionando varios tel√©fonos para cualquier duda, porque el personal es tan mal educado, y grosero? ES UNA FALTA DE RESPETO QUE SI MARQUE CON TODA LA EDUCACI√ìN POSIBLE Y AMABILIDAD PARA PREGUNTAR HAYAN RESPONDIDO TAN GROSERAMENTE.

P√âEEEEESIMO, alguien haga el favor de meter a gente competente a trabajar ahi, que atiendan de manera amable al p√∫blico y que no te reciban con jeta, m√°s informaci√≥n en la p√°gina por dios y que alguien haga el favor de contestar los tel√©fonos. P√©simo TODO.

Several ladies both said that the only reason is to get the extra money.  Once we redo our pictures we went upstairs and The lady Maria palithi said that we have to call over the phone to make an appointment to do this and brig the paperwork. You need to book your appointment through email. If you don't hear back from them, check your spam folder; the email is most likely there.

Once the appointment was booked, the rest of the process was ok; not convenient, just ok.

I know people have different experience when they try to get the visa appointment. We had to waited few days for them to reply for the visa appointment which was Aug 24th. Went to consulate with my wife whom she needed the visa. I had all the paperwork handy. Took elevator to 5th floor, greeted by nice lady. She asked us for the reservation, w-2, fight ticket, and took finger prints. She was very helpful and we asked her few questions and she politely answered them. The passport pick date was give on the spot which is today. Wifey got the visa. Whole process at interview was less than 15 mins, and visa processing was even sweeter only 8 days. I would like to share you this to people because they don't understand they are having so much on their plates right now and its hard to keep up. Anyways, my suggestion would be keep everything handy originals as well copies, put stickies and paperclip them so your interview process will be smoother. If you send them an email for inquiry or questions, the usual turn around time is about 4 days, which is okay. Such a great experience, please don't haste and give any negativity to this place.

reviews.text: They serve great diplomacy here.

This is to complain about the way my wife and I were treated by a male either an employee or the Consul at the Lithuania Consulate office in New York He refused to tell me his name and his position. On May 6th 2011, I called the Consul office in New York to check the status of my wife's visa request.  First I was put on hold for a long time. Then, when they came back to the line, I asked about the status of my wife's visa and I was told they had not had a chance to work on it and I should check next week.  On may 10th, I called back again.  This time a female answered the phone. She was polite and put me on hold.  A male came back to the line and I asked again for my wife's (Tatsiana Franco) visa status.  He said let me check and put me on hold again.  When he came back he said there was a missing document.   Then I asked him that if there was a missing document and they have our contact information why they do not contact us to let us know instead of me calling again.  He was very loud and his tone was demeaning and unprofessional. He said, I do not have to contact you and what I can do is deny your wife's visa.  Then I asked him, is this a threat?  His answer was very rude and he said yes, I can deny it.  Also, she did not include the prepaid envelope to return the passport.  I can also have your wife pick it up in New York.  He knew we are in California.  Then I said, let's focus on the problem and tell me what document is missing.  He said, hold on and I was on hold again.  When he came back he said, let your wife call us.  I do not need to talk to you.  I told him, my wife is here and passed the phone to her. He told her, your husband is very rude and I can have you pick up the passport here in New York since you did not send the prepaid envelope. My wife got worried and asked him, "What document is missing"?  He said your marriage certificate.  She told him you need that even though we sent a copy of my husband's US passport and it shows we both have the same last name?  He then said, he also needed a bank statement and travel insurance in a very rude way with a very bad attitude and after he gave me this information he replied, "okaaaay" and he hung up. Anyway we have sent all these documents today.  My concern is that other people can be treated this way if no action is taken to change this unprofessional attitude and rude behavior. I will appreciate if you can look into this and please make sure that it does happen to other people and it made my wife and I feel very disrespected and belittled and humiliated.  My wife was in total fear of his threats.

name: Consulado da Alemanha e da Fran√ßa

reviews.text: Rude staff. Though my application process was smooth but I have seen the lady asking questions that were totally irrelevant and way out of her jurisdiction. Sometimes even mistreating the people. They misbehave specifically with the people who are less likely to retaliate. One of the staff at the counter was not even able to understand english properly.
They will be rude only if one goes unprepared or behave oversmart. Have courtesy, they are too good, well cultured n well behaved. Had really a nice experience.
Worst experience to deal with VFS Global and Embassy.  They have no sense of urgency and don't even bother to acknowledge your emails.  God save Germany and German :(  Horrible Experience!
I was 2 times there. Its a little complicated to go there. You need a Otto car. But. This People are friendly and helpful there.
Good services

Terrible service, grossly inefficient, I had to wait over 45 minutes just to pick up a (pre-prepared) sheet of paper. An organisation with an ounce of common sense or self-organisation would have a system whereby you can pick up such documents without queuing. Not the Italian Consulate in London.

Some staff do seem to do their best and struggle through despite the lack of organisation, but clearly the management do not have the necessary competence to run an organisation of this size with any efficiency.

If they weren't wasting Italian taxpayers' money it would just be embarrassing. As they are, it is outrageous.

Needed to renew my passport: no available appointments online. On 1st June 2016 I called the call centre and they said that the booking system is blocked so I have to call back on 15th June to get an appointment for August. Looking forward to get the British passport so that I don't have to deal with this corrupted consulate. Vergogna parassiti!

I have had 2 experiences of the embassy and had no problem.
The website is a bit busy looking and clunky but usable with a little patience.
So, booking a passport.
The site explains that there are limited spaces.
They are released at specific times of the week thus you have to go online at these specific times. Simple.
The availability is limited so when you are at the computer the spaces fill up quickly by default. The system is set to book an appointment nine weeks later.
I sat at my computer on a Sunday and duly booked my appointment for 9 weeks time.
This was at 9.08 on last Tuesday.
The consulate opens at 9 and it was first day back at work after a bank holiday but not unduly busy.
Reception was courteous and pointed me in the right direction.
I took my ticket.
15 minutes later I gave my application in and 20 minutes later walked out with my passport.
Perfect.
Thank you

Awful awful service!!!!!  After 3 months of trying the pointless on-line booking system I reluctantly decided to phone (at ¬£0.75p per minute) and got an appointment 3 weeks later.  on the day of the appointment the waiting room was empty and yet I had to wait 20 min! They say that the passport is given on the same day but this is a total lie. They told me that I couldn't pay there and then (a card machine was right there on the counter) I have to send a postal order and a pre-paid envelope, guess where.........to the exact same office I was standing in!!!!!
A total joke. it sums up the Italian government!!!  I feel conned.

this is the worst I repeat the worst service anyone can receive and expect from the Italian embassy they are surely a money making operation that don't  give any help whatsoever apart from taking your money which they are very good at first they ask for information you send it to them they need they say they have not received it then you pay to call and speak to someone 75p a minute then they tell you bullshit about separate private company and that they can't  help you then you send numerous email to which they don't reply back and so on they operate like some kind of mafia just taking your money get a British passport if you can!

reviews.text: Went into our appointment 20 minutes early, knowing  from past experience the security booth  at the entrance can be quite daunting and take some time. But not this day! Flew through security. Got up to the office, checked in, paid at the cashiers desk, waited for less then 20 minutes and we were called and all done at the same time of our original appointment! Passports came within 10 days. üëçüèº

The time of your appointment doesn't mean the time you will enter the embassy, it's only the time for you to get in line. Nothing that carries a battery is allowed inside the building so you will need leave your mobile phone in the free lockers when you pass by security.

Also, wear some comfortable shoes as you will be standing for a while.
Usually calls earlier than the actual appointment time and visa processing time is also very fast. I got the visa within 4 working days..
Very strict security but a fantastic building that can be viewed with prior permission by the general members of the public on Culture Night
Of course the American embassy is a circle, couldn't be a square like the rest of them.

Adzan Start           : 12:30
Average Duration : 45 mins
Enterance gate     : Backdoor gate (Adelantado Street)

- please come earlier,because you ll need extra time for security check,elevator and wudhu

Das Generalkonsulat der islamischen Republik Afghanistan in M√ºnchen f√§llt vor allem durch zwei Punkte auf: Service und R√§umlichkeiten.

Zun√§chst zu den R√§umlichkeiten:
Die Botschaft befindet sich in einer Villa in Gr√ºnwald. Von au√üen ist das Erscheinungsbild √§u√üerst vornehm. Innen allerdings sieht es anders aus. In dem kleinen, viel zu √ºberf√ºllten Raum, befindet sich leider nur ein Service-Mitarbeiter, der die Aufnahmeperson f√ºr alle Angelegenheiten ist. Es gibt bei der Anmeldung keinerlei Wartenummern, dies hat zur Auswirkung, dass es sehr lange Wartezeiten gibt - auch Dr√§ngeleien sind keine Seltenheit.  Im Raum befinden sich ca. 15 St√ºhle, ein kleiner runder Tisch, ein Fotofix-Automat, 1 Kopierer (an dem man sich auch sehr lange anstellen muss), zwei Kleber und zwei Scheren. 

Nun zum Service:
Aufgrund des Personalmangels am Serviceschalter, der sichtbar begrenzten R√§umlichkeiten und der unzureichenden Professionalit√§t mangelt es sehr an Diskretion. St√§ndig werden die Namen von afghanischen B√ºrgern durch den Raum gerufen, die ihre P√§sse abholen sollen. Noch schwerwiegender allerdings ist die Tatsache, dass der Service-Mitarbeiter so wenig Zeit hat, sich um den Einzelnen zu k√ºmmern, so dass man selber aufgefordert wird, die Bilder in dem Fotofix-Automat aufzunehmen, eigenst√§ndig auszuschneiden und anschlie√üend auf die Formulare  zu kleben. Es erfolgt also kein richtiges Einscannen der Fotos mit zugeh√∂rigen Stempeln, wodurch die Dokumente h√∂chst unprofessionell und willk√ºrlich wirken. Auch sind kaum Richtlinien diesbez√ºglich vorhanden, wodurch diese Willk√ºr verst√§rkt wird.

Die telefonische Auskunft ist ebenfalls mangelhaft. Da die angebotenen Telefonzeiten sehr knapp bemessen sind, kann es auch passieren, dass man einige Tage keinen Mitarbeiter erreicht. Oftmals werden kompliziertere Anfragen werden auch durch die Standardfloskel "kommen sie morgen vorbei" abgewimmelt. Diesbez√ºglich sind die mangelnden Deutschkenntnisse der Mitarbeiter unglaublich hinderlich. Nur vereinzelte Mitarbeiter sprechen mittelm√§√üiges Deutsch, wordurch die Vermittlung des Anliegens sehr schwierig ist und bei √úberforderung sehr gerne abgeblockt oder aufgelegt wird. Es w√§re w√ºnschenswert, wenn Mitarbeiter eines Konsulates in einem zust√§ndigen Land die jeweilige Landessprache besser beherschen w√ºrden. 
Besonders bedauerlich ist zudem, dass das Konsulat M√ºnchen den Regeln der afghanischen Botschaft in Bonn nicht g√§nzlich folgt.

Absolutely splendid and beautiful embassy. You can feel the blood of the starving citizens of Brazil in every detail. The staff is either preoccupied doing their nails and hair or meeting business people "away" from the premises for undocumented meetings. The "visible" staff certainly represents the most beautiful that Brazil has to offer, however also the most inadequate and inept. Without a doubt it is the most grotesque experience to meet these descendants of the various inquisitions while they pose under the pictures of Dilma Rousseff who presides over mass extermination of its population by starvation and withholding healthcare. Third world counties are often this way, one truly needs to lower ones expectations of honor and dignity in dealing with them . Usually, however, they are not so foolish as to point fingers at successful nations who defend themselves only because they must, over-lorded by the oligarchs such as Rousseff who bleed the civil population every second of every day and with banal leadership who fear the obvious revolution tomorrow, or tonight. Understand that we are not talking "tough times" we are talking about fully one half of the Brazilian population not only doesn't know where its next meal is coming from, there is no meal. The staff of the Brazilian Embassy has excellent health care, that puts them in the 2% of Brazilians who have access to health care. The government of Brazil prefers to operate at night.The rivers of Brazil may run today but they certainly run in vain and are very shallow, they run with the failed hopes and dreams of the Brazilian people, tomorrow they may run with blood. Oh did I mention the destruction of the entire ecology of the country and the region? Don't worry, for a price they will not mention it either.

Lamentablemente no puedo calificar mejor esta oficina que se supone que representa Alemania en el extranjero. Ya que se estaba venciendo mi pasaporte Alem√°n tuve que extenderlo; me dirig√≠ desde Puerto Vallarta al Consulado en Guadalajara y deje mis huellas digitales, llene los formatos necesarios y pague la suma de 3500 Pesos para recibir un nuevo pasaporte. Ya que ten√≠a un vuelo a Alemania que hac√≠a escala en EEUU de regreso, el pasaporte temporal era un problema para mi, sin embargo opte por esta posibilidad y recib√≠ un pasaporte temporal, con el cual puede regresar a Alemania donde saque un pasaporte normal antes de regresar a M√©xico con escala en EEUU. En cuando solicit√© de que me reembolsan mis 3500 Pesos me dec√≠a que s√≥lo me pod√≠an reembolsar 1400 Pesos ya que hab√≠an iniciado los tramites para un nuevo pasaporte. Por supuesto que no estaba de acuerdo ya que el problema fue en su sistema y no por mi falta que no me pod√≠an tramitar el pasaporte. Despu√©s de varios meses sin se√±ales les ped√≠ de pagarme por lo menos 1400 Pesos pero hasta el d√≠a de hoy no he recibido este dinero de regreso. Sadly enough I can not write a better review about this office which supposedly represents Germany. 
Since my German passport was about to expire I went from Puerto Vallarta to Guadalajara; left my digital fingerprints, filled out the necessary formats and paid 3500 Pesos to get a new passport. After a couple of weeks (on 24.2.2014) I received a mail which read that the scanner of the fingerprints had a problem and that I would need to go to Mexico City to leave my fingerprints there again or except a temporary passport for free. Since I had already bought a flight with a stopover in the USA a temporary passport was a bit of a problem for me, since I could not enter the states without an additional visa. Using the temporal passport I got a new passport in Germany and was able to travel back to Mexico via the states. Asking for a refund of the 3500 Pesos I had paid I was told that I could only get 1400 Pesos back, since the consulate in Guadalajara had initiated the paperworks for a new passport. Obviously I was not happy with this reply, since it was a fault in their system which prohibited me from getting my new passport. I asked for a complete refund of the money I had paid for their services - it is not my fault that they could not provide me with the service I paid for. After some time without any information I requested to deposit me at least the 1400 Pesos however until this day I have not gotten paid back this amount either. This is definitely not an adequate representation of Germany. If you can stay clear of this representation of Germany!

En fin, en el Consulado General hay dos estaciones para la toma de datos para pasaporte y DNI, y no faltan empleados. Habiendo DOS personas en la fila para hacer tr√°mites, y cuando una de ellas se ofreci√≥ para cederme su turno, no logr√© hacer el cambio de domicilio.
En vez de encontrar personas de mi pa√≠s dispuestas a ayudarme, encontr√© un ambiente hostil, sin voluntad de brindar una buena atenci√≥n a los ciudadanos que vivimos en el exterior, y un claro ejemplo de la mala burocracia argentina. Me vuelvo a Nebraska desilusionado, y con domicilio en Capital Federal, donde no resido hace dos a√±os.

Tried and tried and tried to call the 646 number to find out basic information about passport renewal but NEVER GOT THROUGH... In order to make an appointment you have to do it online which is fine but the earliest appointment is in about two weeks. To get the quickest response you have to do it via email and it takes them about three business days to respond.

In early  April when I went  to renew my passport (because I'm traveling abroad) you could only pay cash which is ironic since all the other stuff has to be done electronically. 
Despite giving all my personal information like phone number, email address and my mailing address no one has contacted me in regards to whats going on with my passport because it still has not arrived. When I went to check my passport status online, the application was not found. I emailed them and still have not heard back.

Somethings cant wait three days and a response should be provided sooner.

The best ‚Äúconsulate experience‚Äù I‚Äôve ever had. All information you need to apply for a visa available online. 
Don‚Äôt believe to some nonsense people put in their review about ‚Äúa throwback reminder to communist era‚Äù or complains about emails being answered in 3 business days. Polish Consulate much better than Ukrainian, Russian or even Hungarian Consulates in NYC, for example.
It is normal for Consulates to answer emails in 3 days, but the email I‚Äôve sent them in the evening was answered next morning at 9am and contained all required information. If you want to have bad ‚Äúconsulate experience‚Äù ‚Äì apply for a visa to Greece in NYC! :-) I had to cancel my trip to Greece because Greek Consulate was that bad, but I am going to visit Poland next month‚Ä¶

I had a very poor experience with the Australian consulate in San Francisco. Incredibly inefficient, lazy (but competent) office staff. My only goal was to book a mandatory appointment to request a new passport (I am a student here).

PROBLEMS
- Phone maze takes literally 5 minutes to get to what you want (I timed it after the fourth time I selected the wrong number!)
- Nobody ever answers the phone once it finally directs you to a real person
- When I finally got to speak to someone on my 4th call after 3 weeks, the guy decides to argue with me, "we actually get those complaints a lot, so I checked by calling for myself and the system definitely works"

GOOD THINGS
- The office itself is in a fancy building in San Francisco, so while you're waiting at the front desk for someone to show up, you'll have a glimpse of their view.

They said this is because if paperwork and other procedures get delayed so all the appointments.  I told them about my disagreement and they got mad. The Colombian consulate in Chicago fell into the unfortunate routine of accepting forgetful and disorganized people coming to the appointments and making us all pay the price. I have been living here in the U.S for the last 16 years. I have never seen the worst customer service like Ethiopian Embassy. Every time I call for information or something related to ethiopia, the first question they ask me is "why did you call?" They never ever tell you their name which the are supposed to. They don't want to listen questions. They are talkers, not listeners. The worst of all, any piece of paper you send has to be express mail which is very expensive. That is not bad. You have to send paid return envelope. That is not bad either. The bad thing is they deny  and say "you didn't send return envelope." They lost my document several times. The USPS tracking number says delivered buy they havev never admited. Group of disorganized lazy people there. Shame on them. They deserve zero or negative star if it exists. Ah rude customer service.

Guys -- They have heard your feedback and, as of February 9, no longer allow people to come in person to get visas. It all must be by mail. But I thoroughly enjoyed the scenic drive up into Northwest DC. Friends at the Embassy -- It could help those visiting your country if you would update your website to reflect the fact that people should not come to the Embassy, and the website still states that US citizens can get tourist visas upon arrival in Addis Ababa, but we've learned that the policy has changed. Those would be good updates. Thanks for serving those from the US trying to visit your special country.

I was skeptical about the service after reading the previous reviews, but my experience was totally different. When I called, the woman who answered was very polite and very helpful. I was worried about sending my passport in the mail as well, so I just went down to do it in DC in one day. When I arrived, the man working there asked me, "when are you leaving?" And I said, "3 weeks." And he told me, "you're too early, come back in a few days." That is because the visa is valid on the day you apply. But when I asked, "can I just do it today because I live far away?", they were accommodating and took care of it right away. I was in and out of the embassy, with my visa, in 20 minutes! I'm very happy about that!

reviews.text:
I was impressed with the way I was treated at the embassy. Completely different from the previous experience had say 5 years back. They never pick up the phone, so this goes to show of how connected we can be with our embassy. The one like myself who lives in a different States and Territories have no option but driving to Canberra to get any service.
I arrived in Canberra and grab a ticket just to realise that with one person serving over 50 applicant with a variety of requests, my number might be called a week later.
I was surprised that the person behind the desk was professional but so busy that everyone was unhappy nevertheless as there is so much one person could do.
When I finally manage to hand in my paperwork in next visits, I was assured to receive my passport within 3 weeks, when i mention the New Year and the effect of holiday in this matter, I was sharply told "Holiday or not holiday we do our job, 3 weeks".
Now 3 weeks is up and my flight is booked and paid for next week, there is no way to contact embassy as many of you aware of and I don't know what to do?
Would one of those people who is given a 5 stars kindly advise me of what to do?

I just came back from the Iranian consulate service in Sydney for our marriage certificate. I have to say I am SO surprised by their patience. Some people were really rude and unappreciative, but the consulate members were really polite and helpful and funny. Very pleased to see they are helping everybody. and a word to some Iranians: common!!!! why are you so rude? if they call you with 10 minutes delay, no need to be so bitchy! 
Special thanks to Mr. Sadeghi and the other gentleman who helped us but i did not get a chance to catch his name for their helpful advise and making the atmosphere pleasant.
Dear Embassy staff, I wanted to say how appreciative I was of the excellent way you handled my visa application. Very professional, courteous and so quick.  David

I would like to thank Mr. Sadeghi ,Mrs.Jafari and Mr. Ghobadi . They were so helpful, welcoming and warm ; if there is any problems its the lack of my own documents but they gave me right advice. I realized its much better to attend to the embassy in Canberra in person .All the paperwork's done in one day and they are a great team and  wish them all the best. Thanks Heaps

I recently noted that Ambassador Mitchell will be leaving his post here in Myanmar, and I wanted to publicly thank him and his staff for the outstanding job that they have done in an environment that at times can be stressful, ambiguous, and thankless.  I was fortunate to have been here the entire time from his original selection, to his later appointment as Ambassador and although he is not a career Foreign Service Officer, he is the embodiment of what the corps should strive for.  Hopefully we will have an open house at the Embassy for US Citizens to offer you our thanks before you finish your tour here. 

Sincerely
William R Parks, American Citizen, Taxpayer, and Vietnam War Veteran

This consulate has no empathy for Spanish citizens. They despise them out of pure bureaucratic arrogance.  I am a Spanish citizen. I contacted this consulate a week before my business trip to Houston to get a document notarized. This should take 5 or 10 minutes at most. They could not find me a spot despite the fact that I told them that I don't leave in a city with Spanish consulate, and that if I don‚Äôt get that done that day I would be force to ask for another appointment, which, because I don‚Äôt leave in Houston, means losing one day of work and spending $300 or more in a plane ticket plus perhaps hotel night. Really, is this the service we expect and pay for? Maybe, it would serve of some sort of consolation to my compatriots that this consulate is terrible with everyone. I have heard from an American friend that dealing with this consulate is truly a nightmare.
Rude, uninformed, and unhelpful

Over the last 40 years I have dealt with the consulates in L.A., Miami, S.F. and Houston.            Houston for me, by far, has been the office where the staff are the most friendly, courteous and helpful, (Todos muy simpaticos y alegres).

This is without a doubt, the most unprofessional, ghetto, consulate/embassy I've ever encountered. They're not even in a real office. It's like they just set up shop in somebody's house. We called their visa department many times over a period of a week to make an appointment and never got through to speak to a real person even ONCE. When we finally showed up in person they told us the first available meeting they had was two months away and way too late for the trip we had been planning. There's also the dumb rule that you can only apply for the schengen visa within 3 months of your trip. So if you're applying for a UK visa AND a schengen, good luck because you have a really tiny window where you have to apply for one and hope to God it comes back in time for your appointment for the other. Ridiculous system all around.

This is one of the friendliest consulates that I've been to. I came here for a visa and got one in a timely manner. Highly recommended. Make sure you call well before you travel if it is a high season.

Good day,

My name is Noel Anthony Francis and I recently received a non-immigrant visa from the US Embassy on March 16, 2016. I am taking this opportunity to express my deepest gratitude and to share my experience.

I cannot recall the name of the officer/agent who interviewed me except to say he was at the last window during the morning session. During the interview process the very first question required me to provide proof of my job status other than the company shirt I was wearing. I did not bring my job letter or identification that day which under normal circumstances would have been an instant rejection.

The officer/agent to whom I'm eternally grateful saw something in me and used his discretion to give me another chance. After a 30-second pause which felt like hours, he began asking me questions about my organisation, family life and reason for visit. I answered every question truthfully and was granted a visa.

I visited the United States between Thursday March 31- Monday April 4th. I attended the Florida Relays in Gainesville, Florida for the first 3 days. It was a great experience. I met some outstanding athletes and coaches and saw great performances. My stay got even better on the 4th day as I attended the world renowned Disney World, went shopping at Walmart, visited the Clermont track facility and a MLS game in Orlando City between Portland Timbers and Orlando City. I thoroughly enjoyed my trip and look forward to more pleasant visits this time with my family.

I am giving credit where it is due and no praise can be too high for that officer who gave me a second chance. Thanks a million to the US Embassy.

Sincerely,

Noel Anthony Francis.
Quick and fast

reviews.text: They must know how to serve their Filipino people well. I was there to renew my passport and had to clarify with the man in the first counter which has to be done first: biometrics or payment... he then said, " Ano ba una kong sinabi sau?! Dba maupo ka muna sa pulang upuan bago sa yellow! - (pabagsak na tono)." People in the consulate, was I wrong to clarify with where to go and which to be done first???? I do not deserve an attitude because I was only clarifying. Plus I suggest your people wear name tags/ IDs to be recognized! Thanks for this and would indeed be my last to be there to renew! Kuddos to your service. You are all paid to do your job and do it well for your fellow Filipinos.

I think I had the worst experience from this place. On Sept 15, my father died, but I could not go home because I had my passport renewed last June, so I phoned them knowing that around that time they are already preparing for the passports to be sent to their owners. I heard the news from my family around 2pm in Saskatoon, so it is already 4pm in Toronto, someone answered me and told me they are already closed though they know my situation, and instead gave me an emergency phone line which is supposedly open 24 hours, so I phoned that line but the woman who answered me was so rude and would not do even check if my passport is already there and could be picked up because she already went home. The woman who was in charged of the emergency phone doesnt know anything about what is going on in their office, saying that she was only in charge of the phone. With a broken heart I opted to wait for the next day, before I could book flight from Saskatoon to Toronto to  the Philippines. So early in the morning 9am Toronto time, no one is answering the phone then around 10am Toronto time, that was the only time they answered the phone and had me passed from one person to another to another just to check if my passport was ready and can be picked up. So then I was able to book my flights, but the flight I was able to book to Toronto would be arriving 5mins before 4pm, so I informed them about this and in a begging manner asked if they could accommodate me and I will just grab my passport, the woman on the line asked me to just call once I landed because she is not sure if anyone would be staying in the office. The moment I landed I was phoning their office and their emergency line, not a single person answered and their voicemail is full. Not knowing if their would be anyone in the office I still went there, as soon as I got there, there were about 20+ employees inside the office. I was fuming with anger for the stress they put me through to add to the pain I am feeling for the loss of my father. The workers in this consulate are heartless, inconsiderate, lazy and undependable! This is the face of our government extended here in Canada! You are a shame!

They had a piece of paper on the left side that was covering where it calls your number, but its confusing because they give you a paper with A on it in the beginning then the number. For example they gave a paper that said "A26" but the counter only shows 26. There was a huge confusion among the people. I know its stupid to write but I feel it needs to be said.

Update 2: A multiple of emails over the last couple weeks and a couple phone calls and no response. Do everything you can to avoid these guys. 

UPDATE: Paid for a multiple entry Visa in the Philippines and only received a 3 month/single entry visa. I have emailed them and have been waiting for days. They take bank draft only, so no way of getting your money back. Until they fix this issue, DO NOT SEND YOUR PASSPORT FOR A VISA. If they fix the issue, I will update my rating accordingly. 

Have consistently tried to contact their Visa department for the last 3 days, calling 4-5 times a day. He's always out of office. Very difficult people to work with.

Okay, so here's the deal.
I'm an Israeli citizen who's passport just recently expired and I'm trying to get it renewed.

Just like everyone else here, so far no one answered the phone or gotten back to me via email (Typical Israeli Public Service Behavior).

Only difference is, I live all the way in Denver, Colorado and they don't have an Israeli consulate here.

If any of you have had any kind of luck in the past getting a renewal for your passport, I urge you to tell everyone about it over here in the review section.
Share whatever knowledge you may have to make people's lives easier.

It will help not only me, but also to everyone else who is trying to get the same thing done.

Thank you.
-Yakov

Very professional staff. Did my APPOINTMENT thru embassies.gov.il/la. Everything went smooth. Did my notary papers and even extended my passport. Guys was very nice and friendly. I don't know why there is so many complaints?? This is serious diplomatic agency, and in my opinion you have to behave accordingly. Also, there is no phone customer service, go to website and leave the email like every modern adult. Be nice and you will be treated like a king!

You can call and leave a massage, they will call you back in 1 to 2 business days. We had to go to LA because we change names and we needed to renew passports also. Appointment was on time, the lady was very helpful, polite, knowledgeable.

Truly an awful experience. The website instructions are wrong, and it was very difficult to get in touch with anyone via phone to get the instructions and the forms. The background check from the FBI must be less than three months old, and if not you will have to get another one. The online form will not accept a large and odd range of words and characters, from the word "and" to a "/." If you enter any of the forbidden characters, it will delete the entire form and log you out. The consulate staff does not tell you this unless you email back about the form not accepting your information. 

The pictures I sent in were wrong (which was probably my own fault) but they were very rude in demanding that I have new passport photos taken. The original fee for the student visa was $140, which I submitted with my original application in early July. When I called in mid-August to make sure my application was complete, I was told that it was. I was then called a week later and informed that the fee had changed on July 1 to $160 and that I must send $20 more. I did, the following business day, then sent an email saying the money was on its way. Two days later I received a very angry phone call from the woman who works at the consulate demanding to know where the money was. I explained to her that I had already emailed and the money should arrive the next day. She hung up on me. 

FINALLY, one week before I was due to leave for Chile, I receive an email from her saying my visa is ready for me to pick up on Monday in Los Angeles. This was on a Thursday, and I live in Colorado and was planning to fly to LA the following Wednesday. She told me I'd have to change my flight because the consulate does not give out visas on Tuesdays or Thursdays. I cried the whole day, positive that I would have to cancel my whole semester abroad. Fortunately, my father managed to call her and convince her to give me an appointment for Friday morning.

Picking up my visa took LESS THAN five minutes! And she wanted me to spend hundreds of dollars changing my flight.  

Sorry for writing a novel... 
Point being: Getting a visa will be a royal pain. It is expensive and the bureaucracy is unbelievable. The staff is rude and difficult to reach. I never want to leave the country for more than 90 days ever again.

Visa information is supposedly available via this number in the mornings from 9 am to 12 pm. However, I called, went through the phone tree and was told by a recording that I could (A) leave a message; and (B) my questions would only be answered via the website. 

They deferred everything to the website.

Went here to obtain a tourist visa for Vietnam.  Clerk spoke English and explained I could use their computer to fill out required form and print. I did so and then left my passport, form and 1 photo with them for processing.  Was able to pick it up 2 days later with visa intact. It cost NT$1350 for single entry, one month visa.

The fee for a single entry 30 day tourist visa is NT1850 (as stated on various sources online), but they tried to charge me 200 extra. They said it was because I filled out the form by hand (their printer wasn't working). After asking about the price increase, they begrudgingly let me pay the normal price, mumbling something about giving me a discount. Don't let them overcharge you! Also, try to print out the application form in advance so you don't have to use their ancient, ailing computer and printer.

reviews.text: The efficiency of the embassy (especially as compared to others) shows part of the reason why Greek economy is not going well. I came at 10:10 AM, got a queuing number of 13, and now they're just starting to process number 6 (and I've waited here for a solid 2.5 hours already). I am a citizen of Russia and permanent resident of the USA and needed tourist visa. Contacted them by e-mail and they replied next day with detailed info. Contacted them by phone to confirm that online info was correct. They were polite, friendly and caring - they were concerned for me to have enough time to get a visa. Personal visit took 15 min and was all about business. The lady who checked my papers said that everything is "perfect" and she needed only one additional paper. She was frank that she does not know exact name of this document but we understood each other. She regretted that they did not have free map of Prague available:) I visited a few consulates before (not the Czech Rep.) and I feel weird after visiting this one because I did not have to prove that I am a good reliable person, I did not feel intimidated, all talk was about paperwork, and it took no time. I appreciate their work and help very much.

I am a Czech citizen living in USA, in San Francisco. I have to say that I hate dealing with bureaucracy but this consulate is quite the opposite. They ALWAYS pick up the phone, don't let you wait and if you happen to call during lunch break or super busy hours, they ALWAYS call back. Professional, nice and extremely helpful and patient. I have no complaints. In fact I think that this is how every consulate should work. Thank you for being here for us!:) Ivana Scott (Starikova)

I have obtained all necessary papers, invitation from a very high-profile studio/marketing agency in Paris, a financial guarantee letter and a bank statement that shows that my income is very high. They asked to have an agreement but this was not the case because I am only a freelancer and I am there working with an Italian company but we will make the recordings of the video-game in the French studio. They said; so we need only the agreement from the Italian company!! I have bought an agreement from another very well know company in Italy, signed from the CEO and we have CC'd the French Studio and they also attached a letter giving all necessary details, ALL, the videogame's title, the duration, the talents name, why they need me there, everything, stamped a signed. They did not get back to us until Philippe the Studio's owner had to call them from France and they said I will be rejected because the contract is with an Italian agency!
