TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!
I returned to Vietnam from the U.S in mid-December 2015, my flight back to the U.S is on January 18, 2016 which has a layover in Tokyo and I had to move from Haneda Airport to Narita Airport, which meant I need a transit Visa.

As soon as I returned to Hanoi, I called the embassy and no one answered the phone. I had to email Mr. Ryouji and he was very helpful, even though he replied very late (5 days after I sent the email).

Mr. Ryouji provided all the information I needed. Later, I called them again and a lady (not working at the Visa) admitted that the Visa representatives never reply phone calls. She was very helpful but I was shocked at the Visa department. The only one star in this review is for her, I wished I could rate this facility without any star. If I could rate that lady separately, I would give her 5 stars for being honest about the system. 

My experience while I was at the embassy was VERY DISAPPOINTING. First and foremost, the agents did not accept my application and asked me for the copies of almost every document. This information was not listed in the email. Furthermore, they also asked for another document to be filled out. It took me at least an hour to get back to the line to talk to one of them. Everything could be done better and faster by providing all of this information on the website.

Secondly, as soon as my application was accepted, the agent told me that I will have my passport back by Monday, January 18, 2015, in the afternoon. YES, My flight is at 2:00 PM on the same day. I told her so, and she replied me discourteously "The em co muon xin visa nua khong?" (So, do you still want to apply for a visa?)

I understood that the embassy received a lot of applications everyday, but this situation happened to not only me, but many other people and it seems that the embassy has failed in training the staff as well as improving the visa process.

I totally understand the struggle but the staff's attitude in this situation is unacceptable. I would love to re-rate the embassy as soon as I see some improvements.

reviews.text:
We have used these guys for Russian Visas and Passport renewal on short notice. They came through.
We are very satisfied and will use them again.

Dreadful, awful service. They charged me $20 for Canadian permanent resident card photos, which were so inadequate they were rejected by the Canadian government due to "poor quality." An extremely rude woman at the company then had the gall to tell me they had warned me that they pictures would be rejected ("the Canadians always reject pictures") and that they would not return my $20. When I insisted that no warning about rejection had been given she shouted, "Yes it was." Don't think I have ever been so insulted by a company that is supposed to provide a service to the public. Don't even think of giving them your business. Agggghhhh!!

Not a very professional organization and seems ill equipped for recent changes in the photographic standards of passport agencies.   Unlike other companies providing passport and visa photographic services Universal Passports and Visas does not offer re-shoots of rejected photographs, provides no guarantee of their work and will not refund for rejected photographic work.   

In the last year I've had passport photographs rejected by multiple passport agencies.   Other companies offering photographic services when presented with the rejection documentation will re-shoot the photographs.   Not Universal, they will blame the agency for "no rhyme or reason" in-spite of written evidence to the contrary.   

Fortunately, I found more professional establishment less than 4 miles away which was familiar with the new standards, recognized Universal Passports and Visa's failure and took the necessary photographs correctly.

I was invited on short notice to some work-related training out of the country. My boss recommended that I use UP&V to expedite things. I'm really glad i did because they bailed me out of a jam. If you're in a hurry, call these guys.

To be clear, they are a courier service... so they don't help you in filling out your forms. You still have to make an appointment at the post office and you bring UP&V the sealed documents. They over-night them to their office in Houston, and then hand carry them to the State Department. This beats the post office. :-)

But where they really came through for me was when my application was put on hold because I sent the wrong kind of birth certificate. I hustled and got the correct one in hand with 2 days before the deadline. I gave it to UP&V. They got it down there and pleaded my case to them.  This got my application reopened and my passport issued on time. I'm really grateful to them for their excellent service.
I love this place because my friend Helena said she loves it

reviews.text: If you are American, speak English only and is trying to get a visa to Brazil they treat you well. But if you are Brazilian you are lucky if all you get is a scold. I've been yelled at, called dumb, irresponsible by the ppl who work there.

While I was not able to get my visa on my first visit,, I would say that the Consulate was well organized and pleasant and the people were helpful.  I would also recommend that visa applicants read the website carefully to make sure they have all the paperwork that is needed.

Came here to get my travel visa and the lady who helped me was really friendly and polite. Once I was called up, it took no more than 5 min.

When I first entered, I waited in the one long line. Then the guard asked the people in the line who was here for travel visa. He counts how many people need a travel visa and goes back to one of the counters and spits out waiting number tickets. He hands them out to you and then you can just sit in the large waiting area.

You have to make an appointment online and print out the email confirmation and bring in the other sheet of paper with your photo and signature on it. Once you have a time, I would just show up right when it opens. You do not have to come at the designated appointment time. The only thing I did not try was once I got my appointment, could I come on an earlier date. My suspicion is that it is fine. 

I've been to other consulate offices and they seem to work a little faster , but not by much. 

Overall, great experience and I hope I am greeted with such politeness and friendliness when in Brazil.

In the website was around $125 DOLLARS . In the phone was $ 80 DOLARES. I CALLED MONDAY.  AND THIS AFTERNOON 2 TIMES still say $80 .dollars . And in the person was $120 DOLLARS the fees for just renovated the passaport I was so frustrated and disappointed about the information didn't met enywhere. They  needs fixed about that for who need some information for any fees for the consulate. I don't think is far pay something is not true.  Also when we schedule the day e time for the passaport. They call me around 10am. Say the fees  is $120 DOLLARS. I was finally than everything was over 11 am. The don't even respect if someone have something for do after that.

my son and i were there for tourist visa..he's getting married..after all the negative reviews and dramas i have read i can't lie i was all shaking and nervous even though i had all documentations they request, our appointment was at 945 we were called around 11:15. all it took was 5 minutes the person who took care of us was very polite..3 questions and bump comeback next week for the passport. Now ill be there again for my daughter who at the last minute finally her boss gave her the ok to assist, but i have to walk in because the appointment is Dec 28 and we fly Jan 2 i been trying like crazy everyday to find an spot but nothing, i was told if i get there early they accept visas with no appointment which it means i have to get up early but no choices, also im the one whos going to process my daughter's...hoping everything goes fine like with my son..will see.

Indonesian Embassy established in the year 1966 or 2 year after the opening of diplomatic relation between Indonesia and Ethiopia in October 1964. The Embassy has 10.000 Sq.M area of land, it's strategically located in the South of Addis Ababa city, precisely in Mekanissa Road, Addis Ababa.The Embassy consists of two big building, namely Chancery Building (1.200 m2) and Residence Building (Wisma Indonesia). Since almost 48 years ago, it is noted more than 12 Ambassadors of Indonesia occupying post in the Embassy‚Ä¢The presence of Indonesian Representative in Addis Ababa is extremely strategic considering Addis Ababa is capital city of Ethiopia and there are lots of head office of international organizations located in said city, such as UN-ECA (United Nations - Economic Commission for Africa), AU (African Union), ICRC etc.Meanwhile, the presence of Indonesian representative in Addis Ababa has also portrayed a historical link between Indonesia-Ethiopia whereas the two countries are the participant states of Asia-Africa Conference Year 1955 and the founder of Non-Aligned Movement. So far, Ethiopia has not opened yet its representative in Indonesia, whereas Ethiopian Embassy in Tokyo, Japan, covers for Indonesian

reviews.text: This is the best embassy I ever visited. Always very friendly and professional consuls and security personnel. Been there few times and every time, am very impressed with them.

I just went to the embassy in Washington DC to update my passport and get some papers.
At first the security guy looked tough but very quickly we got in, and they were very helpful. Not only that, but contrary to what other reviews I saw  before writing this said, the person helping us at first was very nice and was definitely very professional and efficient.
Then we got to the desk and got the help we needed. She was very patient, very understanding and extremely helpful.

Israeli's are tough at nature, but trust me they were extremely helpful and I got everything I needed to my full satisfaction. 

Parking was NOT a pleasant experience, but the embassy itself was more than I had expected 
Overall a definite 5 star experience, and anyone saying otherwise has either failed to actually go, or was already having a very bad day.

I am writing this message in regards to an incident that happened today. I had scheduled an appointment for today at the norway embassy. I had it scheduled for earlier but had to reschedule for today. I arrived at the embassy but they denied having any appointment set up for today. There was an appointment that popped up on their system by name but they denied it and said that it was for someone else. They then went on and accused me of lying even when I proved with all my documents that I indeed was the person who made the appointment. Then the supervisor was called and even though I proved to him as well that I indeed was the one who made the appointment, he refused to consider the facts and instead chose to side with the staff. There was an Indian lady who constantly stated that I was lying and I was heavily discriminated on the fact that I am Muslim. The Norway Consulate is completely corrupt. My paperwork was solid and so perfect with checklist and they did take 2 weeks to issue the visa (one star) but they found no other item to come back to me with other than issue a visa that is no good to me. After contacting them, they had the nerve to tell me I could apply again! So what, you can take more of my money? If I could give this place a negative rating I would. Some serious morons are working in this place and you can see extreme levels of unprofessionalism one can exhibit if you ever have to deal with them..

name: Embassy of the United Arab Emirates in Poland

reviews.text:
This Embassy is quite frankly the most outrageous operation I've ever come across! 

They provide absolutely zero service to British citizens - whichever service you may require the answer is "eeeh, we actually don't do this here, I can give you a phone number in the UK". 
They are also instructed to not give out any helpful information, so they will not answer a single question. For example, they cannot tell whether you have to send away your current passport to get a new one or for that matter whether it is even legal to remain abroad for "at least 60 days" without a travel document...
Why such useless place it still getting funding is absolutely beyond understanding!

name: The Consulate General Of State Of Qatar

reviews.text:
After dealing with the Melbourne Consulate from recognition of citizenship all the way to getting a physical passport today, I have a pretty good insight into dealing with consulate. Firstly, special mention to both Michela and Silvia. Michela was my main contact for the whole process and she was absolutely amazing in helping me out. Thanks to her.

The issues I had with the Consulate were frustrating. Their non-acceptance of discrepancies, whilst advertised is very specific. I know some consulates allow the applicant to write a list of discrepancies which is sufficient, but not so with Melbourne. Due to this, I spent a great deal of time at BDM Victoria which was a horrible chain of events.

Otherwise, the consulate is a nice place to visit. Bring a book though, as wait times can stretch, but I was mostly admitted on time. I can't help feeling like the place could be run a whole lot more efficiently with some minor changes, but I'm sure they know their resources and limits.

Dealing with the Italian consulate, whilst frustrating at times has been a much better experience than I expected, and this was probably due to the very professional and friendly staff. Grazie mille!

Utterly disgraceful, unhelpful and rude, the man attending to my inquiry was unprofessional to the point of smirking while I was asking relevant questions , I am baffled as to how they opperate- long waits, a call Center that may as well not exist, and rudeness which I have seldom witnessed before. They should be ashamed.

I think it's important to mention that the services I received from the Italian Consulate has been outstanding every time I have visited the office. I have found the staff to be attendative, friendly and professional at all times. The service provided by everyone has been excellent whenever I have required assistance. The staff go above and beyond when necessary. This has been the case for myself and one staff member who I am so grateful to have met is Sig. Antonio Scarati. No matter how busy he may be, he has the ability to assist me with any enquiry even at very short notice in the most perfect and professional manner and not to mention the genuine compassion he demonstrates. I totally appreciate the services provided by the entire staff and thank them very much for the professional and prompt attention everytime. Grazie mille per vostro servizio speciale e gentilezza.
If you book the correct appointment type online and arrive with all the correct documentation you can have a physical passport in your hands in 45 minutes! Very efficient!

Hang your head in Shame Italian Consulate in Melbourne!!! I have never had a good experience with you. You can't get any assistance AT ALL! That place should get a clean out & get new staff. One that WANT TO WORK & ASSIST.
I had to call the Sydney office who not only returned my call within the hour, they were so helpful & happy to assist me. 
Take a bow Sydney you are very professional & obliged to help when our own state can't be bothered. 
Now I will go to the Sydney page & give them the 5 stars the most certainly deserve. To everyone else, bypass Melbourne & ring Sydney at least they have a voicemail where you can leave a message & they will get back to you. Sorry Sydney for having to pick up Melbourne slack.

If you need a VISA to Italy, make sure you read very, very carefully all the extremely confusing instructions on their website before making an appointment. If you are wondering why their website is so slow, well it's because their servers are physically in Italy (?!?).
If in doubt, call the consulate and try to speak to someone to make sure you do have all the paperwork you need... and beware also of the people you speak to on the phone. Some of them are not actually prepared and will give you wrong information, besides being rude. Start the application more than a month in advance, so you won't have bad surprises.
My fiance and I had to throw away plane tickets and all our vacation plans because some bozo gave us wrong info on the phone, and we ended up being too late (10 days ahead of the trip...) even to apply for the VISA.

Please note the  Malaysian Consulate Jeddah Official requirements (for expats) which are not mentioned on their website
1- Application form
2- Photo
3- Letter from Kafeel mentioning 
a. Name 
b. Nationality
c. Passport number
d. Profession
e. Salary
f. Purpose of visit
4- Copy of passport
5- Copy of airticket
6- Sufficient fund (copy of credit card or one month bank statement)
7. Copy of Saudi Exit-reentry VISA

When will we ever get our act together????? I'm sick and tired as I know most Kenyan's are of mediocrity. What is wrong with the Kenyan embassy in the U.S, I thought Ambassador Githae was a performer, a reformer who was supposed to clean house and put things in order but I'm afraid that the pathological lethargy bug caught him too. When you have to call the Canadian Embassy from the USA to get answers and one is given prompt and courteous service it leaves me begging the question, "What curse befell the Kenyan embassy in Washington?". They say the apple does not fall far from the tree, the L.A consulate is no different than Washington as far as service delivery is concerned, I guess they learned from the best.

Mr Githae , this pathological lethargy is a reflection of your leadership and your implicit if not explicit complacency in the way things are done. Why are phones never answered in any department at the embassy....... ever, why don't you have a direct email we can reach you on, why aren't you on social media e.g. twitter etc, why don't we have a grievance process/mechanism, what did you come to Washington to do?. The Washington mission under your leadership leaves a lot to be desired and that's being polite.

Ambassador Githae, we deserve better than this raw deal we are currently getting from you and your delegation. reviews.text: I would give them a zero if i could. I have had to travel to Chicago twice and STILL  do not have everything needed for my trip. Tried several times to send stuff in for passport even after triple checking the checklist of things needed, only to have my stuff returned.     My son had notorized passport issuance only to have returned stating needs certification by secretary of state.  As i was explained, all public notaries are certified by secretary of state. Of course no one is reachable by phone so I  leave messages that apparently go nowhere because i have never gotten a call back.. email took a few days to get back where they basically copy and paste off website so doesn't answer my question there either. Asked notory for a copy of his certificate from secretary of state- sent back in.. guess what!! Got it in the mail today,  now they tell me that the certificate has to be original!! WTF!! How am i gonna get that??? Sure glad there is no one there to call and talk to.. guess i will make yet ANOTHER short 18 hour round trip to probably have them give me wrong information again. I tried very hard to be patient.. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!! They really need someone that can help over the phone. So much money and time down the drain.

They do not call you back or answer emails and are very rude and impatient when you finally manage to get a hold of them.  Over all, very unorganized and unprofessional.  Furthermore, they are not willing to assist in any way if you have questions about the website or visas, and their hours are completely nonsensical.  The website is also obsolete.

OK folks here is the real deal. The consulate themselves are not that bad but their directions for the paperwork ARE.

Please READ all instructions. Biggest mistakes I saw were as follows:

1. Get a PASSPORT PHOTO taken by Walgreens as your photo, DO NOT ATTEMPT to take this yourself. (I was turned away)

2. Make sure the payment is a USPS money order (you can only get these at certain post offices, make sure you call ahead). No other money order will work.

3. You MUST have your travel plans booked and your e tickets printed for entering and exiting Brazil. No exceptions.

4. Make SURE you bring proof that you live in the Chicago consulate are of service. (utility bill or current ID with address)

5. Get there at 9am sharp as they only see people until 11am. You don;t want to get there and then be turned away.

Those are my tips enjoy!

Went for my Business visa for Brazil. I was forewarned about the paperwork etc. But my experience at the consulate was a breeze. In and out in less than 20 minutes. Just have the paperwork in order (USPS Money Order, Driving License, Flight Itinerary and Letter from Employer). 

No expedite option exists. But applying in person (rather than using an agency) is faster - 10 business days.

They haven't mentioned at all the payment methods on their website clearly. I couldn't find that I had to carry USPS money order. And when I got it after having struggled for about 45 mins to find out the nearest post office etc., they were closed. I had to take the pain of driving back again the next day and it's a 2 hour drive one way. They were least empathetic about my issue when I tried telling them about the issue.
I hope I get it on time to travel :(

name: Embassy of the Republic of Korea

reviews.text: I love it and thank you Google . By the way you are my best search

Rude staff. Extreme security measures. Humiliating waiting area (which is actually outside the embassy permission in  the sun). 
Third-world treatment. Unexplained anger and frustration from Egyptian and American employees alike. Trashy coffee. No questions answered by anyone of the staff anywhere, regardless of what the question is. P.s. I'm a US visa holder

U.S citizen services are horrible and unprofessional. I find the staff to be very unhelpful and rude. The wait times are usually ridiculously long. The cashier takes numerous  of breaks often times making the process longer. Every time I went I was frustrated and overwhelmed. Also, you aren't allowed any phones or other devices, which is understandable. However, it would be nice if magazines were placed out on the tables as well as the television be put to use instead of having people sit in boredom. If you are military. I'm sure they will treat you a lot better. On the other hand,  if you have all of your documents and a aggressive attitude with the staff you can get things done more effectively....hopefully. Btw, it took multiple trips and over a year to get my child first passport amd CRBA completed. May the odds be forever in your favor!

The embassy staff and procedures are poor and lack in professionalism and professional standards.

Everything from the hotline, to the queue, including a waiting time of up to 2 hours is sub-standard, but I am going to mention the most important point: the interview.

I answered every question reasonably and succinctly, including inappropriate and random ones like "is it common in Arab culture for a man to visit a woman?" (neither I nor my friend in the US are Arab!). I had all the required documents and supporting evidence, but he didn't ask to see a single thing and when I said I had a document from work, he said, and I quote: "I don't look at work letters"!

After that, at the end of the worst interview ever, by what is possibly the worst interviewer ever, he said he will deny me a visa under visa denial 214 (B) and handed a letter "explaining everything". I asked him to explain in his words and he said he believes I will go to the US and not leave or return. Did he forget where I'm from (the United Kingdom)? Did he forget where I work (a well-known charity)?

I left the embassy both disappointed and disgusted by the application and the interview process where an incompetent man or woman can say 'no', based on a whim and not a legitimate reason. What's more, there is no option to appeal/challenge; you just have to count your losses (literally) or reapply, repay, and reschedule an interview and pray you will been seen by someone with sense.

I can only imagine the amount of money they make through applications and re-applications, especially from people who genuinely want to visit the US for medical and/or personal reasons. If you're looking for a piece of advice or a suggestion I would say simply: be prepared. Be prepared in terms of documentation and supporting evidence and be prepared to be told 'no' for no proper reason.

I hope this has been beneficial and of some use --- let's hope my case is isolated and not the norm.

Good luck!

Zak,
From the UK

If you go with a good application you'll have no worries and rejections. 
Some things to keep in mind along with what is specified: 
1. Carry a xerox of you full passport(all pages even if blank) Needed it for Spain Application. 
2. See what percentage of face area should be there in your photo with background (differs from country to country, available on online forums).
3. During visa collection carry a photocopy of your passport.
4. They accept only cash payment, so make sure you carry it (closest ATM is 500 to 800 meters)

There is a Xerox and Photo centre in the application area but it's usually crowded and costly.

I submitted my original degree certificate and marksheet transcripts at VFS Global BKC Centre.
Received the documents in an extremely poor state. The documents were wrinkled, twisted and folded at several places. The extent of the damage cannot simply be the result of careless handling and storage, but it seems to have been deliberately tampered with by some depraved person(s). Henceforth, I would be wary of handing over important original documents to such irresponsible people. If required, provide Certified/Notarised true copies, but, never ever hand over your precious original documents!
They nevert revert back to customer queries. Their customder help-line is of simply no use.

UK Visa  Application Form is the worst I have ever filled visa forms.It is so cumbersome and tiring and can not be filled without the help from Travel Agent. It seems that they have deliberately kept such not user friendly visa forms that you are compelled to go to Travel Agent. They have courtesy to ask for how was your experience for the form , but even if you opine in negative terms , they do not improve or change the form.

I recently had gone to the Italy Application centre in VFS for my visa application, The centre is okay, staff is friendly but it can get really really crowded during the normal working hours of the day.
My suggestion would be to book the application at 8:00am slot when the Crowd is minimal

Thai tourist visa - quick, efficient and hassle free . The visa was issued on the next day without additional fees. One of the few requirements is to present proof of your next destination leaving the country along with your application. Usually a ticket or booking reference is sufficient. Note the correct address: 77 Tr·∫≠n Qu·ªëc Thao,  District 3, HCMC
Discrete building with some flags visible. Sorted Thai visa next day for $40. Make sure you have evidence of some sort of EXIT booked when applying.
Quick service, visa for 3 month for Thailand
Quick process, if you have the full pack of evidences.
Well spoken and polite staff, very professional and efficient

lots of bad reviews for the consulate and expect most of them are from years past. The customer service there now is top rate.

I got there early to get a 2 month tourist visa and even though they were not opened yet, the security guard was nice enough to allow me to get a ticket, regardless. I didn't need one because there were only two other people there. not crowded at all and perfectly organized.

It took about 15 minutes total to provide my paperwork and pay the fee. I drove up from San Diego and expected to spend the entire day there, but it was fast and easy. 

I cam back 4 days later to pick up my passport with the new visa and that took me about 5 minutes. Everyone from start to finish was as pleasant as I could expect and the entire experience was no hassle at all.

I think it's important to go to the website to get the list of all the paperwork you need. Make sure you have the visa form already filled out and don't forget to bring your pictures.

When you get to Indonesia, you'll have to visit Kantor Imigrasi if you want to extend your visa and the process is much more complicated and time-consuming so prepare yourself for that. Here, however, everything went as smooth as can be. I'm very happy with the process.

I don't even know where to begin with. Okay let's try this. They don't know what they're doing. They didn't give enough information, they're rude, they're not helping and all they did is raise their voice. As an Indonesian, I'm really disappointed with their service and their cockiness. Not only they think they know everything but they misinform me in everything I asked them. They told me to go to LA to take care of my passport and when I got there they told me that I don't have to be there. They told me to just bring my marriage certificate and my passport; apparently I need to provide an envelope and a passport photo. They told me I didn't explain well of what I need. They're the one who doesn't speak English well and misinform people! I've been disappointed many times by the people who works in Indonesian government in Indonesia but I didn't expect to be disappointed by the ones who are sent abroad to represent Indonesia. Shameful! Such a disgrace!

I'm stunned by the failure of this business office to do the public service they are getting paid to do!!
There is not even one star deserved in this review.

Worst embassy i have been too, and I have been to many. Always something missing when you go there. They really need to get their things straight,  and please have some respect for people. Everyone's negative comments are exactly true.  They do NOT post the complete requirements online and then convey them to you one by one just to stall.  It's simply a power trip for them to see you run around following their orders trying to fulfill yet another missing requirement.  Rude is an understatement.  I have truly never seen such poor service and apathetic employees.  Their faces are emotionless but their attitude makes it obvious that deep inside they are spiteful and suspicious.  Maybe not of you specifically but they take their frustrations out on any one they can- and since you need them, you are their victim.  I have visited several times and ran around tirelessly wasting money and time making copies etc  to only get back to the counter literally out of breath to have them tell me that something else was missing for a visa, which they could and should have told me before I ran all around.   If you are not Pakistani, I suggest you make friends with someone who is and take them with you.  They are extremely racist to foreigners and will not give you any consideration unless you speak their language.  The Pakistani people should be outraged and do something about this.  Pakistani people are generally so nice, respectful and friendly but unfortunately this embassy does not represent them well.  Please note I am American, non-Pakistani descent.  They seemed to be especially difficult and racist toward me, not to mention sexist too.

reviews.text: This address is incorrect and it is not clear where they moved to. Please update the address or at least a phone number asap to prevent people from wasting their time trying to find it.

Compared to the Consulate in Philadelphia,  the folks in Baltimore are a lot more courteous and helpful.  Makes you actually want to travel to Italy.  Reminds you of the hospitality that once was prevalent throughout Italy.

For those folks in Philadelphia, you should drink more wine or take a happy pill.  After all, you represent your Country.  Don't make us hate it with your bureaucracy.

Incompetent at best, purposely idiotic at worst. I wanted to drop off my ballot for the election. It was nothing like they told me it would be. Some moronic remarks from the German security guards, then nobody let me in. I had to give it to the dude in the booth. I was told I can PERSONALLY drop it off in order to make sure it got there. Too many Germans working here. Rude and inconsiderate.
R√ºde und unfreundlich

Erstmal vielen dank f√ºr die vorhergehende Beurteilung. Sie hat mir sehr geholfen. Doch finde ich das noch einige wichtige Informationen fehlen. Die Uhrzeit des Termins ist nur dazu da, dass nicht alle Antragstellenden zur gleichen Zeit oder zu sp√§t kommen. Ich war um 8:30h dort sollte aber erst um 9:15h einen Termin bekommen. Das hatte dort keinerlei Einfluss. Ich kam sofort dran. Wenn man am Oskar Helene Heim aussteigt geht man die Clay-Allee hinunter bis zum Konsulat und stellt sich draussen vor dem Geb√§ude an der Schlange an. Man wird in kleinen Gr√ºppchen zur Pass- und Personenkontrolle gebeten. Die gleiche Prozedur wie am Flughafen. Wichtig ist hier das man keinen Rucksack dabei hat. Taschen scheinen in ordnung zu sein. Nur keine Rucks√§cke! Falls jemand dennoch seinen Rucksack dabei hat  kann er ihn f√ºr einen Euro in der Bahnhaltestelle am Kiosk hinterlegen. Alles andere steht auch in den Unterlagen wie keine Handys, Mp3 Player, .... Die Leute dort sind echt nett und zuvorkommend. Wenn man drinnen ist sortiert man seine Unterlagen und stellt sich in der ersten Schlange an. Eine sehr nette Dame √ºberschaut diese nocheinmal und hilft falls etwas vergessen wurde. Im Prinzip muss man nichts mitbringen! Man kann dort zur Not alles neu erstellen. Naja.. ein DS-2019 vielleicht nicht. Man sollte sich auf jeden Fall 6 Euro in Kleingeld mitbringen, da recht viele Leute Probleme mit ihren Fotos hatten. Einige Fotos konnten nicht eingescannt werden. Aber es gibt dort einen Automaten. 
An Schalter 3 werden die Inhalte der Formulare gepr√ºft. Auch wenn die Online ausgef√ºllten Formulare nicht ganz fehlerfrei sind. Die Software kann nicht alle Daten auf den Formularen abbilden. Es muss jedoch alles auf den Formularen stehen. Mein Tipp! Schreibt nicht zu viel. Das interresiert die eh nicht! Mit Photoshop k√∂nnt ihr die PDF Formulare korrigieren. Nun bekommt man eine Nummer und darf warten. Anhand der Nummer wird man zum Schalter 6 gerufen und gibt seine Fingerabdr√ºcke ab. Und zwar alle Finger und auch wenn man einen Biometrischen Reisepass hat. Nun wird die Nummer einbehalten und man darf sich wieder setzen. Man wird namentlich zum Schalter 4 oder 5 aufgerufen. Hier findet das Interview statt. An einem Schalter hinter Glas wie in der Bank... Das hatte ich mir anders vorgestellt. Es verlief bei mir recht Problemlos. √úbrigens sprechen dort alle auch Deutsch! Ich wurde gefragt warum ich denn ein Visum brauche und ob ich schonmal in den USA war. Anschlie√üend habe ich einen Stempel bekommen und mein Visum war genemigt. Insgesammt war ich keine 2 Stunden in dem Konsulat. Ich hatte aber das Gef√ºhl ich w√§hre der erste der Wieder raus durfte. Soweit ich das sehen konnte haben die eh nur bis 12Uhr ge√∂ffnet. Falls man mit dem Zug anreist k√∂nnte man sich hinterher noch Berlin ansehen. Der Reichstag kostet auch nichts! Schlie√üf√§cher im Bahnhof findet man √ºbrigens unten in der Tiefgarage! Sie kosten 3 Euro und das Geld bekommt man nicht wieder. Der neue Bahnhof ist unglaublich Riesig. Man verl√§uft sich dort schnell. So, jetzt aber auf nach Amerika :) 
Vielleicht noch einmal kurz an dieser Stelle. Vielleicht h√§tte ich das zu allererst schreiben sollen. Leute die in ihrem Pass eine Verbindung zu einem Land haben welches mit den USA einen ungel√∂sten Konflikt hat bekommen grunds√§tzlich kein Visum. Im internationalen B√ºro wurde mir gesagt, dass es durchaus einige sind die kein Visum bekommen. Ein Komoliton bespielswiese ist der Sohn eines Mitarbeiters des deutschen Konsluats in Beiruth und wurde in Beirut im Libanon geboren, lebte dort jedoch nie! Er bekam kein Visum! Obwohl diese Krise schon 1958 vorbei war.

Hier eine kurze Beschreibung des Ablaufs, wenn Ihr Euch ein Visum bei der US-Botschaft abholen wollt:

Beim Ankommen steht meistens l√§ngere Schlange vor der Botschaft. Nehmt m√∂glichst einen fr√ºhen Termin und kommt auch fr√ºh. Auch wenn ihr ein bestimmte Uhrzeit mit Eurem Visa-Termin mitgeteilt bekommt, hier gilt: "first come, first serve" (jedenfalls fr√ºh morgens).

Die vorderste Personen werden dann in einer Gruppe von 5 oder 6 Personen zun√§chst in einen Vorraum f√ºr einen Sicherheitscheck gelassen. Hier Reisepass bereit halten, da dieser von einem der Beamten √ºberpr√ºft wird, au√üerdem muss man seine Uhrzeit f√ºr den Termin selbigen Sicherheitsbeamten mitteilen. ACHTUNG: Handys und schweres Gep√§ck zuhause oder am Bahnhof im Schlie√üfach lassen, dieses kann hier nicht aufbewahrt und darf nicht mit reingenommen werden!!! Als n√§chstes m√ºssen alle Metallgegenst√§nde, inklusive G√ºrtel, wie beim Flughaften abgegeben werden, damit diese gescannt werden k√∂nnen. Nach dem Scan und der obligatorischen Sicherheitsschranke erh√§lt man seinen Reisepass zur√ºck. Das zust√§ndige Wachpersonal war aber sehr witzig und nett.

Die gesamte Gruppe wird dann in die Botschaft in einen gro√üen Aufenthaltsraum geschickt, hier sieht es √§hnlich aus wie in jeder gro√üen Verwaltung: Sitzpl√§tze und ("Ticket"-)Schalter :-). Hier muss man am Anfang des Raums zun√§chst erneut seinen Reisepass einem Sicherheitsbeamten zeigen, der dann den eigenen Namen auf einer Liste durchstreicht. Der Sicherheitsbeamte wei√üt Euch dann auf einen gr√ºnen Zettel hin, der die Anordung der Formulare, die Ihr dabeihaben solltet, beschreibt. An drei kleinen Tischecken mit Kuli habt Ihr dann die M√∂glichkeit, alles aus den Schutzumschl√§gen zu nehmen und in richtiger Reihenfolge zu sortieren.

Dann m√º√üt Ihr Euch leider schon wieder in eine Schlange stellen. Von einer Art Seket√§rin werden Eure Unterlagen dann auf Vollst√§ndigkeit hin "vor√ºberpr√ºft". Kleiner Tipp: VERGESST BLO√ü KEINE UNTERLAGEN UND √úBERPR√úFT SCHON ZUHAUSE; OB ALLES VOLLST√ÑNDIG IST UND HIER ALLES MIT UNTERSCHRIFT UND DATUM UNTERSCHRIEBEN HABT (das erspart Euch Zeit und √Ñrger).

name: Botschaft der Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika, Konsular-Abt.

reviews.text:
I was rather surprised. Both electronic and customer service provided at the consulate itself worth 10 points. I have booked appointment online which was very simple and straight forward. 
The person that served me (right on time by the way) at the consulate was very nice and pleasant and provided all information needed. It has been ONLY TWO WEEKS and my daughter‚Äôs new passport is with me! I understand that it is rather an exception than a rule but I'm very please with overall experience

Not very good at picking up the phone waiting over and hour for a phone call to ask for some information about my passport.  Also I never received no call or email saying my passport has arrived. Had to chase them about it wasn't very happy because the lady took all my details down and promised to call when it has arrived. 
Over all everyone was very nice

After reading not very favourable reviews I thought to write mine. It is true that Embassy gets very busy and you need to be patient waiting if document needs to be collected the same day. Majority of people,who came, were families with small children, so it got noisy and crowded but everyone was polite and staff members did their job well. It took me over an hour to get return papers for my son but all in all it was not too bad despite my apprehension.
The website is not easy to use and the information provided on the website is unclear. But great service within the embassy.

Staff never answer the phone! Very irresponsible! Only one office in the entire UK and this is how you manage it!!??!! Why should I bring along a little kid all the way from North of England to South of England for her travel documents? The kid has travel sickness and I do not want to waste the journey in case they say I have something missing that I should have brought (or done) along with me prior to visiting. There should be another way to do so. The kid was born in UK and needs to visit Lithuania why should she travel to London from Northern UK and show her face to you to get her the travel documents!!?!!
Stressful journey for parents and especially single mothers who have more than one kid to take care of! Shame on you for your carelessness. You need to improve your service, big time!

Had my passport renewed in November 2015. The people working there are very decent and respectful despite the chaotic attitude of the customers. I was kept waiting for an hour which wasn't the embassy employees' fault but rather the customers who kept jumping on the queue; the typical Iraqi way! I had my application all done in the same day despite the fact I had made few mistakes in the application form. They helped to reprint and re-fill the application form which is highly appreciated. My passport was posted to me so I didn't need to come to Sydney again to receive it. The only down-side though, they didn't answer the phone when I was calling, I had to call the English line to have someone to answer the call.

Very bad customer service. Went there from Melbourne to renew my passport and was told that the system is down. Waited 3 days in Sydney and returned back to Melbourne without renewing my passport (waste of time and money). Then I got a call the next day telling me the system has resumed and when I complained about what has happened, I didn't get an apology. However, I was told that these things happen in the American embassy as well (what a ridiculous comparison). 
Systems can go down in any institution, but then it becomes the responsibility of that institution to treat the customer in a due manner that appreciates the time and effort he is taking to visit them. 
Frankly this consulate truly represent what Iraq really is!!!!
hello iraqi embbay am mansurah but please answer phone what time open  and what time close ,,,are you open now

My booking fee went through but all the details of my appointment got erased from the system! Anyway, i explained my situation to the security at the embassy and he passed on the message. They could have said its non of their business and i should sort it out with the VHS myself but they didnt. They saw me only a couple of hours later that day.

No answer at all.  They won't even let me leave a voice message.  If there were some other company I could go to in order to get a visa, I would have done it several days ago.  Now it looks like I'm just stuck and I won't be able to go to Russia at all because this company is too lazy to open its mail or answer the phone.

reviews.text:
Staff is arrogant, lazy, cavalier, condescending and unhelpful. Rude and straight up dismissive if you ask questions about what is not obvious.

No one ever answers the phone or e-mails. As a whole the Brazilian government is shameful and disgraceful; their work mentality is irrational, built on an authoritarian tradition which is sad and counter-productive. Definitely not recommended.

I'm Brazilian, Lost my passport and after reporting it to the police, went to report to the consulate. Oh boy... they don't give a f**k. The police officer are more interested and preoccupied than them.
It's been days and absolutely no contact. They don't care that I don't have any kind of ID with me, don't answer directly to any of my questions, and even if I do exactly as told, the almost refuse to acknowledge it.
The are bigots, arrogant and totally unhelpful. If you can't go there, I'm very sorry for you. They never answer the phone, and are extra lazy with the e-mails.
Oh, and never forget: even if you are away from that country, they don't care. Someone steal your money and documents? Don't care. No money, no new passport. 
Seriously... the worst consulate I have ever been to.
I came in prepared with everything that was stated on the website. The people were friendly and everything went smooth.
Useless people reflect the current situation of my country.

In Spanish, we say "La cara del santo hace el milagro."  If you are going to visit another country, the first thing you need to learn is how to navigate. In Brazil, as in many countries, the person sitting in front of you is going to get the service. I went in person and waited my turn. The person who assisted me was courteous, answered all my questions, explained how to complete all the forms and explained how they could accommodate my mistakes.  You cannot expect the entire world to adapt to your world view or your take-out, drive-through mentality. If that's what you want, stay home.

Hi! Be aware of the new security measures since November 2015, at the reception of the building they will not allow you to go upstairs if you have a bag, even a small one or an empty backpack. Just come with your documents. The Consulate staff is very nice and efficient.

I was so disappointed about this embassy, they can't provide any adequate informations. When I called them to ask if I can apply for a visiting visa in France while I'm in visit here in Chicago,  they put me on hold for more than 15 min before they finally said that I can only apply when I stay here for at least 3 months in Chicago. At the day of my appointment they said they couldn't give me the visa cause I'm in visiting here. I was so disappointed and depressed after struggling with all the requirements they needed. Mrrrrrrrd.....

Me and my family needed a visa to go to France in March. Although we were missing documents, the two officers were very kind and patient. We were able to submit additional documents by email. We had the surprise to receive our visas in the mail less than a week later, even faster than what we had been told during our interview. Having applied for visas in the past for other countries, I have to say that it was the best experience I had in a consulate in a long time! We will again visit France for sure in the very near future! Great service, great people, amazing country!
Nice, very friendly and helpful.

Drove 10 hours to Chicago for nothing. Never experienced anything like this. Three of us went there, and he gave two of us the visa and for some reason turned me down. It was for a nine day trip with a university and I already paid for everything. Rude as hell. Told me to leave immediately and didn't bother to explain. I was in shock so I stood there for a bit and begged him and he threatened me that he would call the security on me. On an effing girl. He doesn't deserve to be the representative of a country. Shame on you.

I've already been interviewed for two types of a visas at the Frankfurt consulate, J-1 and E-1. The officers were always very kind, friendly and patient. They all also speak German perfectly.
One con: The waiting time for the interview can be up to 2 hours, so make sure you bring a book or stay at the cafe, which is located in the waiting area. The interview is really quick in case you have all your documents.

I wish all consulates were this friendly and helpful. Reception was excellent, and they processed my request quickly and professionally. I have to admit I was worried, but they put me at ease.

Three things make this 5 stars versus merely very good:

1 - The friendly reception - I was treated as a normal human being.
2 - Whenever I did not have all the necessary information, they actively worked with me to resolve the issue. Many government agencies will stick rigidly to the rules, and tell you to get out until everything is perfect. In this case they worked with me and my situation to make everything perfect. Very impressed.
3 - At the end they actually asked me for feedback - I did not at first have all the necessary documents, and they asked me what my source of info was so that they could try to improve it and avoid gaps in the future.  VERY impressive - there was no arrogance, no assumption that it was my fault. This is an absolute first for me.

Hello,
As an American living here in Germany going on 30 years. I must attest that I appreciate the professional and competent services offered to us Americans.

At every instance I have had to correspond and visit this US facility, I have been met with dealt with respect and  left with the feeling that my particular wishes or issues had been attended to. 

Thank you one and all personnel at this facility.

Respectfully,
E.C. Jr.

I love Singapore

Only get a Visa here if your airline requires you have it before flying out. It's cheaper to use an online agency, $10 to $20 USD and get (pay) the entrance stamp $45 USD on arrival in Vietnam. The consulate charges more than anywhere else and only excepts cash. The price for 3 day turn around is $100 CAD. A friend of mine in China paid $77 CAD at the Vietnam Consulate in Beijing on the same day. I know it's not much money, but it is a strange system when private Visa companies charge less and you don't have to go anywhere for the documents. I hope I see large lines at the Visa counter in HCMC, lol. Then I will appreciate the value of the consulate.

If you're applying for a visa here, beware that they don't unnecessarily overcharge you and check the date of the visa.  Also, you don't have to provide a photo or self-addressed delivery envelope if you're going to collect your visa in person, despite what it says on the application form.

The way they overcharged me was by asking me when I'd like it.  I asked if they could do it by the following day and they simply said yes.  They didn't tell me that this was the most expensive 'very urgent' option.  A four-day turnaround would have been fine for me, but they didn't tell me that.  Check the prices before you go.

I applied for a visa to start on a particular date but the date they actually put on it was four days earlier than this.

Consulate is constantly over-crowded, two hours wait time even if you arrive on time. No place to sit down. 

Horrific bunch of bureaucrats. Inefficient and arrogant.

Always very friendly and helpful, however do your home work. Like much of American customer service it is partially self help. That, means you need to go to their website to research solutions on your own, download forms and follow the procedures for making appointments etc. Honestly some of the one star comments sound childish whining from spoiled brats that can't do anything to help themselves.

The first time I went to discuss an issue I had with an employer who threatened to rescind my Visa.
The Embassy did not help at all.

The second time I waited an hour for the person to tell me that they couldn't instruct on me on how to renew my visa for a 90-day renewal.  

I just called them now because my visa is going to permanently expire and they said they do not handle that issue.  

What good is my own country's Embassy if they don't help their citizens, or give them information on how to proceed?

And why is their staff primarily Chinese? 
Their English is not that great, and it is difficult to understand them.

Terrible experience.
Thanks for nothing, US Embassy in Beijing.

reviews.text:
There's not much there --don't waste your time.

The Los Angeles Korean Cultural Center houses a tiny library, along side a small, seldom changing, museum display centered mainly on the now nonexistent Choson dynasty. The upper floors may sometimes play host to cultural arts displays and various meetings but this hardly qualifies the center as a "hotspot" for Korean culture in general. The center also is home to the King Sejong Institute that offers classes in Korean language, but the head of the institute has appeared rather terse on more than one occasion --I got the feeling that if I were a pretty young lady or perhaps dressed in an expensive suit the situation would have been different. 

Anyway, if someone is really interested in Korean culture I think they would find a lot more enrichment through Korean Meet-up clubs and taking some Korean classes at the community college.

I was unnecessarily nervous based on some of the reviews here so I thought I'd chime in about my experiencing with getting a US visa.

1) security check is simple. Make sure to read you document. No electronics (including fit bits). 

2) first line up is to ensure you have the right documentations. You have a checklist to ensure you have everything.

3) 2nd line is for finger prints and showing your photo.

4) 3rd line is where they ask questions. I only heard people getting declined because they had not been in Canada long enough.

5) they asked me 5 questions
1-where in the states do you plan on visiting
2- why are you traveling?
3-for how long will you visit?
4-what do you do for work? (Don't answer with a company name, explain your role)
5-how long have you been in Canada?

***other questions I heard, very basic***
What countries have you traveled to?
What school do you go to?
Do you have family in the states?

Honestly I am disgusted by the amount of people saying they are racist. Its completely bs. Of the 50 ppl I saw 30 ppl were brown. 10 white. 10 Europeans. Tons of people got approved.

An interesting observation I saw as a person of a colour is my fellow brown people were dressed in suits and blazers with their hair done and ties. The Asians and Europeans came in track suits and did not present themselves professionally. It goes to show that brown people are very worried and try their hardest. Do not fret. I am very pleased with the process and I now have a 10 year visa.

I only went there once to get a visa for visiting friends in the US. Because I had read all the rules and had prepared all my documents based on what I had read and the discussion I had with my friends with experience, I didn't really experience any issues. Considering my ethnical background and my field of study a clearance check was expected. So I got my visa after 1.5 months. Because I had planned ahead I could go to US as planned. Visit 4 cities. Be at times square for NYE2013 and enjoy the live shows of Psy, Taylor Swift, etc. And the beauty and coldness of NY.

The website indicated that re-applying visa will not require another interview, however, they still requested one after me sending passport over... It consumed half of a productive day.

Note: NO electronic devices whatsoever.

Here's a detailed review from a person who has gotten a lot of us visas at this location. (Total count 6) 
1.The security check point. They're always nice. They don't have the same responsibility that the agents who grant you permission to their country do. So don't expect any royal treatment from the agents besides the occasionally bubbly ones. This one thin lady with short hair is golden. 
2. Be straight forward. When they ask you questions they want a sharp exact answer. Don't beat around the bush. There is a lot of appointments in that 10-15 minute time slot so don't treat it as a special therapy session. Every extra delay effects the appointments to come. That's why a lot who come in at 10-11 will complain about the long process. ALWAYS pick 8:00-8:30 appointments. You will be in and out in  20 minutes. 
3. If you have any immediate family or very close family in the US and your status in Canada is simply worker or student and you want to visit USA than you pose a threat to them because you have more reasons to stay in the us.I know it's ridiculous in your head but there's a lot of people who do that so they're only trying to "protect" the country from more people going in and staying illegally. 
4. If you are a student/worker make sure you have enough supporting evidence that you will return to Canada. Many students show up there and they don't have an answer to who supports them financially when they are unemployed. Say your parents! If that's the case. Always support your case. 
5. If you are trying to lie about something bluntly and your story doesn't add up they will reject you. 
6. You don't specifically need an event to attend in order to visit USA. You can simply go to visit the many different states. 
7. Most of the cases rejected have had one of the above mentioned questionable and a few are because sometimes the agents see you as suspicious. Nothing you can do about it but make sure you have all paper work good when you show up and ALWAYS have supporting ones if there's anything questionable. 
8. Some of the questions asked: what's your status in Canada? How long have you been in Canada? Are you employed ? What's your profession? Where do you work? (Rarely how long have you been working there) if you are a student where are you going and what are you studying? (Rarely are you planning on staying in Canada after your studies or what's your plan basically) Why do you want to go to the United states? Have you ever been to the united states? Where will you be staying? (Rarely for how long) if it's a specific event they will ask a few more questions like place,date etc.

I have never felt the reason to review anything until my experience here. As I was planning for my passport renewal process I read the reviews of Pak Consulate NY and I was definitely anxious. Some of the reviews people have written here are really negative. With that in mind, I took a day off and drove 5hrs to get to the consulate. There were a handful of people in the waiting area. I arrived @ 9:05am and I was out by 9:40am. There were no issues, the people were very nice and I received my passport within 2 weeks, even though it was not expedited and was scheduled to arrive in 4-6weeks. If you follow the requirement instructions on the website, there is no need to worry. People who complain are usually the ones who didn't compile documents properly. I wrote this review specifically for well-organized individuals: you have nothing to worry about :)

I ultimately need to move to Sweden and become a citizen. I was always treated with respect and patience when I called this office. Everyone I interacted with did their best to help me. While waiting for my residence permit to be approved I called numerous times and always felt like I was receiving the highest level of service. Everyone did their best to answer all my questions and offer me the best assistance possible.

Worst experience ever. Last year on August 31st me and my husband suppose to visit our uncle in Sweden who had sent us an invitation. I am an American citizen as a result I didn't need visa from here but my husband needed because he was a permanent resident. After 10 days of his visa interview we were informed that his visa was denied because we suppose to have certain amount of daily deposit in the bank. Point to be noted here. In their website where it says what one needs for visa it only says bank statement for last 3 months. We had submitted both bank statements of our checking and savings accounts. In checking we didn't have a lot; however, in savings we had enough deposit. If these people decide not to pay attention is this our fault? They never checked our savings account's statement. My husband requested them to recheck the statement and as usual they took their time to answered us back because they really don't care about people's situation. As a result we had to cancel our flight, and very unfortunately the plane fare was non-refundable. I have never thought that with a permanent resident card someone's visa actually can get denied. My husband had submitted copy of his most current paychecks, copy of my paychecks; moreover, our uncle submitted his financial documents which showed he is able to support us. Altogether we have lost $1636.00 because the plane fare was non-refundable. If some people of the Swedish Embassy did their job correctly and paid little bit attention we wouldn't have to lose $1636.00.
Ask for Marie, she's patient and doesn't mind if you don't speak Swedish. I had an unusual situation getting my passport and she was very helpful!
Love sweeden!!!

People who write angry negative reviews lack perspective and understanding of the process. They do things the way they do because it is mandated by law and rules. This is not a private business serving you for your satisfaction. Leave your attitude at home and come here to get things done. Read their website for instructions, come early, bring ALL of your documents with copies and be prepared to wait a few hours. I've come here a dozen of times over the last 8 years, and I was always able to get everything done on the same day.

Hint: if you ask nicely, you would find employees taking an extra step to help you.

This is the worst place I have ever conducted any business with. If this is a representation of Jamaica then that's total disgrace to the nation. I experience more professionalism at any fast food place than the ones I experienced at this place. They don't answer your phone calls, if someone does answer they have nothing to tell you except call back next week. They talk to customers in the most unprofessional way. As a Jamaican I have to say I am a shame of these people representing the nation. There is no one to contact to make any complaints you have . I have applied for a passport renewal at this place and it's FIVE MONTHS  now and I am still waiting on it. I have had two family members died since and couldn't attend the funeral because these people have my passport hostage. I have another friend who told me it took her 8 months to get hers back from them. If you can find any other resources to conduct any business without using them I recommend you do so. This is the last place on the planet you want to interact with. YOUR EXPERIENCE WITH THE CONSULATE OF JAMAICA NEW YORK IS GOING TO BE A HORRIBLE ONE.

This place is absolutely horrible. WORST most unprofessional customer service ever. 4 times my pictures were declined and I did everything they asked. They do not inform you when there is something wrong with your passport so you have to call them or you'll be waiting forever!!! Been waiting for my passport for 6 months!!!! Spent $110 dollars for something I can't receive!!! You guys need to get it together.

Instructions and information is very important when you're doing any form of business. First of all a lot of people write negative reviews about this place, I have none. I lost my passport and when to replace it, like everything else in life there is a process and order in which it will be done. I when there the first day explain to the lady at the window my reason for being there, she ask me to identify myself and other documents which is respectfully posted on their website, similar information about the necessary documents was given to me by a representative on the phone.
If you're the type of person that don't like to follow order and instruction don't do business. Whenever you intend to do any form of business fine out all the requirements before you begin. I'm sick of people bad mouthing Jamaica and Jamaican people for one bad experience. Jamaica overall is a nice country and you have people there and here from jamaica with a heart of pure love. Will give you their last and don't even know you. 
If you had a bad experience and is not a fault of yours I'm sorry. My experience was great. I already recommended people. Most important is a place of business not a place to link up with Jamaican, if you want to link up go home to Jamaica jezzz I'm out.

This is the WORST place to do business. As a Jamaican i am embarrassed to be associated with this place. They tell you that something is wrong with your picture because they want you to come to the office and pay double what you would pay in other reputable places. SCAMMING IS ALIVE AND WELL when it comes to doing business with Jamaican consulate.

Today at 11 am (go early)  I went to the jamaica consulate, the first few things I did before going was I printed out the application. 
Most importantly: go accross the street [This Pix] and get your photos done trust me they will not accept any photos not done properly  !!!!!!! Bring your birth certificate and old passport!!!! Money order and cash is fine .. anything else refer back to their website and read everything!!! 
1.Section A. Fill it out accordingly 
2.Make sure your signature stays in the box when signing and it has to match the bottom signature on page 2 it's a must I did mine over 3 times 
3.Section D the information is in your passport if your renewing you don't have to fill out anything about a lost passport 
4.Section E. On the dotted lines put your passport number there again  and the date of Declaration would be the your applying for the passport

An absolute joke.. trying to get a form for a passport without having to travel all the way to the embassy. No one answers the phone. Ever. And no one responds to the email either. A messaging service tells you to call another number...which is also never answered. Such a joke. This is affecting people's lives. Do they not understand the importance of passports for people?! why have a phone and email system that no one looks after. Ridiculous.

I have just called to the Embassy today, asking about the visit visa from England to Ireland. There is no need to have the embassy staff if they do not want to do their work or answer to other people. I wish the staff should be more helpful than just to push the people away by the way she speak impolitely. It is the worst impression, I do not even want to go to Ireland anymore because of the bad impression from their own Embassy people.

I want to start this review by saying that every negative review I read, I cannot relate to. I applied for a Temporary Resident Visa and Mr. Ricardo Daniel Bercerril Martinez was the person that helped me through the process, which by the way, took about one hour. When I had to wait I visited with some folks from Mexico and shared my desire to live in Mexico. Now I have blue eyes and there was no racism directed toward me. I talked to Mr. Martinez about my wanting to immerse into the culture and he was very encouraging to me. I don't know anything about what these other folks experienced but it is 100 percent opposite to what I experienced. In one hour I left with my Temporary Resident Visa but not before saying goodbye.

Got my visa fast and with no hassle. Great services. I will definitely come again for other visas.
Call around.  These guys want to charge $100 more than the next most expensive visa service for China.
I always use Visa Express, they are fast and efficient. I applied for the Visa for China and got a multiple visa valid for almost 10 years!

I spent a week in St. Petersburg, Russia, last june, and used Visa Express as my agent to obtain a Russian Visa. I found the service very efficient and personal. The Visa was ready n about two weeks, and everything went as expected.
I am returning to Russia in 2014, and will be using Visa Express again.

For years I have travelled extensively for my work, thus I can usually navigate my way through the myriad forms and papers when applying for a visa.  Not true for the new process (as of June 1/12) for the Russian Visa.  YIKES!  I gave it my best efforts and still the clock was ticking -- with erroneous and misinformation coming from my contacts in Russia and absolutely NO progress with my visa application.  So, as in the past, but now in a pinch, I once again turned to Stella.  In her usual professional, quiet and straight forward manner she proceeded to do it all from scratch with me right there in her office (located in a quiet neighbourhood very close to the 401).  Passport and visa arrived with days to spare and my business travels were confirmed.  While in Russia I compared my visa application experience with colleagues who also used visa services in the Toronto area and discovered that my Russian visa was processed in less time and at less cost than that of my colleagues.  Thank you Stella!    
--  Manuela 
(Fulford Academy & Fulford Preparatory College)

reviews.text:
I thought this is an Embassy number, but it is like a voice-mail that says that is is full and visit a certain website to leave a message. It is a representation of the UK for god's sake. Hinduja seems to have bribed the UK government and made a pact. Now everything is money. Why do I need to spend 4 pounds to ask a basic question, and that too over web-chat. What are they taking the money for?

This is the worst visa application experience that I had to go thru for my loved ones. Never again will I let them fly British airways. A visa application that asks which color underwear am I applying a visa in is plain stupid. Keep it simple. But then you are NOT USA. You are plain British.

Keep your pride and avoid this application process.

Horrific .... took over 30 mins to find an option for an operator and that option was emergencies only ...... no one answered .....  all seemed to have gone home over 30 minutes before closing or were ignoring phones. 

.

Menu makes no sense doesn't let you to operator if you are lost, few options to go back in the menu and auto service hung up on me over 6 times. 

.

Disgusted this is representing the UK in terms of organisation. Feel very vulnerable as i now know I would be unable to contact my embassy in an emergency and have abandoned my plan to stay longer in LA. 

.

Used embassy in 3 other countries ...  this is the worst ! unrepresented, un supported and unable to attain any aid. Think its better closed so i hadn't wasted my hour calling them

Its impossible to reach a human being when you call this Consulate or even leave a message. I am being told by UK passport Government service that I can renew my UK passport at no charge for one year by making an appointment with my nearest Consulate office. Its impossible to do. The recorded message keeps referring all callers to contact the UK, although it was announced in the UK on 7 June  2014 that individuals in the USA should contact their nearest consulate office to renew their UK passport to help offset the backlog in the UK..

Unlike other reviewers, I have to admit I've had a positive experience with the British Consulate in Los Angeles. I have applied for the visa numerous times via mail and got it in less than a week. 

My only concern is that they require applicants to do fingerprinting every time they apply for the visa. I think doing fingerprinting once is sufficient especially if the Green Card,  the Drivers License and the employer are all the same. Maybe they require that for criminal record check too. 

Most of the European consulates are not allowing people to call directly in unless they pay a fee per call. Sounds like they're trying to reduce number of calls. The British consulate is no different than others from that perspective.

There is also a web page that allows people to send their questions to. I used it and received a response the following day.

Ahmed

Why does the consulate answering machine direct you down a long chain of options to the "General Enquiries" desk, only to announce that the consulate cannot answer general enquiries? 

Isn't answering general enquiries part of the reason the consulate exists?

Whenever you call you have to listen to a series of "if you need this, press this"; no matter what you press, however, you are forwarded to voicemail, told that you haven't provided a "proper code" (even though it doesn't ask for one), and it hangs up on you.  

In short:  you cannot get in touch with any living person through their phone system.  

Their website does not offer assistance on many different things and, if you make an appointment for the wrong department (because you can't find one that suits your needs), you will be turned away if you needed a department that was not listed.  So, even showing up in person gets you absolutely nowhere.  Also, you cannot make appointments with the correct department through the phone, which complicates things un-necessarily.  

Overall, I'm going to give my experiences a 1 star, if I could give it 0, I absolutely would.  This system seems designed to make you give up.
Horrible all around. Whoever rated it 5 stars, you're clearly a shill. Guards are rude, service is slow. The worst embassy I've ever been to.

The US Embassy is not helpful in any way possible. I found out from the Danish Police they will not verify my drivers license, much less pick up the phone.  I was under the impression that embassies are supposed to help.

If you're an American citizen, as I am, avoid this place like the plague. The lines are long, the security is tight, and the waiting times in the shabby little lounge are interminable. You can't have your phone, iPad, Kindle, or computer with you inside, and if you bring either of the latter three with you, you will be denied admission. Bring a book instead - 'War and Peace' will probably suffice, or perhaps John Dos Passos' 'USA Trilogy' (1312 pages) for an American twist.  

Most Embassy services, like passport renewal, can be done by mail. It costs more, but it saves a great deal of wear and tear on your nerves. Do it and have a happier day.

HOWEVER PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT THERE IS NO OFFICIAL PARKING SPACE - the road in front of the embassy cannot be used as a parking/waiting space (there is a sign, however it cannot easily be seen by incoming cars, and even if the security guards say that you can park there as long as the driver is there, do not believe them. The road is not part of the embassy thus the local Taguig City government/road enforcers can issue the driver a ticket with a violation "obstruction of roadways" and hold their license until the fines have been settled).

There is a pay parking space inside McKinley Hill a few blocks from the entrance near the embassy, takes a couple of minutes to walk to but definitely better than having to process your fines in somewhere else within 5 days.

reviews.text: Embassy of the United State in Cambodia. The Embassy has a very high security, but the staffs are very helpful and friendly. In the Embassy, there is a library called IRC that has many good book and document in English language. The library welcomes to everyone to do self study, research and practice English through computer system. For those who want to get in the library, you need to bring your ID card or student card and ask the security to enter the campus; they will guide you to the place. Moreover, the atmosphere of the campus is very clean and comfortable.

I made an appointment with the embassy. When I arrived, I had to stand in the hot sun, around 100, for an hour before I could enter. Once I finally got inside, I had to wait another hour before talking to someone. Fortunately, the lady who assisted me was very professional and helpful. If it we not for her this would have been 1 star.
Also considered as a good library aka IRC. I love this place. People are very friendly and have a very high security...

reviews.text: My wife was locked in a cold room with men and women for 14 hours by mexican immigration because her passport was hole punched. When I was able to call the consulate it was closed and the emergency number that was given in the message didn't work.  My passport says to call the consulate of you get detained.  But I don't think that I want to go to Cancun again. It's lucky that my wife didn't get attacked by the men locked in the room with her,  because it's one big party at the consulate.

name: Embassy of the Republic of Maldives in Riyadh

reviews.text:
Not bureaucratic at all.
Very efficient and helpful staff.

I was very impressed by the fast and helpful service I got there. Had to renew my passport, and got it in just over 4 weeks. Their recommended time is 4 to 6 weeks. 

Staff were friendly, wait time at the consulate was around 20min, since I was there in just around 11:30 at the end of the closing time for making submissions. 

If you are applying for passport renewal, just make sure you have all the required documents as pointed out in the website. Make the required copies and take all you think is necessary. Do not forget stamps and envelope if you want it posted, and take the exact change that you are required to pay.

It is very strange that you can not speak to any one on the Telephone on number given on Internet. 

Called many times to speak to some one at the Consulate. A machine is answering but No one in Person to speak to. 

Called many time at Cox and Kings.-- same sad experience. No one available at this time call later  is the machine telling you. 

Why don't you say, get lost, we are busy and have no time to speak to you.

Don't try to be "Valaitee"( English) even there they answer the phone in Person !

Hopefully some one at the consulate reads this and takes care of this problem !
Alles ok
Efficient and friendly

The automated services are disgusting. .its as if they don't want to speak to you .when you do finally get through the staff are nice and polite. .but the wait is usually 20 min and was told they were 2 or 3 people were answering the phones ..and thats for the whole of the uk..unbelievable. ...so the one star is for the staffs polite manners ..that is when you eventuality get through

I just wanted to say how blown away we have been by the service we received this week. We realised on Wednesday that our son's passport had expired and we were due to fly on Sunday. My husband was seen at the Peterborough office on Thursday morning to submit a 7 day fast track application. On Friday when we called we were told it had been printed, and this morning (Saturday) that it was out for delivery. I have just opened the door and received the passport! I know we have been lucky but the efficient and informative communication we received from your staff over the last 4 days has been so impressive and far outweighed what we had hoped for. Thank you.

Rude staff. Very slow. Nothing seems to motivate the workers there. A real bad place to go. IF you can, I would try and do it back in Ireland as you can travel there with a driving licence or work ID. Avoid.

Seven weeks to date,Received on the 2nd of February and only moved to stage 2 within the last week.I have emailed twice and first email only outlined turnaround times during busy periods,so impersonal as info is on the website.The second email response was from an employee stating turnaround times again.I am furious that i am unable to speak to any customer advisers on this issue and i am still waiting for my sons passport to be issued.Adding insult to injury the actual turn around times at present are comical as  the below are stated on website !!
As of 18th March 2016:
Renewals:
10/11 working days
Passport Express:
20 working days
NI Passport Express:
15-20 working days
These times are a guideline rather than a guarantee.
Please apply in plenty of time - we recommend 6 weeks in advance of travel.

When in with extra I.D. requested because of a previous lost passport. 

This was photocopied, I stressed you can take the originals as this is what the letter I received wanted. Told no p/copies taken here are fine. I asked three times are you sure. Six weeks later tracking site says application not being processed, letter in post. You guessed it, after waiting nearly an hour on the phone told because Dublin only received copies. When I pointed out the above, just told ``oh well, you will have to take the extra I.D. in again''.
