What a waste of effort and browsing our very own Embassy Website in the UK. In the FAQ where you're suppose to have at least a glimpse of what to do or even just a simple explanation to know what are the requirements needed to sort out your problem, click the link.... NOTHING!!! But, when it comes to FEES... Ooops! There you are, clear as a shining day.  You want to check your SSS in the website? Just follow the link and.....ads and ads and just ads. Call the mighty Phil Embassy? If you're on prepaid, don't bother for no one will answer you at any time. For those who had been answered, you're very lucky. Might as well pass it on to a call center back in the Philippines. In that way, more jobs for our countrymen. I wonder, what have we done to deserve this kind of Embassy?. Surely, we are doing our share by contributing to the economy of our country.   I am a patriot but This is a disgrace and full of embarassment.

I sent an email to the email address provided on their website.  A helpful reply was provided within 2-3 days.  Of course, I would have appreciated a quicker reply, but I didn't think it was unreasonably long.

First of all this is embarrassing! The embassy, staff, and how everything is being handled is proper unprofessional. The website does NOT work! The phone does NOT work! No wonder the country itself has no progress in any way at all. Being an embassy, you deal with really important matter/issues, so the least you can do is update your technology and maybe update the staff as well as everything and everyone is just incompetent. How are we, the people whether or not a Filipino suppose to trust you in handling our important documents if you can't even do your job properly?!. By the way I don't know what this guy MICHEAL PARSONS is on about his review about negative reviews in here made by foreigners because to be honest with you mate I AM A FILIPINO myself and I am experiencing difficulties in making contact with my own bloody embassy! And I have Filipino friends inside and outside of the UK experiencing the same problem. So, you are so lucky to be seen to in a very efficient way man.

Hi my name is D.swain Original from india but i live in Thailand since 2002 i have married my wife is thai, i love this country even more than my country. Thai people are very friendly and help mind people this is my personally experience.

I have small business here in Thailand  about fashion design and yoga studio. I have visited most Asian/Europe  countries expect North Korea and Malaysia. 

North Korea is not normal but Malaysia is normal as people think but its totally wrong imagine if anyone think like this. On below i will explain how cruel is Malaysian immigration and system:

I had Malaysian visa but at that time  my passport pages was finished i got new passport but my Malaysian visa was still valid. i have visit to phuket to KL because i live in phuket, also one of the my friend come ti KL from BKK to KL, my friend also was new for Malaysia i told them once arrived in kl just waiting for me at air asia bus counter even they can not speak English.

Ok when i arrived in kl immigration said i have not visa even i have showed them visa they said this is not valid because i got new passport. they send to me immigration office for visa, i told everything to them they said can get visa have to show money i had some thai baht but i had 3 credit cards, i request them can some one go with me then i can get some cash from ATM machine then they send some one with me we went to ATM machine but that one was out of service, after that i request to that person please bring to another ATM machine but he doesn't listen and just came back to immigration office again.

Even i beg to all officer they don't try to understand seems to be the they don't want help me, i was worried about those people who waiting for me at airasia counter, also i have booked 5 star hotel at kl  , even i request them i have 3000 thai baht i can pay for visa but they said need show money to i am staying in Malaysia. when i said pls bring to me right ATM machine which one do work they answer this is not our problem.

After all they put in me jail one night i was real shocked about this even i have visit to several countries never ever happened with me, they put me in those jail where were criminal people live all over world.

Even i request them can call to my friend who is waiting for me on arrival airasia counter even they dont try to help they dont listen anything to me. it was one of the my bad time in Malaysia i get high BP while in jail, even i have sent to email Malaysia embassy in Bangkok they did not reply anything, in fact at that time 10 people from thailand they met with me in jail too they also said they are surprise how can they put in jail to them even they have credit card money everything.

next morning i get flight from KL to phuket also those thai people get flight in same time.

why Malaysian people so cruel and selfish even govt people as well.

I wont go anymore this country in my whole life even my kids family etc no more never ever never.

War heute dort,weil ich woanders in wien einen Termin hatte,und muss sehr loeblich erw√§hnen,dass
Mir nach dem Anlaeuten ,und einem kurzen Gespr√§ch ,anfangs auf englisch dann perfekt deutsch

Informativ sehr weiter geholfen wurde, trotz regen und der russischen Feiertage 7.u8.M√§rz

Privjet Russia

Ich war heute bei der Konsularabteilung der RF Wien und war angenehm √ºberrascht, dass ich - nachdem ich an der Eingangst√ºr gel√§utet hatte - freundlich ins Haus gebeten wurde (auf Deutsch, da ich des Russischen nicht m√§chtig bin), dort sofort drankam (hatte √ºber Internet einen Termin vereinbart) und die russischen Angestellten des Konsultates √§u√üerst freundlich und zuvorkommend waren. Nat√ºrlich sprachen diese Angestellten ausgezeichnet Deutsch. Da man - wie auf der homepage informiert wird - nur nach Terminvereinbarung hinkommen darf, gibt es auch nirgends lange Warteschlangen. Und unser Visum f√ºr mich und meine Tochter kann ich schon in wenigen Tagen abholen. Nach meiner Erfahrung sind mir die vielen negativen Bewertungen f√ºr die Botschaft der RF v√∂llig unverst√§ndlich.
wenn ich 8 Uhr dort bin muss ich bis 12-13 Stunden warten das ist nicht normal.. Bei Russen Glaube ist normal...

Um eine Erfahrung reicher. 

Waren ca. um 8:30 bei der Botschaft wo sich vor dem Zugang zur Konsularabteilung (Zust√§ndig f√ºr Visa, befindet sich auf der Bahnstra√üe!)  ca. 10 Leute eingefunden haben. 
Bis 9 wurden es immer mehr und man merkte das Russen nicht wirklich was von Anstellen halten und sich daher einfach vorne zur Reihe stellten. 

P√ºnktlich um 9 kam der W√§chter zum Tor der den Ablauf komplett in russisch erkl√§rte! Von Zweisprachigkeit keine Spur. Zum Gl√ºck waren ein paar Russen so nett zu erkl√§ren das es eine Reihe f√ºr Visa und eine f√ºr russische Passverl√§ngerung gibt. Eine begrenzte Anzahl wurde hineingelassen und dann wurde durch die Fernsprecheinrichtung (wieder nur in russisch) durchgesagt ob Visa- oder Pass Ansuchende hineinkommen d√ºrfen. 

Nach einer guten 3/4 Stunde kamen wir nun auch endlich durch die 2 Metallgittert√ºren durch und waren im Botschaftsgeb√§ude angelangt.

Dort mussten wir unseren Rucksack Tasche Schl√ºssel in ein Kastl sperren. Vorsicht! Die Kastln sind wirklich sehr klein daher sollte man auf einen Rucksack eher Verzichten. 

Durch den Metalldetektor durch waren wir endlich am Ziel angelangt. Dann gings auch relativ flott. 

Bei "Visa" anstellen, Dokumente hergeben dann bekommt einen Zahlschein den man auch gleich in der Botschaft per Bankomat oder Bar bezahlen kann und fertig. 
Das Visa kann man sich in 10 Tagen von der Botschaft holen. 
Fairer Weise muss man auch sagen das das Personal sehr nett ist.

Wir waren an einem Mittwoch bei der Botschaft um unsere Visa-Antr√§ge abzugeben. Wir waren um 8:15 Uhr vor Ort. Da warteten bereits 4 Leute. Um Punkt 9 Uhr wurde aufgeschlossen. Inzwischen waren bereits etwa 14 Personen dort. Der W√§chter erkl√§rte den Ablauf (Visum bzw. Passeverl√§ngerung) nur auf russisch. Nachdem ihn ein paar Leute verwirrt anschauten, fragte er durch die Menge "Visa? Visa?". Es durften nur etwa 8 Personen rein. Die anderen mussten draussen warten. Drinnen muss man seine Tasche in eine kleines Schlie√üfach geben und durch eine Sicherheitsschleuse durch. Oben im ersten Stock gibt es dann 3 Schalter f√ºr die Visumsantr√§ge. Zwei Schalter waren ge√∂ffnet. Die Dame die unsere Antr√§ge bearbeitete, war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit und erkl√§rte den ganzen Ablauf bzgl Bezahlung und Abholung der Visa. Wenn man alle Unterlagen (P√§sse, Antr√§ge, Krankenversicherungsbest√§tigung, Einladung, Versicherungskarte) dabei hat, geht es relativ flott. Unsere 4 Antr√§ge brauchten etwa 5 Minuten. Dann muss man bei der Kasse alles bezahlen (Achtung: NUR KARTENZAHLUNG!!) und die Zahlungsbest√§tigung 10 Tage sp√§ter wieder mitbringen. Wenn man die Botschaft verlassen hat, d√ºrfen wieder ein paar wartende Leute rein. Fazit: Wenn man fr√ºh genug da ist und mit der ersten Gruppe rein kommt, geht alles fix. Und wenn man dann auch noch alle Unterlagen beisammen hat, l√§uft alles reibungslos und schnell ab.

PS: Wer lange wartet, hat nat√ºrlich auch Bed√ºrfnisse wenn er mal im Geb√§ude ist  - im ersten Stock gibt es Toiletten ;)

Pakistanis living in UAE are close to the 700,000 mark, maybe even more. Only the national database can confirm this figure. We contribute US$ 25 billion in the local economy, and yet all we get in return for this is just dissatisfaction. The world has progressed leaps & bounds, and we are still living in the 70s.

The building is seriously old, and outdated. It needs a complete overhaul, a complete restructuring. The queuing system needs drastic improvement. We need the MRP machines installed here in Abu Dhabi & Dubai. We do not want our applications going all the way back to Islamabad.

Families need to be put in a separate hall, it just doesn't help that people have to wait like this with kids. Priority should be given to them, and their work completed asap.

That being said, the main road Khalid bin Waleed is popularly referred to as Pakistani consulate road, since the beginning.

I asked if the consulate was open on Sunday, out of curiosity and the lady on the phone (with her thick Nigerian accent) replied with a the sarcastic answer "No we are even open on Labor Day" . I was not sure if I had heard her sarcasm correctly so I asked her to repeat herself and she started yelling at me asking why I would ask if the consulate was open on Sunday. I replied by telling her she was a representative and her job was to answer my question in a respectful manner. She then proceeded to yell some more and then hung up the phone. 
Now, I am also a Nigerian I know about Nigerians and our "Nigerian" behavior but even at home I had never encountered such blatant disrespect.

name: Consulate General of the Republic of Croatia

reviews.text:
When I read these reviews prior to going here, I was afraid. Afraid of the nightmare this could have very well been.

None of that happened. 

My friend and I applied for a tourist visa. Number one mistake people do; bringing their visa applications HANDWRITTEN. NO! Don't do that! All capital letters on the visa application. For a tourist visa, I brought the following...

Itinerary / tour invoice 
Copy of passport 
Copy of drivers license 
Passport sized photos
Visa application typed entirely in capital letters, with any non applicable space filled with a capital N/A. 

You grab a ticket and wait, but if you do the above correctly, processing the paperwork takes about five minutes. 

The woman who waited on us was nice as well.

Horrible waiting area and exhausting overall experience.
Insufficient number of office workers and far too many people walking around with no clue of what they are doing.
Yes, the guards are nasty too.
Oh yes, the people aren't friendly either, but hey, that's NY.
Don't forget to take copies of everything. Their copier sucks and cost $$$.
Remember, the primary goal here is to collect money, not provide service.
Best Wishes for an exciting day at the consulate...

I have been coming here year after year when I need to travel to China.  Yes they are not the nicest, however not the worst like some views said.  I am giving a 5 star as the bad average 2.5 star rating is not fair. I find some reviews here somewhat very unreliable .  They don't charge you until you come back to pick up.  So when someone said he left with a paid receipt and asked to pay again coming back, I just don't believe it.  True that their website is not very clear and the phone system is truly no good.  However the staff there is helpful enough.  They are stern but not rude. If you are polite enough to request info, they will help you.  Check out their website carefully to make sure you have all you need before you go there. It is New York, a lot people go there to get their paperwork done.If you show up without the correct info, you can't take it all out on them for not granting what you ask.  They have to move on to the other people.  It's only fair. If you are not the type who can understand the info online and be prepared, go to a Chinese travel agency and they will help you get paperwork ready and get the visa for you for a very small fee.

I was pretty terrified reading all the review. But all of all my experience was not that bad.

I came to the consulate on Thursday, May 5, 2016 to get my student visa done as I'm going to China for study abroad.

First of all, there's a parking behind the consulate building which charge you about $25 dollar for 2 hours + tips.

Once you get to the building, there will be a line. We came around 9:30am and waited for like 10 minutes to get inside. The police guard will check your bag. 

Once you're inside, go to the left counter to get a number. There will be a lady who will check your documents. I see about 25% people got turned down due to their documents incompleteness. 

I apply for student visa(X2) and this is what i brought :

1)Visa application form (V2013). You can download this from the Chinese embassy websites. Make sure everything is type except your signature and date. Put N/A on every empty spaces. Bring 2 copies just incase 

2) copy of passport page (notarized)

3) copy of U.S. Visa page (notarized) . I am not a U.S residents. I am international student on F-1 visa so this is a must

4) copy of I-20  (notarized). Also because I am on student visa 

5) original and copy of invitation letter from university in china (in my case the university for my study abroad)

6) flight booking page

7) copy of driver's license (notarized)

8) original passport, original everything that you copy. 

*Note about notarization : you have to download a form from the Chinese consulate in New York website ( google : chinese consulate notarization ). There should be a form where you have to fill out before getting your documents notarized.

*addition about notarization : you can get your documents notarized at any UPS store. If you do not notarized it, you can't get the visa approval

Once you get a number, be patience before they call your number. Do not expect any smiles or great customer service like any usual U.S customer service. This is asia ftw. People just don't care much. I waited for 45 minutes for a 3 minutes at the counter

*About judistriction : In any way, you can ONLY go to the consulate which have the power over your judistriction. Like in my case, my house in closer to the embassy at D.C, but I still have to go NY consulate since they have the power over the state of pennsylvania.

*Notes : There is no ONE DAY SERVICE. Be advised. The fastest is 2 business days, excluding the day you came in.

Wait was a bit long, but I did go on a Friday when everyone else had the day off, so it was expected. Everyone (except maybe the front door security guards) was very helpful and friendly. I needed extra copies of some paperwork and was able to make them right there because they had a photocopier. 

Just make sure you have all of your materials (check the website, which does have all the information you need) and you'll be fine. Know the hours (they do take a break from 12-1), which are stated on their website. Easy process if you actually do some research before going there.

Suddenly I came to know that none would get the access to the system unless paying to the agents of Embassy. Ultimately I had to contact one guy (there are many)who advertise himself as agent of e-token and he could submitted all 4 applications of my family. Then the process of appointment. My wife's one done in ten day, younger daughter got after 14 days. I got after 1 month 5 days and elder daughter got appointment it after 37 days.
My holiday plan got lost in the Atlantic. My younger daughter and I would not able visit to accompany my other 2 members. There should be some arrangement where the family members should be given appointment together.
The important part that Embassy authority wanted to reduce complications by implementing "e-visa" and to stop illegal act by so called agents. Now the system has become a monoster for those who want to visit India. It should imm be stopped. ....

reviews.text: The only Iraqi phone number provided on the website transfers to a hotel in Baghdad which says that the number was changed 9 months ago. The other numbers given to me by the soldiers at the green zone gates do not work either. I was not allowed in despite having British passport. I wonder how someone would go in if there was an emergency but not being able to contact someone. Their twitter account is useless as they do not respond.

The best of British. I mean it IS like stepping back into Britain. You can relax (the compound walls ar over 2m thick), they are friendly, kind & helpful. I was injured and unlike the soldiers being repatriated, I needed a passport (lost as all my clothing was burned), I needed a replacement passport even though RAF contacts got me a flight. There is the sound of gunfire & explosions all over the city from time to time but the staff were unflappable.
Not the favourite foreign posting for our diplomatic team but I suspect there is a strong patriotic feel. They reminded me all of the latest safety information and one lady asked me to take a bag of personal mail as it's much faster than other routes.
Of course, I hope nobody needs their assistance, but when I did in 2003, I couldn't have asked for more.

We required a Visa to enter Bali in June because we wish to stay longer than the 30 day maximum provided by Visa-on-arrival.
   Firstly, download 1 Application form per Visa required from the Indonesian Embassy. It is reasonably easy to fill in, but make sure that you can tick all of the items in the checklist provided.
  We recommend that you purchase 2 Registered Post envelopes, and include 1 of them as a self-addressed envelope with the other required items.
   Money required must be Bank Cheque or Postal Note. Email the Embassy to find out correct amount.
  We found the service very friendly, helpful and efficient. Turn-around time about a week.
  Thank you to all involved.    Dave Miller.

I just got my US Visa approved. Here's what I can share: 
1. There's no parking. Best to get someone to drop you off or take a taxi. 
2. When you arrive at the front gate, you will see people likely in a queue. The left one is for people registering at the guardhouse. Produce your passport/IC (both if your local) and your appointment confirmation. Once done, proceed to the right queue. Try not to get annoyed, the guards aren't the most friendly. 
3. Once you enter the security room, they will screen your bag. You will need to surrender all electronic items (hand phone, laptop, cables, etc). Proceed to the waiting room. 
4. You will be waiting in the waiting room for a while, at least an hour. There's a TV in there but that's abt it. So bring a book if you'd like to amuse yourself. Also, best to bring a bottle of water along as you'll likely get thirsty. Someone also comes along to sell water and snacks. There's a toilet. 
5. During the interview, there's not much. Just answer the questions honestly and clearly. It's quick and don't need to imagine some sort of interrogation in a room. The whole thing probably lasts 3-5mins at most. 
Hope it helps üòä

I tried to vote for the Spanish elections in 2011 thought the Spanish Embassy in Berlin, but they sent me home the papers too late, like two weeks later, so that I couldn't vote. This disaster happened to thousands of Spanish expats that couldn't vote outside Spain in 2011. Not just because of the embassy, also thanks to a neu measure form the ruling right wing party PP, that introduced just before elections an extra step to do to be able to vote outside Spain: the "Ruego de Voto" (Vote request). This antidemocratic measure is still in force, so that may be many of the spaniards that left Spain due to the crisis, won't be able to vote again in December 2015. The Spanish embassy doesn't inform either about their deadlines.

Deveria haver uma inspe√ß√£o para averiguar o mal atendimento e demora no atendimento do consulado brasileiro em frankfurt .

Prezados  Senhores e Senhoras,
 
Venho atrav√©s desta tornar p√∫blico meu rep√∫dio e insatisfacao com ‚Äûnosso‚Äú Consulado Brasileiro em Frankfurt am Main. Insatisfacao que pelo que pude observar √© de muitas pessoas que sao atendidas nessa instituicao. O que me deixa meio contrariado √© que, como todos sabem, o consulado est√° aqui em nossa regiao pra poder ajudar de alguma forma n√≥s brasileiros que precisamos muito de documentacoes ou mesmo pequenas informacoes pra podermos dar, em muitos casos, os primeiros passos na Alemanha. Vou detalhar apenas algumas coisas que pude observar, j√° que felizmente nao precisei passar muito tempo nesse ‚Äûcirco‚Äú.
 
1 - Quer ir ao Consulado? Entao al√©m de levar seu Passaporte nao esqueca de levar muita paciencia. Vai precisar na hora de obter as informacoes dos confusos  funcionarios.
2 - Observe muito na hora de extrair a senha de chamada. Apesar de o Consulado nesse ponto obter um funcionario simpatico a sua senha pode levar voce ao setor indesejado e voce ter√° que retirar nova senha e aguardar novamente.
3 - Voce tem vergonha que algu√©m saiba de seus problemas? Aqui voce vai passar por um dos seus maiores ‚Äûpapeloes‚Äú, j√° que seus problemas pessoais serao discutidos de forma muito alta e a ‚Äûsala‚Äú inteira vai saber o porque de voc√™ est√° ali. Leve na brincadeira pois isso poder√° acarretar na demora de seu atendimento.
4 - Cuidado! Os funcionarios podem esquecer algum documento necessario e, caso voc√™ more longe, eles nao reembolsarao sua paciencia, tempo e combustivel at√© voltar l√°.
5 - Voc√™ mora longe? Entao saia de preferencia muito cedo de casa. Os mesmos nao costumam te atender caso falte 10 minutos pra encerrar o curto expediente deles. Fora que ser√° mais um motivo pra eles alterarem a voz e voc√™ passar vergonha perante seus conterraneos que estarao ali.
6 - Verifique onde voc√™ mora. Se for longe de Frankfurt vao te mandar em voz alta ir ao consulado mais proximo de voc√™. Caso more proximo de Berlin, Colonia ou Munique v√° l√°. Pior que o de Frankfurt √© dificil de ser e sua documentacao sair√° mais breve.
7 - Tire ferias antes de ir. Se for precisar do consulado provavelmente ter√° que retornar porque os mesmos, como disse antes, sao muito esquecidos e podem precisar de voc√™ no tempo que eles determinarem.
8 - Nao contrarie ou faca muitas perguntas sobre as confusas informacoes que lhes serao dadas. Caso eles se sintem precionados voc√™ poder√° ficar ali falando sozinho e o funcionario bater√° a porta na sua cara. Aconteceu comigo! ;)
9 - Quer matar a saudade da patria amada? Venha pro consulado, lugar que est√° na Alemanha a muito tempo mas os costumes sao ‚Äûnossos‚Äú. Se bem que j√° estamos muito melhores que eles.
10 - Quer falar com a Consulesa? Procure a Dilma(Presidente), ser√° mais facil.
11 - Voc√™ precisar ligar pro Consulado? Procure conhecer alguem de l√° e ligue pro mesmo. O numero do Consulado nao √© atendido e nem retornam liga√ßoes.
 
Enfim, gostaria muito que fosse diferente. Espero que um dia esse consulado aprenda. Hoje gracas a Deus pude obter muito sucesso na terra alema. Mas nesse caso tive que pensar como os alemaes pois se fosse pensar e agir como nossos conterraneos desse √≥rgao ja estaria a anos luz daqui de distancia.
 
Atenciosamente,
 
Adir G√∂tze

reviews.text:
3 days after being notified that my Tier 4 student visa application package was being processed, I stumbled upon these hefty, emotional reviews. The stress steaming from the threads below is contagious and I began thinking that my visa and graduate school in the UK was a lost cause. My application and supporting documents weren't presented in a binder, sheet protectors, with a table of contents, offerings of dark chocolate confections, and a lipstick print for good luck. Was I an unfortunate soul like all else who waited months for a single response?

With my departure in less than 15 days, the visa center told me the application will take that long-if not more- to process. Everyone documenting below how inadequate the consulate didn't help the least bit.

My visa was admitted August 26 and was issued September 1, arrived today September 2. I had sent them exactly what they asked in a USPS next day envelope and that's it! Unless all else had failed to provide expected paperwork, i'm not sure why the consulate has such poor reviews. I would say this was faster than my expedited visa experience with the Chinese consulate two years ago. And they accept anyone.

Absolutely dreadful experience with the consulate. Avoid the consulate and the country all cost if you can!!!! Have your UK resident families/ friends visit you instead in the US. I can't imagine anyone will really want to be in the UK beyond a few days.

Hola!! Primero antes que todo quiero dar las gracias al Seguridad el chico que esta en la puerta, hace un GRAN trabajo!!! pongo gran con mayuscula, porque no para ni un segundo, no se... nunca vi un seguridad que se encargue de  tantos puestos de trabajo y responsabilidades  a la ves...  al principio parece un poco borde jajajaj pero todos tenemos nuestros dias o momentos en que respondemos mejor o peor.  La verdad que se implica un monton en darte soluciones, explicarte y agilizar tramites dentro de sus posibilidades, etc.
Los chicos que atienden el telefono y una chica que me atendio hoy en ventanilla fueron muy amables  en todo momento. 
Tambien tengo que decir que en una semana me hicieron ir y venir 4 veces al consulado, se suponia que estaba  aceptado el tramite, pero a ultimo momento despues de esperar casi hasta las diez de la ma√±ana porque no llegaba el consul, este  dijo que no, sin dar explicacion alguna, solo me recomendaron que vuelva al dia siguiente. Vuelvo, para ver que decia otro consul de los 3 o 4 que me dijeron que hay. Vale  estaba todo ok, pero...me dijeron que  tenia que ser al dia siguiente; al dia siguiente vuelvo y  el que se dedica a completar los pasaportes de emergencias, no fue a trabajar y la respuesta  cuando pregunte:" pero no me lo puede hacer otro ??"   ..." y no... dentras que volver otro dia !!!...jajajame rio ahora pero bue...  al dia siguiente otra ves a las 7 de la ma√±ana en la puerta como cada dia y por fin estaba el que escribia los pasaportes de emergencias que fue muy correcto, pero tenia que retirarlo despues del medio dia y no podia porque tenia que ir a trabajar, lo cual esos dias pedia las horas de las ma√±anas en el trabajo, para poder hacer el pasaporte y bueno.... a volver otra ves al dia siguiente ... en esa semana me gaste:
-  pasaporte emergencia 20e
- es obligatorio tramitar el digital para que te den el otro 165e. 
- dni digital  15e.
- tickets de tren vic/ barcelona 5,60 por 8 viajes total 44,80e.
  Gastos totales 244,80e ....:. LAS TARIFAS DE LOS TRAMITES SON MUY MUY ELEVADAS !!!. ...( y encima tenes que agradecer que te acepten el tramite  jajajaja)
  ahh Mas las horas que tenia que devolver en mi puesto de trabajo por pedir tantas ma√±anas !!!
Por eso pienso que el chico de la puerta hace lo que puede...al menos por  mi experiencia, no dependia  de como le caigas a el, ni si tenia un buen dia o malo, si no de algunos que estan detras de las ventanillas, los cuales creo que son ellos realmente los que no saben tratar con las personas. ... Bueno espero que todo ayude para bien, para mejorar en algunos aspectos, no quiero ofender a nadie pero realmente mas de un dia me fui muy angustiada por la situacion que vivi esos dias, era de no creer...
 Aqui me despido .
                                     Saludos Luana.

reviews.text:
I'm giving 4 stars although I didn't get the visa at the end of the day but let me explain why.
Normal application, not premium.
Applied for a family visit visa, I go to the uk frequently and my last visa had just expired last month, so I was thinking easy.
Day 1: (Monday) 16/5/2016 biometric data taken, purchased the stamps from their website and sent the application same day visa ups next day delivery.
Day 2: (Tuesday) 17/5/2016 received notification from ups that package is delivered and then on the very same day, received an email from the embassy saying my application was received and shall be processed within 15 business days.
Day 9: (Tuesday) 24/5/2016 received an email from the embassy informing me that my case is considered "complex" and wil need more than the standard 15 business days to further 15 days and was asked not to make travel arrangements.
I had already made other travel arrangement so there was no way I could wait that long so reading the reviews I started to panik because I didn't know how to get my passport back! So we called the call center, on the 24th itself and they advised us to request "withdrawal of application" and gave us a form and an email address to send to.
Day 11: (Thursday) 26/5/2016 called the call center because I didn't get any confirmation regarding my email and was reassured that it is definitely received and being processed but takes 3 days atleast to locate the passport. Total cost of phone calls was 40 dollars!
Thankfully, same day I received my application and passport back by the ups service.
I didn't get the visa, but I'm glad I got my passport back when I needed it and I'm glad that they informed me ahead of time that my visa will require time so I didn't have to just wait and wonder and end up missing important trips.
I really appreciate the reviews written here because they really guided me thru what I should do, and that's why I decided a review to pay back a favor and maybe save someone 40$ of Fone calls.
If you require your passport back, you have to send an email to this address:

ukvinewyork.correspondence@fco.gov.uk

Subject:
CANADA/USA/Jamaica WITHDRAW OF VISA APPLICATION GWF xxxxxxxxx

And attach a signed scanned copy of this form 

‚ÄúI hereby withdraw my visa application and understand that the entry
clearance fee is non refundable. I understand that my application will be
shipped back to me and that my package will not leave for up to 72
hours‚Äù. It will take a minimum of 72 hours to locate and link your
withdrawal letter to your application. Your documents will then be returned
to you through your chosen courier.

NAME:
DATE:
GWF:
DATA of birth:
TRACKING NUMBER (label):
SIGNED:

Overall, I am not happy with the lack of transparency over the status of the application. Further, the "priority service" is a joke as it appears that all applications are treated equally and top of that they charge +$200. The VFS third party have no insight over the application processing and typically provide the same information that you are aware of already. Do not even bother trying to contact them via phone, they will charge you an arm and a leg for that option. See below for details of timeline:

Bio-metric: May 2nd
Application sent using UPS (AWB purchased via VFS site): May 2nd ( shipped end of day)
Package received by consulate mail room according to UPS tracker: May 3rd (Next day delivery)
E-mail received from UK consulate stating that package has been received: May 4th 
Visa approval and printed: May 6th
Passport and supporting evidence received: May 9th (I have not yet received my passport, I am hoping that I will receive it by May 10th - otherwise I am not going to be able to travel)
Travel to the UK: May 13th

Can one of you please let me know the most important information? DO WE NEED TO BUY THE HORRIBLY OVERPRICED SHIPPING LABEL FROM VFS? Cant I send thru USPS priority mail and have it shipped back to me by USPS priority mail?

Unlike like many users are stating, I had one of the best experiences applying for the UK visa. 
I sent my application using UPS on Saturday 2 April 2016 around 13:15 
Package got there Monday 4 April 2016
Tuesday 5 April 2016 I got an email from the UK consulate stating that they opened my parcel
Wednesday 13 April 2016 I received an email at 11h08 stating "Your UK visa has been printed"
Thursday 14 April 2016 Passport received at 10h39 
I used the regular processing ( it was super fast, compared to people who paid for priority). I know it says apply 3 months before travelling. I made a mistake and basically applied 4 months before travelling. I realised afterwards that if i cancel my application, all the money I paid will NOT be refunded. I decided to take a chance and just explain that in a cover letter which I  sent with my package.
The documents I included are: the paper application, two 45 millimetres by 35  mm photos ( I paid 70 USD for at a speciality store) but they ended up using the photo from my fingerprint appointment which actually looked cuter ( at least!), a copy of my green card, 6 months bank statements, last 6 pay stubs from my job, a credit card statement , school enrolment verification from my university for current and future classes, a medical travel insurance I purchased from an online agency called Seven Corners ( valid for Schengen Area and United Kingdom that was worth 40$) which I believe it helps in your visa case and shows that you are prepared for the worst, a letter from my HR at work stating that I was granted those days off and I will be returning to work after my holiday, a hotel reservation, a plane ticket itinerary ( But I did NOT purchase the tickets. I stated in my cover letter that I did not want to purchase them before the decision), the receipt from the finger print appointment, my passport, and finally the prepaid package with the label.
My advice, just send as many documents as you can to prove your ties in your country of residence, be open and honest, send it early enough ( 3 months is a good choice although i sent mine 4 months earlier, although don't do that because they might not make an exception for you like they did with me), purchase the return label and print two copies right way, I recommend purchasing a travel health-insurance too. Write a cover letter and explain anything that can be confusing for the visa officer. Write the dates correctly dd/mm/year. Arrange your documents neatly in your envelope. I put mine separately in different see through folders. I believe it makes the visa officer go through it faster if it is neatly arranged.
I wish I could give the UK consulate 10 out of 5. They did a great job and I really want to thank them for their outstanding job. 
I received a 6 month visa and multi-entry. I am so happy and grateful. 
Top marks to the UK consulate in New York.

Wish I can give negative stars. Extremely poor service. Worst consulate service ever. They charge for everything but provide the worst response. The priority service is a total waste as they open the application after 6 working days only. Their telephone customer service only want money but do know have any knowledge about the process or where your application stands. They only give you the information whatever you have received in your mail. If you haven't received any mail customer service also will not give you any information. Please do not use any other courier service other than their paid courier. I had included a prepaid airway bill but they sent a mail four days after granting the visa saying that there was no return service included along with my application. Because of their whole irresponsible staff and worst services I only ended up losing a lot of money and my whole trip had to be dropped. Just a bunch of greedy unfit people.

name: Consulate General of People's Republic of Bangladesh

reviews.text:
Our Embassy in Costa Rica is a complete embarrassment! 
Everyone there is rude including the few Americans that are there.
Visas are given based upon the mood of the examiners! 
I've talked to people should never get one and they do and those that should get a visa don't! 
I have a friend who has a daughter who needs a very serious operation. 
There is a doctor in the US who will do it for free since they can't do it here!
She only needs a 30 day visa!
She has been turned down 2 times!
This is wrong! 
I'm sure no one at the Embassy cares about this site!

I have lived in Costa Rica for 13 years and my experiences at the Embassy have always been, "OK". The lines, like any embassy are long and the wait time for service is long too BUT, it would not be so bad if there were actually people working the whole time at the "Windows" or if the information provided was consistent. I have spent more time sitting in front of an empty service counter watching Animal Planet with no volume than I have seen people working and tending to the often dozen or two people in seated and standing. When it comes to paying for services rendered, the attendant is on cue. If the staff is busy attending to lost and missing passports and the paperwork they must complete on their end, why not hire people to do this so you can have the lines go quicker and probably get more work done on a daily basis. Those on the other side of the window have jobs and places to be as well. Minimum wait time for me has been 4 hours. On one occasion I did meet an amazing woman who helped me get a last minute Passport issued without paying the extra fee. She understood that I live in a remote area that can be cut off from the rest of the country during which was then the rainy season, and could not physically get to the embassy to fulfill the requirements of my then expired temporary Visa. It was a very stressful time as I was trying to get to a family wedding and she understood and sympathized with me. This was really the only time I have seen/experienced the "human touch" at this Embassy. So like I say, it's OK. They do their jobs, smile as needed but most recently when I needed emergency services that the Embassy would have provided (I needed a Rabies shot), I did not bother or waste my time...just knowing what awaited me there, I preferred to go anywhere else. The hassle and attitude was just not worth it in a desperate time.

The guards have a really bad attitude, it's an embassy, not a military base, i parked one day across the street from the bank so a friend could go to the ATM and a guard tells me I can't park there because of the embassy, I told the man my friend was about to come back and the fool said he was going to call the police, last time I checked that is a COSTARICAN street, so you guys worry about what happens within the walls and let us citizens use OUR sidewalks and streets as we wish...
Not like the US Embassy in the Philippines, US Embassy in CR is far more friendly, helpful and accommodating.

Oh and they have a little, cafe which was very convenient, to have a little coffee and snack while waiting for your appointment. Don't worry about the taxi you'll always find one. Just make sure to be there as soon as you can in order to wait in the line outside of the embassy with your confirmation page and passport(and of course all the needed documents). I used a transparent document organizer since I had to check in my bag in the entrance. ( don't forget cash or card for the coffee and snack inside :).

I called several times.  Most of the time I was directed to a non-responsive voicemail.  I am very happy with my service.  I spoke with an operator or some several times with no help.  She gave me a telephone number that was invalid.  I hope that my money would be spent better than the service I got today.
Roses are red, I true love, Money Clothes, Designer, A cute puppy!
Very professional and friendly staff. I was impressed by the speed paperwork is done. Keep up.

name: Embajada de la Rep√∫blica del Salvador

reviews.text:
To start, the website is is not up to date. It doesn't provide any valuable information.  Something as simple as what is required to renew a passport, shouldn't take so much hassle. 
I have been trying to renew my passport, I visited the website, no luck. I tried calling them more than five time, no luck. I even went in person, and I was told that my two previous passports were not valid to renew a passport that I needed my birth certificate. Well guess what, I went back home, came back the same day and I was told that the birth certificate was not valid. What?  Are they serious, it was a the same document  that I was using to make transaction in American soil it was even notarized.  And my people where telling me that it was not a valid document, I replied to them that it was a legal document that I was using outside the consulate. 
Their reply was, sir. One you cross that door you are in Guatemalan land, I laugh so hard because they were damned right about that. The incompetence, the ignorance, the lack of customer service and above all the fact that these ignorants have the chance to serve Guatemalans and do something good in a foreign county and do the complete opposite they feel so entitled and superior to anyone that goes there. 
What a shame. 
Way too much BS, these people don't deserve to be here they need to go back. 
Gosh it makes me sick the fact the the corruption expands so far. They were damned right about the consulate being Guatemalan soil. 
If you go, make sure to take every piece of paper that you have with you so you won't be needing to go back like me. But I guess I'll find out it's true what they say third time is a charm.
Worst experience, it's sad how they treat our own people... if you must go, do not leave until all your questions have been answered even if they ignore you...

THANK YOU to "Esther" at the Belgians Consulate for making our visa process smooth & easy!  We also thank the Belgian people for their hospitality, kindness & support!

Agree with some of the other reviews. The staff seems a little snooty. I tried to receive a service from them, but answering questions such as a simple "yes" or "no" confirmation of whether or not my documents were received, already seems too much to ask. After needing to ask the same questions, over and over, and not receiving an answer, I decided not to use their services. Luckily I had an alternative, in the private sector, where people are held accountable to do their jobs. My experience with this consulate was one of incompetence and inefficiency. I'm not quite sure what they are paid for!
Very efficient and nice service to renew my passport. The lady was very friendly. The man at the reception is maybe a bit cold in his manners!

I wish I could give this place negative stars. Horrible, horrible..Nobody follows up, nobody cares and there is no way to contact anyone. And if you do get in touch (magically) they rush you off the phone and hangup even before you utter another word. And to top it off they made up a lie (confirmed by the Spain Consulate). 

So here is our story....my Godfather needed to get an Italian Visa for a wedding.They already booked the flight, hotels and Tours because thats what they require of you to get a visa. It was hard to even get an appointment but thankfully we did. Everything went smooth and they told him they were mailing him the Visa, two days later they call my Godmother and say there's a problem. They said we can't process your visa until we speak with the Spain consulate, we want to know why they denied your visa application to Spain. 

My Godfather had originally filed a visa for Spain because they are spending a week there then two weeks in Italy fot the wedding. Spain denied his Visa because they said "since the country you are staying in the longest is Italy, they are the ones who must give you a Visa." 

The Italian consulate told us they will have to call and discuss with the Spain consulate. meanwhile his flight is in a week. It has been four days and no word. We called the Spain consulate ourselves and told them everything. They stated they will not call nor speak with the Italian consulate about this issue because there is nothing to discuss. They even told me the Italian consulate was flat out lying. That Spain does not need to give us a Visa because it is known policy that whichever European Union Country you are staying in the longest is the country that has to issue u the Visa. 

We have tried calling the Italian consulate 5x a day after this, no one answers there phone. No voicemail available. We have tried emailing then 5x, no answer. We do not know what to do except cancel the trip altogether and loose alot of money due to flight and already paid reservations.

This is the most ridiculous Consulate Ever. I have been traveling to many countries and never have I encountered such issues.

I live in NY as a legal resident with a green card, with my U.S. citizen wife. We wanted to go to Italy for our honeymoon. I need a visa to go there so we prepared all of the documents. 

Besides the staff being extremely rude, I was told to make another appointment to bring more documents.

The documents that they requested is a flight itinerary from Ukraine to Italy. I tried to explain to the  person that I live in Ukraine, have family and friends there and that we would drive from Ukraine to Italy. But she wanted the specific name of the driver and license plates. I told her I could provide her with the information but since my phone was taken away I did not recall the license plates. No! I was turned away and told to make another appointment! On the sheet of paper that she gave me she checked off bring proof of a flight reservation and added between Ukraine and Italy, I mean the whole point was that we were driving there, SO WHAT FLIGHT RESERVATION. But besides that, the sheet of paper on it has an option to drop off the documents, but NO she crossed that off and said make another appointment. She saw very well when the trip was scheduled for, and knows very well that there won't be appointment in time. 

THIS IS BEYOND RIDICULOUS. I had a flight reservation to Ukraine, one back to NY from Milan, and all of the hotel reservations for the duration of the stay in Italy. They can at least ask you to submit additional documents especially if everything is sufficient except for something petty as that. 

Ohh and she wanted to see a letter form my wife's employer that he okayed the trip for her and that she is allowed to take the reservation. They know that they require you to book everything ahead of time, she saw that thousands has been spent on the trip (good idea to get insurance), why not require additional proof and approve, I mean the name and license plates of the driver could have been provided same day in few minutes, or submitted on a peace of paper the next day or even the same day!

I was in time of my appointment and everyone I dealt with was very friendly. Guard at the front asked me if I have an envelope and copy of envelope. I had 15 minutes until my appointment and I was able to find a copy center near by. The guard took my cell phone and locked it. Tip: Review the necessary documentation needed for the particular service you are seeking before arriving. Also I took my marriage licence and a copy. She took my copy of it because I have different Last name on my passport and on my Green Card.  I didn't have any issues with this. Everything was good.

We Have Had Some Last Minute Urgent Travel of Senior Managers to our Airasca ,Turin & Other Cities in May 2016.

Its good to See that Both Countries are Encouraging Business With Each other.

US citizen here, frequently use their services for passport services for my family. Have had nothing but excellent experiences and service here until the last visit a few weeks back.. Normally the U.S. college kids they employ (probably summer interns) are such a pleasure to deal with. Chat you up, ask how you ended up in Singapore, super friendly and kind. The more seasoned American clerks here are really helpful, prompt, efficient, and clear in communication. Despite not being Caucasian, I have always been treated with respect and dignity. However, the last person I got treated me very poorly and had no kind of courtesy toward me whatsoever. The clerk I had to deal with seemed to be a local Singaporean from what I could tell, though she could be American as well... Anyway, I am familiar enough with the processes and what not, but she was constantly scolding me, speaking in a very curt and short-tempered way, talking to me as if I were a child, and not answering any of my questions in a coherent way. The sad part was, for the 2 people before me (both Caucasians), she gave them compliments and treated them very kind. I felt that because simply I was not a Caucasian, she profiled me and treated me with great disrespect and discourtesy. Now, I know we greatly rely and appreciate Embassy staff for the great service they do for our citizens. However, all people should be treated fairly, there should be no selective treatment based on the color of your skin. I hope this worker gets reprimanded some day for bias, being very rude, and being a very poor communicator. I felt she treated me poorly simply because I was not a Caucasian. I am an American citizen, and deserve the same level of treatment as others.
Looks like a giant castle. The tour they offer once a year is nice. The place is very imposing. Would love to be ambassador here one day.

The worst experience ever!! The Peru consulate in Boston is as unhelpful as a consulate can get. 

They refused to grant me visitor VISA despite my 3 in-person visits and several requests without any solid reason and made no attempt whatsoever to help me... They never pick up the phone or answer the voice mails and consulate general is the last person on earth I would ever want to deal with.

Please note that I was able to get the visitor VISA from another Peru consulate location without any issues and I just got back from Peru without any immigration/VISA issues that Boston consulate kept telling me about to mislead me! They are hurting Peru image and Peru tourism by treating people looking for VISA unfairly. 

Peru consulate in Boston - Please start doing your job and stop giving people hard time for no reason.... This is one of the worst things you can do to damage your own country.
